one_reviews_text: I e spent hours on hours exploring with no hud. Blown away by the graphics and combat. The crafting and companionship with your animal followers. I mean you got coin toss and ace throwing or go frolic in the fields of a tiny narnia. It’s got swords, guns,axes daggers shields and they all serve a purpose just like companions . All with a very ominous story that you learn slowly that keeps you in. So many worlds and a huge map with so many books and crannies maaaan it’s been 3 weeks and im still at only %6 completion. Worth every penny especially when in real life it’s snowing or raining all the time

review_title: Best game available in the Oculus store!
one_reviews_text:
I was first drawn to this game because I have studied Norse mythology in depth in the past. Let me say this game is definitely on point when it comes to Norse lore. 
The graphics are beautiful runs smoothly, the map system and the inventory system are the best on any game I've seen in a long time.

The only downfall I see so far is the long load times. 
Playing with the Quest 2 through virtual desktop.

Side quest are just more quantity and fetch... someone said this is a sort of Skyrim for VR... sorry but no.  MEH lore.
After playing asgard for 3 evenings, on the fourth I'm back playing skyrim another time. I want something new but more deep...!
I want more

On paper the game is 5/5.  Graphics are top notch, it has 50+ hours of gameplay, multiple characters to control, tons of gear to collect and upgrade, cool boss fights, mini-games, animal companions to upgrade, and  incredible sense of scale with sections where you're either tiny or a towering god. In fact, this game makes most other VR games look like $5 mobile games when it comes to scale and content.

Unfortunately, I found myself struggling with the combat system.  It never completely clicked for me.  To make matters worse, I didn't have the time to play the game continuously.  I'd take a week or two break, and come back only to be completely lost.  I eventually swallowed my pride, and about halfway through the story dropped the difficulty to easy and finished the rest of the game.

Despite this, I would still highly recommend this game to everyone.  There is simply nothing like this currently in VR and there is some true WOW moments.  The developers weren't afraid to experiment and from time to time they knock it out of the park.  The Tyr boss fight, for example, is hands down one of the coolest things I've experienced in VR.
Do NOT pause the installation, as it will restart the installation (from the beginning).

Anyway if you love Hack n slash with a decent story this is the game to play hands down. If you want realism-ish / no story play Blades. Def buy this to show fb we want games like this.

A very competent RPG with some really annoying parts. The game looks great, 90% of the gameplay is good, with a lot of puzzles and dungeons that you can go back and explore further when you unlock new companions that will open secrets and different paths. However, the game is littered with annoying, and in my opinion, way to hard even on the easiest difficulty minigames. These are things like extremely drawn out and turret like sections where you have to aim and shoot cannons on invading forces with a terrible control systen where you use two levers to control the cannon and one lever to shoot. At least for me it took 4-5 tries on the easiest difficulty, which takes a few minutes pr attempt. It would have been fine if this was a one time thing, but its not. Also some of the boss encounters just feel cheap, shooting projectiles towards you while you try to shoot them down, rinse and repeat so many times... I found pretty much all these minigame bosses/encounters just a huge waste of time in a game that has some really nice exploring and environments. If i have an hour to play one evening I don't wanna spend 25 minutes of those being very frustrated at some game machanics just to progress the story I want to play.
I've only just started, or I feel so. See alot of other worlds on map. Dunno if they are accessible yet but as it is, I'm absolutely loving this game.

This game is definitely a buy for any one looking for a well made story driven vr game.

Probably the most advanced VR RPG there is. 4.5/5, rounded up to a 5. I spent more time in this game than any other in VR. 

Pros:
The storyline is good, yet it doesn’t take itself so seriously sometimes which adds some fun. The main quest is very entertaining. 
The battle system is quite interesting.
The gameplay is well designed. 
Switching to god mode to solve puzzles was a really nice touch. 
Having animals companions to help you fight and solve puzzles is quite nice

Cons:
I wish there was more exploration in this game, it tends to be a bit too linear for a RPG. 
The side quest are all pretty much the same, so it ends up feeling like grinding for items and money
There are a bit too many battles sometimes, the bows and crossbows are pretty useless because they can’t break armors.
I wish there was less companions with more skills and evolutions.
The last boss difficulty is way too high, yet quite underwhelming. 

Overall an amazing game that I would definitely recommend to anyone who enjoy RPGs

I'm really enjoying the game but again I can't call it 5 stars until it works (even though in my heart I know it is) <3

review_title: I wish there were more games like this
one_reviews_text:
The difference between this game and 95% of everything else currently on VR is astounding. This game is huge. It has complete worlds of environments, that are rich in amazingly detailed and incredible looking assets. Your sidekick NPCs are funny, and the AI for them actually seems to work. There are countless weapons, potions, pickups etc. And I think this is one of the mistakes of the game - there are too many ! The story is pretty linear, but it's still impressive, with Gods bounding over mountains, and riasing mighty tempests. 
Something makes me feel that this game is a little too good, maybe thats why it doesnt seem to appear in the 10 best VR games, seriously I have no idea why. I dont really like or play these types of games normally, but after a year I am still playing it. The worst thing about this game is it shows how bad other VR titles really are, especially where an existing game has had a VR camera added, and nothing else. If only there were more titles like this, Lone Echo, and Alex Half life. 
Now I play mostly driving and flight sims, I am still waiting patiently for another AAA as good as this.

review_title: Took me a little bit to like it, but ...
one_reviews_text:
Took me a little bit to get into this one. When I initially loaded this game up and started to play it after choosing to buy it over a few other titles, I began to regret my decision ... but then I kept playing. This game is a lot of fun.

The combat system took some getting used to. I had to learn how to parry blows and how to look for the blue lightening telling me which blows were especially important to parry. I had to get used to some of the other mechanics as well, but now that I have this is one of the funnest games I have played in VR.

The puzzles are clever, the combat is fun, being a giant or super tiny is AWESOME, characters are engaging - overall this is a well-made, creative game - especially for someone new to VR like me. Highly recommend picking this one up if you like a great RPG.

review_title: Happy I got this for free, but...
one_reviews_text:
I played this when I first got it, and was happy to see that my PC could play it (although laggy in the beginning). However I set it aside and played another VR game, Half Life Alyx, then returned to this game. When I opened it up, everything works fine and peachy until the initial loading screen. It kept loading forever so I assumed it was a corrupted save, and deleted it. Then I tried starting a new game, and everything works fine until the movement options screen, where it just straight up crashes (no crash dialog though). I have a laptop that supports high end games like Cyberpunk 2077. (1660 ti max q design, 10th gen 17, 16 gb ram, nvme for reference) However for some reason, I haven't been able to get it working. I'm suspecting it might've been the new update? I'm hoping the team at Oculus can help me out. I already uninstalled and reinstalled the game just in case there was some corruption, but still no dice.

6/4/21 I went into the crash log files and deleted all the save data plus the saved settings. This fixed it for me. If you're having issues at the 'comfort level' screen, try this.

After 23 years of gaming experience, Asgards Wrath was stunning and felt very fresh and innovative, thank to excellent use of VRs potential. Big thanks to the devs for this game! And please more AAA-VR games like this, I spend 40$ for entertainment of this caliber anyday :)

You enter the temple.  Across the chasm, you see the haunches of metal horses the size of small mountains.  You find your way blocked by the architecture of this stunning and alien world.  Lifting your eyes and hands to the heavens, you see a glowing orb pulsing above.  You reach out and feel your spirit leave your body, soaring to impossible heights.  When you open your eyes, you tower above the ant-like priest whose body you left behind.  Grasping at the golden sphere, a bow of lightning materializes in your hand and you draw a shimmering arrow to take aim.  The horses' legs start swinging like pendulums as you fire golden bolts at glowing bells.  As the melody rings throughout the cavernous expanse, the rooms shifts and opens the way forward.  Releasing the bow, you channel your spirit back into the body and find yourself standing once more, a mortal, in a cathedral built by the gods.  

If you just read that and don't want to play this, I'm not sure what to tell you.

This game confuses me. I really wanted to like this game. A fully featured single-player adventure game that fully embraces VR features and has the budget to back up its ambitions? Sign me up! Except... it just feels half-baked at every corner.

Wow, melee combat that tries to circumvent VR's lack of any real "weight" by implementing a block and parry system to force good positioning? That sounds incredible! Except that you *have* to use the parry system to kill certain enemies on most difficulties, and some attacks have the most bizarre and confusing telegraphs, and the parry system itself sometimes seems to just... not work even when you do make the right motion. All it took was one enemy encounter 1-2 hours in that refused to let me parry it to sap all fun out of this combat system. You can turn the difficulty down to easy (which is weirdly annoying in and of itself as the menu is just a rotating wheel of vague difficulty names with no description, so I had to look them up outside of the game), but then this robs the combat system of all depth, and makes everything die embarassingly fast, even with no upgrades. I could not find a middle ground between painfully easy and painfully boring, all because they built up everything around a parry system that just doesn't work consistently.

The visuals are often great (for a VR title), and there's an incredible amount of variety and detail. It's a shame they pop in and out of low-detail models so frequently, and the game is prone to intermittent stuttering and crashing.

The puzzle-solving is neat, but extra frustrating when you're stuck awkwardly standing in your living room for half an hour.

And the writing and voice acting are just... weirdly bad? No context is given to almost anything and so many lines sound stilted.

I really wish I could see this as the killer app it's hyped up to be. Instead it just feels like a half-baked, unpolished, confused game with a decent budget that really outstays its welcome.
an actual complete videogame

review_title: The combat ruined it for me
one_reviews_text: This is a really great, ambitious, in-depth game, with lots of clever ideas. I was really enjoying it until I got to a certain point where they introduce the idea of 'Runic Armour' - you are completely unable to hurt enemies with this until you perform exactly the right parries & counters it wants you to. I just couldn't get the right cues from the game's chaotic visuals while playing in VR, which is already overwhelming. The use of colour coding probably didn't help, as I'm clour-blind, although I don't want to over-emphaise this. I probably could have adapted & learned the exact sequence I had to do things to allow me to go to the next part of killing the enemy but it just made it frustrating & not fun. Even so, I wouldn't want to tell people not to try the game, especially as many of us got it free. It's a game with very many good points, it's just that in the end the combat ruined my enjoyment. But that might not be the case for you, so I'd urge you to give it a try.

review_title: Very boring combat and really bloated
one_reviews_text:
Theres alot to love here. Its a full on AAA RPG, with many hours of gameplay, perhaps too many hours. But this was just not for me sadly.

For me the game just ran out of steam about 10-12 hours in. After that everything just felt the same. 

The puzzles are insanely easy
The story is just kinda meh, and is a collection of short stories. The final twist is so obvious you have to be a complete idiot if you dont see it coming a mile away. 

Theres A TON of sidequests but many of them are just the same. Upgrade your weapon, upgrade your follower, light 5 torches etc. And again the puzzles in the side areas are just soo easy.

The combat is a big offender, af first it seems amazing, but anyone who has played Until you fall with find this combat REALLY boring. Mostly because you can just flail your arms around, since they dont take the arc of your swing into account. Then to remove the shield of the enemy you have to wait for the blue attack so you can deflect it. I HATED just standing there like and idiot waiting for the AI to do this attack even when i provoke it to happen. The non-shielded enemies pose no threat to you either. When deflecting its also REALLY imprecise and sometimes it works and sometimes not. I turned the difficulty down to easy, and instantly it became more fun since i could just focus on the adventure aspect and forget about the boring combat

The boss fights are the same, just with some different attacks and the blue attacks take even longer to happen.

Theres FAR TOO many varients of crafting materials, it just becomes a chore to gather everything you need, 2 variants would have gotten the job done. 

BUT i think you should play it, since there is a big chance you will like it. This just was not for me sadly.

review_title: An Inspiring Precursor to Future Games
one_reviews_text:
[Main Campaign and Most Side Quests Completed : Played on an Oculus Rift S]
It's rare to see full games built for VR, but that's exactly what Asgard's Wrath is. A fantasy game built around deep lore elements and beautiful worlds. 
Let's talk good notes. First off, the game is straight up beautiful to look at and you can see the time the artists and designers took to make immersive scenery. From intricate character design leaning into the Norse Lore to the detailed backgrounds, you can really feel like you are there. The sound design brought life to the bright tavern and darkness to the dusty barrows. 
Onto the meh. Combat is very middle of the road in AW and its obviously designed to be easy to get good at. Once you get an understanding of any enemies moveset  they stop posing a large threat. Despite this, the combat feels very personal and some enemies can punish being unfocused. The RPG mechanics of the game feel rudimentary. This game is the same level of RPG as GTA V. Once you complete the story line you can just waltz back through and do any quests or challenges you need to.

Onto the negative notes: The boss battles in AW are underwhelming. While its cool to get a whole dedicated bossfight, several of the fight mechanics felt too simple for a "Boss". As other people have mentioned as well, this game is huge and the load times on the Rift S could go up to 5 minutes. Especially having to jump between the hub and any adventure space. My biggest problem though is that there is a lack of features that we take to be commonplace in rpgs. I have a broken side quest that I would abandon or revert a save on to fix in other games. In the menus, it would be great to have a bulk craft feature. Also, this is an exclusive, which due to certain choices by Facebook could mean negative consequences for the player base.
While this game doesn't excel at being an RPG game, it is a great VR RPG game. VR prides itself on the immersiveness, and AW does just that to an amazing degree.

Takes an about 3 hours on a 500Mbps connection to download and then takes an absolute age to install, well, I say install, what I meant was it'll install to about 85% then it'll start again in a continuous loop. Don't waste your money until it's fixed which as this has been going on since December 2019 may be never.

Starting the game was a bit overwhelming with all the options and items etc, but after a couple of hours I was an completely integrated part of this magnificent world and I honestly felt like a bada$$ hero. Please make part 2.

So further to my original review and having played more VR games I would like to add: This is hands down the best VR RPG at the moment and probably the best VR game at the moment. Absolutely brilliant. 

However, to the developers: 
May I suggest moving your game over to steam VR, recent developments on Oculus/Facebook are leaving customers such as myself deeply unhappy. We bought into Oculus as a platform for playing VR games, not for pushing Facebook's social media nonsense. For the time being I will not buy games on Oculus store and my next headset is very unlikely to be Oculus; consequently if you had released this game now or in the future I would not be likely to play it (a huge shame in my opinion).

Original review:
Fantastic graphics, VR-mechanics and gameplay with a fun story. This I think represents the first fully formed VR RPG and I hope to see many games like this in the future.

Another positive is that wilst the game has comfort options it does not force them on you. It allows  you to use free moving and turning with the control-sticks without snapping/teleporting or vignetting. This for me is the most immersive currently and I do not suffer from motion sickness, so this is perfect for me.

OK, the visuals are amazing, The animal companion idea is cool. Soundtrack is decent, and the 'god mode' perspective very neat. But there are so many downsides to this game, I don't understand why so many websites are giving it 9+/10.
I have quite a few minor gripes: The voice acting is quite bad, with maybe one exception. You can't skip the blacksmith's animation, which is just long enough to be annoying. Enemies keep respawing, even after you defeat the area boss and the area has been 'revitalized'. The game takes up 120GB of space, which seems a bit nuts. The Metroidvania mechanic of sending you back to old areas once you unlock a new character/companion ability...well so far it doesn't seem to be used for anything interesting. Crafting is a pain, and grinding for ingredients in a VR game is REALLY annoying.
Two bigger gripes: First, the combat is bad. Very bad. It is monotonous, the enemies are bland, the controls feel clunky, the parry mechanic seems fairly hit or miss, and the runic armour mechanic for enemies is downright obnoxious. I just don't enjoy the combat. Second, instead of creating your own character and building them like in most RPGs, you are forced to play as existing characters. OK, annoying. But the kicker is that just as you've finished upgrading that character and getting used to them, you finish their 'saga' and it's time for a brand new one. I'm on my third, and so far I don't really like any of them.
Maybe this would have been better if they'd leaned more into puzzles and less into combat. But if I hadn't gotten this for free with the Quest 2/Link deal, I'd be asking for a refund.

BTW: Is it possible to give it zero stars?

This is the first negative review I write after having 15 plus vr games bought. Now this game was free to me but still its no excuse, I got a 1080 gtx, and this game just stutters like crazy, it does not matter if I turn everything low, the stutter just wont stop. So I search for this on the internet and I found so many people complaining about the same issue that I cant understand how could this game have a 76% of 5 stars, is either my pc sux or what is going on? Im using a link cable, I tried every solution possible and nothing works. The  idea and style of the game is a great idea but the game just wont run smooth, tried everything, Im really exhausted.

The game seems cool but there are 3 points that to me make it bottom tier instead of the top tier game I expected it to be,

1 - Stuttering
I am on a Ryzen 7 3700 x, 32gb 3600 bdie 16 cl ram, the newest samsung m2...980 or whatever, and an MSI 5700x 8gb.  I can play any game I have at usually ultra, but somtimes high.  This on, no level is playable without some stuttering.  More importantly, its not consistent.  At times I can play on high at 100%, others I cannot.  At times even low is full of stuttering.  If playing on high and the stuttering is bad, dropping to low changes nothing.  I have started running monitoring to see if this related to heat, cores, or some rogue open program...its not.  To me, something is just wrong in how this game handles data. Which leads me to my next issue.

2 - Closing
This game will not close.  Either by using the Oculus menu, or the game menu, exiting this app does not close it...its still running wrath.exe in the background.  In the library screen, quitting also does not close the app.  The only way to stop the app is to end the process in task manager.  To me that is a red flag of a program handling something incorrectly. 

3 - Parrying
Its quite possible this mechanism gets easier, but for me at this point, it's very inconsistent and bothersome. When its working, it makes combat pretty fun, but to often it just does not work.  Against normal attacks, not the ones you cannot parry, I do not swing or hold, I basically push to where the attack is coming from when its coming.  Its hit or miss if this works or not, timed or not.

I see none of these issues on any other game.  Seems to me on at least point 1 and 2, this game has some sort of flaw.  Maybe if you are one of the lucky choosen that got a 16gb card at retail these issues do not affect the gameplay.  I had to pay the same retail cost of a 6800 for a 5700...maybe next year right?

review_title: I really wish I liked this game more
one_reviews_text:
It does a lot right (especially the intro). That said it also does a lot wrong. 

The ability to turn into a god overlooking the map is cool. Unfortunately the character action and puzzle aspects feel lacking. Melee combat feels wafty in many regards. I really wasn't sure if I was parrying correctly or if there was any point to parrying in most cases. The puzzles feel like 70% of the actual gameplay, by which I mean trying to figure out what the game wants you to do leaves you standing scratching your head more often than interacting with different things in different ways. 

Object interaction is another aspect the game feels a bit hit and miss on. Handling objects in the world feels more akin to clicking on something opposed to grabbing it (in contrast to something like Half Life Alyx which handles such things exceptionally).

The story follows a god like entity taking orders from Loki. Little of actual interest seems to happen throughout, you progress through linear levels collecting materials ocasionally taking a side path (to collect more materials) before progressing to another area of much the same design with a different layer of paint.  

As far as graphic fidelity goes this game is probably among the best. VO is well executed but the character writing is bland and uninspired more often than not.

Many seem to compare this to Skyrim, beyond the Nordic themes I'm not so sure I can agree. This game lacks the freedoms Skyrim affords in many senses.
Best game to date without a doubt.

review_title: Janky mess even with twin rtx2080's.
one_reviews_text: There's a good game under here somewhere, but you have to drop the graphics settings to low to see it even with top-end graphics cards.

Originally i bought this game, and after several hours of trying unsucssefully trying to download and install I refunded it. At the same time I was also unable to download Google vr. 
Last night I tried to download Google again and it worked, not changing anything on my PC. 
So I gave this another chance and it worked. And I am glad I did. Played for about 4 hours straight and had a hard time putting it down. Gameplay is fun, and the graphics are really nice. Have to say I like it more than Alyx Half Life. Absoulutely recommend this.

This game is fantastic. The AAA quality really shines through. Level graphics and design, sound design, just the sheer magnitude of the environment. I enjoy my time in the game and look forward to coming back each and every time. 
Things I really love: 
-the followers, man they did such a good job of making if feel natural to toss your followers snacks and food. 
-sound and vibration design: first game where ive noticed they combined both beautifully. When something heavy drops or walk near you, it makes you feel the weight of that creature. 
-Combat- this is a love hate. At first I hated the parry effect, but quickly relized sword fighting is boring without it. You can just swing your arm quickly like in beatsaber and do a million damage with zero effort. Glad they implemented it. 
-Stories and voice acting- top notch. I am genuinely interested in the stories and charachter and each one is unique

Not so good- 
Fighting- while I still enjoy it, it does get a bit repititious. Also due to the ruinic armor it effectivly makes ranged weapons pointless. Also fighting multiple enemies is really just one on one since you cant parry them all at the same time. 

Item management- Not super intuitive. Grabbing stuff on your body is great but for potions and what not I end up having to exit into the menu to access the supplies that way. 

All in all i'm probaly 20-30 hours into the game and only about half way through and this is one of my all time favorite games. Lots of playback with all the challenes an upgrading of gear. I really like it. I hope these Dev's are working on new projects because it's just going to get better from here!

The game is very cool...when it works. Combat was boring at first, but became very fun as the game progressed. The visuals are fantastic. This game has some very strong rpg elements as well. I was really looking forward to completing the game.

However, the game became unplayable, literally.  I got about 5 hours into the game and transported to Asgard to drop off materials and the game froze at this point. Now when I enter the load screen, the game freezes. Every single time. I have tried about 30 times. The game freezes and my headset turns off each time I try to load my data. 

I told Occulus about it, but they pretty much told me "oh well too bad for you". They wanted me to uninstall, start a new game, get 5 hours into the game, and see if the problem happens again. I'm just not going to spend 5 hours doing that. So I am out $40 now, which is fine, I'll survive. I don't think it is unfair though to expect a full price Occulus marketed game to function. $40 is too expensive for a game that is going to black screen and have these kind of issues. Especially a game from Occulus Studios. I hope you see this so you too don't flush $40 down the toilet. I also am now kind of scared to buy other games on Occulus because of this. I have never had any other problems with games from the Occulus store, but this one was the expensive one. I'd be much more forgiving if this happened with a $10 game.

The game is probably the second best VR game of all-time (#1 is HL:Alyx ofc), but I sadly had to give it only 4 stars because the ranged weapons in the game are pretty much useless. If an enemy has a Runic armor (most of 'em has) you can't kill the enemy using only a ranged weapon. U have to break their Runic shield in melee combat and after that you can use your ranged weapon to shoot a couple shots until the enemy dies. Really on that point it's just dumb to change the weapon so you end up killing the enemy fully in melee. Also u can't deal any damage (even on the armor) before u parry an enemy's special attack which means that there's a lot of waiting on enemies' attacks especially when you have to parry them twice or even more times.
On Quest 2 you can't get past the first bar scene because the left controller occulus button or indeed ANY button will not open the ingame menu only the occulus link menu. The game is not playable..

Somehow I got this game for free after purchasing a Quest 2. Anyway, it is by far, one of the best experiences you can have in VR. It is not a tech demo, but a FULL game with amazing graphics and terrific gameplay.
Did not expect much but as an RPG nerd I was very surprised how extensive this game is. Like a PC RPG, an absolute must play for RPG-nerds.

I had a great experience in the beginning of the game over Link. After Playing for a while on high settings it's hard to mantain 90 or even 72hz. I'm on a 3070, a 3070x and 32GB of Ram so I don't think it's related to my hardware.

Also the game sometimes freezes for a little while and it creates a doble vision or jitter effect afterwards. If I put the headset to rest and wake it up, it sometimes fixes itself.

I really wish this game worked because it's a stellar experience.

review_title: The best vr game to release yet.
one_reviews_text: Dont get me wrong hla stormlands and boneworks are all great games, but this is  a game so good that it still would have been extremely positively recieved had it not been a vr game.

I've had my rift S for over a year now and I've played  some fun games and a lot of disappointing ones as well.  This game is by far the greatest VR game i have ever played.  I got absolutely hooked on this game and started putting in 5 hour sessions straight sometimes because i just couldn't put it down.  I just 100% completed it today and I'm actually kind of sad about it because I really want there to be more (This game is very long especially for a VR game so that wasn't at all a hit on the hours you can spend in this game).  This captures all the elements you want and it's clearly built from the ground up for VR which makes a world of difference.  If you own a VR capable computer and a headset you should not waste your money on anything until you buy THIS GAME.
Enjoying this game but no subtitles

I absolutely LOVE the game. It's gorgeous, it's fun (even if it's a bit slow at the beginning and holds your hand too much) and the whole concept and use of VR is just E.P.I.C. 

I have had some technical difficulties - the same install problem some people have mentioned where it installs, finishes and disappears, and then starts over from 0%. Restarting my PC and the Oculus software fixed this, so that was that.

I do get really long loading screens even on a Ryzen 7 3500X w a 2070 Super, followed by a few seconds of a black screen, but honestly, it's a minor issue and doesn't bother me much.

The good 100% outweighs the bad.
I love this game but the excessive gore makes it impossible for my kids to play due to content. Would love to see an option to disable gore and blood. Otherwise, best game I've ever played on VR.
I'm a huge rpg fan. And this is IT..... its so  immersivd that you will forget time. Loads of small details and amazing graphics... please release DLC for this game and keep it going

this game is the best for people who are looking for a VR game that is long and immersive with great graphics!
 the rpg side of this game makes it so great,
the puzzles are great, combat is a little repetitive because most of the mobs have the same moveset but still nice to try around new things.
game is quite long if you're like me and love looking around for hidden things and love being rewarded because of it.
Just started it, but so far it's great. Looking forward to a rich game and story. Will see where it goes.

The game crashed after fighting the Kraken just a few minutes into the game. I've restarted the game, my computer, uninstalled/reinstalled a number of times, and nothing seems to help. "lowlevelfatalerror" It's very common issue if you do a quick internet search, and still no solution.
only game for me that lags  and had constant glitches
yes good do buy playh game,very fun awesome, nice game good combat fun do playu game fun is good

This is the first game in my live that I want to finish with 100% just for fun, may that sentence itself be enough to show how amazing this game is. I beg a secuel.

I don't know if VR is gonna have a bright future, but for now, and thanks to this game, I think it will.

review_title: Stutters a lot for what it is
one_reviews_text:
I find it pretty disapointing on Ryzen 7 3700x and 1080 gtx superclocked from E-VGA , still high rated for it's top MHZ . I have a pretty good PC and it stuttered too much to  play and have fun . Even in the tavern , it's even worst than my micro-stutters I had on SteamVr ... running both portals at the same time for Quest 2 usage. Everything on SteamVr can eat more GPU ressources for us but on Oculus Portal , I never played a game as stuttery as this. 

It's well well made , I like it , I like the concept but unable to have fun stuttering each some frames .... and reducing details etc don't seem to help. Half Life Alyx runs pretty nice on my Ryzen 8 cores but Asgard'S Wrath doesn't seem to use them wisely at all. 

Still like the fact I had this game as a promotion for free but ... It's not optimized at all at my point of view . Could be soooo much stable . Even 32 gb of 3000mhz RAM doesn't do and M.2 SSD doesn't seems to help. Pretty sad but hope it will be adjusted better for Quest 2 and my system .
Just wow!  The game is beautiful, the soundtrack, the story, the companions. (playing on Rift S)

Adding this to the pile of reviews. Cool graphics at first, well made, but the game just isn't fun. Mostly puzzles and they aren't my thing. This isn't an epic RPG like Skyrim. And why is it such a big install?

Wow! After 40 hours of great content I can finally write a review. This game brings a true, full length RPG experience to VR, complete with quests, exploration, crafting, gear, and a good story. Being thrown into Norse mythology, among and against gods, monsters, animal followers, and more was a great experience. It was the first game I consistently was running out of battery on and waiting for my next chance to play. Combat is difficult but difficulty can be changed. Some puzzles were just challenging enough or areas hard enough to solve that it felt like an accomplishment. And the use of VR controls (eating, pulling levels, high diving a follower, tossing potions to someone else, mini games, etc) all added nice immersion. I would recommend this game to anyone wanting a full length VR game.

It has a lot more puzzles then I thought it would, causing you to change forms and followers more then I want to in a game like this. Also, the loading sections are long enough that I actually look for something else to do while I wait. Breaks my game up when I am standing there just waiting on the load to finish.

(*Oculus Support -> You rock!!)

** Update **

After playing through most of the game the first time through the maps... I wish I could get a refund. Seriously disappointed.

Repeating enemies, so once you figure out how the weakness, you carve through them without any effort. Puzzles everywhere!! You cant do anything without going through puzzles, its constant and one after another after another. Buy this game, I hope you love VR puzzles! And you have to constantly switch followers in order to, you guessed it, solve puzzles!!

This game starts out great, I loved every second of it. But as you go through, you are faced with puzzles constantly, and you cant move forward till you solve the puzzles. So play puzzle fighter, or quit playing, there is NO CHOICE. You must play the puzzle games at every turn.

And yes, there are a lot of glitches to go with this game also. Materials fall outside of your reach a lot, so you dont get your loot. You can only carry a limited number of items, like 1 of something, so when three are dropped at one fight... yeah, you dont get your loot. I will be playing and my arm will stretch way out and around, though it was my controler, but then saw a couple NPCs do it for a moment.

*sighs*  A very disappointing game. Too late for a refund, but thats where I am with it, just want my money back. I didnt want a VR puzzle game. Worst game on VR. Terrible controls, limited movement, limited actions... I hate even giving this one star, it doesnt deserve even one star.

DO NOT BUY AT FULL PRICE!!
(Seriously upset I cant get a refund on this junk game.)

And shock, no feedback from the authors of this game. Its junk!!

Its a nice game so far but has issues.
Not enough information on commands/controls leaves you trying to figure out how to do some things. No real way to know how to heal/feed pets with experimenting.
A number of times pet disappears leaving you to reboot the game to get them back. 
But the graphics are well done. The story is OK. I would have liked more learning on norse mythology in a game like this one though.
Overall nice game.

This game clearly exceeded all my expections. Not like so many VR-Games developed simply to be VR, there is a lot of details in this game starting with the character, the envirorment, gameplay and the story line.

If I had to mention one negative point it would that the virtual arms are to close to eachother which sometimes unluckily takes away the VR experience.

But other than that, strongly recommended.

Really impressed by the this game. 

It's a full length action rpg in vr. Controls are good, lots of options.
Boy oh boy what fun will you have in Asgard's Wrath combat is awesome and puzzles too well recommneded for anyone who is looking for a good story and gameplay. BUY IT NOW!!

I've heard such good things about this game and can't wait to play but ive been trying to install it for almost 2 months, i can't help but be annoyed. I will give this a 5 star reviw most likely unless the experience isn't good.

good game but wish it had teleport .and the change in direction when looking at stuff is off putting big time. i can only play 15mins tops. other games i can play for hours not this game and i wish i could. if you dont get motion sickness this is the game.
worked for 3 or 4 hours but allways get stuck on loading screen!  not worth the money!! unplayible - blade and sorcerys pretty much works but this wont even load
This might be an amazing game but how am I suppose to understand what they are saying if there are no subtitles.

I really loved my playthrough of the game. For $39.99 the content is great. The campaign is very long which makes it diverse and enjoyable. The combat system is just epic, each of the 4 different characters have a fun way to fight because they are somewhat different. The graphics are great. Finally, the setting is one of the biggest factors of the game. You get to be in like a rustic yet advanced setting. You have all these advanced weapons but the environment is like in a middle age movie. All in all, I loved it and I hope there will be another part to this.
This game won't let me install it at all.

review_title: loading sceens to long but very fun game
one_reviews_text: it is a very good game it is just irritating that the loading screens are so long and in vr it is terrible
bad

Great game. Playing on the quest2 via virtual desktop and it's one of the best VR games I own. If you were thinking about getting skyrim VR or fallout4 VR, save your 60 dollars and just get this instead.
I love this game, top 3 VR games for me!
I encountered low fps when playing games, but the GPU and CPU usage did not reach 80%
IT looks great
Awesome game...Thanks for giving me such an AAA+++ RPG game.

review_title: Amazing and not only for a VR game
one_reviews_text:
AAA quality VR game. Interesting story and varied gameplay mechanis. Lot's of Wow moments. Hope it sells well and we get similar productions. 

UI is just new standard that more VR games should replicate.

Fighting mechanis are challanging. They requrie some time to get used to it. But after you get proficien in it they offer satisfying encounters and encurage you to level up your gear.

Not an easy game to start with in VR  but after you get to know the world and how it works it offers great value.

You simply can not even begin to understand how amazing this game is. The file size alone was intimidating, but WOW! This is by far the best time I have spent connected to Virtual REality! the amount of detail that they put into this game is unbelievable! It's (in my opinion) one of the closest feelings you'll get to a SOA-type-wonderland! BUY IT! SAY GOODBYE TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY! ENJOY THE MAGICAL WORLD OF THE NORSE GODS! STAY HYDRATED! DON'T LOSE YOUR JOB/SKIP SCHOOL!

Bought this game after looking at all the recommendations and reviews. After the first hour I was really enjoying it except for all the terrible performance. This game is incredibly unoptimized. I'm running a i5-9600k with a RTX 2060 and 16gb of RAM and I get all this a bunch of stuttering. If you look this up you can see other people expierencing this as well. The combat seems cool at the beginning then you realize it's literally a waiting game for the enemy to get mad enough to do his powerful attack and for you to parry it. Your companion is pretty much useless except for the point and click "puzzles". They will also mess up the enemys wind up attack making you restart the parry process. Took me about 4 hours to realize that if this is one of the "best games" VR has to offer then we are in big trouble.
Amazing

First I was surprised to see that game in my library, later I realised that, every quest owner gets it for free when first time they connect to their oculus store via link or VR desktop. This game is amazing! The graphics and everything else plays like a dream, even with my minimum configuration (geforce 970)
And with my rtx3070, it's even better.

From the moment this game started, I was like, "OH YEAH!  This is gonna be GREAT!" The visuals are grand and immersive.  But as the tutorial progressed, I started thinking more and more, "This is like a Disney ride. Cool stuff to see, and they want to make you feel involved, like "Everybody point your wands and shout "Wingardium Leviosah!" and whether you do it or not, the thing the ride operator is pointing at floats to the sky.  You know?  It's this gorgeous, cheesy level of involvement, from parrying the ships thrown at you by the kraken to fighting it, to going to the pub afterward and not really being able to interact with anyone... but it gets better right?  Well, sure... but not that much.  You can turn an animal into your companion, but I think your only option is a shark -- once again the game handholds you into getting what it wants you to get.  From that point on, pretty much every puzzle in the ensuing dungeon is solved by pointing at some corpse in a cage and telling your shark buddy to go jump up and bite it, thereby pulling it down to open some gate or reveal some secret entrance.  Immersed in the gorgeousness though I was, I started getting bored -- and motion sick.  I don't get sick easily in VR, but the movement in this game for some reason has me gobbling Dramamine like M&Ms, and ultimately, it just hasn't been worth it so far.  Does it get way better?  Maybe.  I find myself just not wanting to play anymore to find out.

Watched it get to 100% then just stop. Tried to start the game, but it said it needed to install. I clicked install, and it started back to 0%. I've done this over 5 times (5+ hours of time wasted). The online forms can't help because everyone asks the same problem, but no one has a solution. I expected WAY more from a $40 game. Installation should be the easiest part... No logs to help understand what the problem was and the support is garbage. I'm using windows 10 with over 1.9TB of space available. I shouldn't be running into any issues. No idea how anyone got this downloaded

review_title: Very fun, but takes up a lot of storage
one_reviews_text: Had the same experience as another reviewer. I put this on my wishlist, and then it just magically appeared in my library. I hadn't even bought anything yet(so no one had any payment information from me) and it just appeared in my library. Thank you Loki? But yeah, it's very fun but it's literally over 100gb so make sure you have plenty of room before purchasing.

Upgraded my pc need to know where to put the save files for this particular game.  Oculus customer service was no help at all.  I have 10 hours invested and do not want to lose my progress.  Unlike most games this game keeps it's files in another location can anyone help it can't be that rare to have to do this but I really don't want to start over.

review_title: First Class RPG with 1st Class VR
one_reviews_text:
This game has blown my socks off!
it was one of my 1st purchases, and I don’t regret it at all.
Never mind the VR, the gameplay is fun! At the end of the day, we play games for fun, and this delivers in buckets.
I wish you could rub weapons against each other (and other objects) like Until You Fall... but that is such a minor thing... The game deserves a 9/10 for me. Amazing!

Everytime I stop playing this game, I tell my wife how much I like it. And I really like it: 
1) Nice stories (for the different heroes) and a lot of content.
2) Characters are great. The companions have different personality and talking with the other gods and semi-gods are so much fun.
3) Graphic is definitive AAA. Make sure you have it installed on your SSD.
4) Sounds are perfect and the German localization is excellent.
5) The fights, oh yeah, the fights. Many users complain about it. And it´s really hard to understand and learn how to parry and reply. I needed quite a couple of hours to master it. But now it´s so rewarding. But if you like to hammer the buttons und just slash without thinking you should not buy this game. It will frustrate you, as you can read in all the reviews of users who were not able to learn the fighting style.
6) The game always gives you motivation to continue playing, as with new heroes, new companions, new equipment, new riddles, even with new boss fights in areas you already finished, because they will be populated again.

All in all: If you like RPGs and a challenging (not unfair) fighting style, this game alone would be worth buying a VR headset. Very well done...
This is year 2020, how hard is it to add a language support?

By far, one of the best VR Games you can Play, not as good as Alyx ( but come on, thats nearly impossible right now ) where u can grab everything and stuff. But the Story and the Setting....just insane. I had goosebumbs after the first 30 seconds allready. Runs good on 2070 S on Epic, movement is on point aswell. 

LOAD THE GAME AND FEEL LIKE A GOD!
really horrible process

After playing this game I can safely say that no other VR game is as ambitious as this game.  It has great combat, a compelling story, great visuals and great puzzles in its exploration of norse mythology.  Cons include file size and how long some enemies take to do their signature move so you can parry them.  Worth playing and suppoprting these great Developers.

review_title: One of the best VR games that I played
one_reviews_text: This game is a MUST have. Gorgeous graphics, fantastic game play and awesome story. The amount of effort put in this game is huge. The immersion and the attention to details will have you dive deep and spend hours and hours in this beautiful world.

Not a game review, but oculus really have problems with their installation and they need to fix it. I am already downloading this game for the 3rd time, upon searching through google you will see that this is a common issue and its already 2020 still not fixed wtf, I never encountered this on steam or even epic store.

Im not sure if its due to anti virus etc, but base on reports I saw this may be the cause.

So make sure you have stable internet (a disconnection will restart everything in my experience), turned off windows defender/anti virus before downloading.

I gave the game 4 stars because i had trouble with the install like so many others have had otherwise It would have been a 5.  It would finish the download and then when it would go to install it would tell me my antivirus was blocking it. Long story short I managed to get around that by creating a new directory on another drive and installed it in there. That did the trick for me. 

As for the game play. I haven't had this much fun playing a game since witcher 3..  I own several top teir VR games including Half life Alyx and Lone echo,  Beat Saber and Walking dead..  This game is by far my favorite. 

Especially loved being able to throw my axe around and summon it back like its Thors hammer .. The sword play is fun as heck and atleast for me it feels very immersive.  It's everything I had hoped for in a VR RPG .
