review_title: For those who can't find in library...
one_reviews_text:
Had the same problem. The only place I can launch the game is off Steam VR for some odd reason. The other option is to launch Oculus app on desktop, and not through the headset, and see if it's in library there to launch. 

Hope that helps.
its like they were making a pc game and then halfway through development God of War came out so they changed it for VR to be unique.

Played now the entire main quest . I say this after carefull consideration of what i have played so far , it´s an clear winner in my book .
10/10 Fun i had completing the story
10/10 Followers. Each follower feels usefull in some regard 
10/10 Visuals , game ran smooth as you woud wish for after installing it on my ssd . And i dont neccesary have the best graphic card around for sure .
9/10 Combat. Minor drawback because of first godfight wasn´t my piece of cake , and breaking some enemys rune armor can be exhausting after longer play time.But overall no issues that lessend my fun i had with the game in general .
10/10 Level design. Loved each level and cant wait to get all of the remaining dungeons and riddles done.

Sorry for the long textand the bad english . English isnt my first language but i felt like this game just coudnt get an review in 1 or 2 sentences that gives credit for the amount of fun i had with it so far. Great game

review_title: Best VR game I ever played
one_reviews_text:
This VR game is a must buy game.
And believe me it is worth it.

1) the graphics are so amaizing, they did so much work on it.

2) the combat is really great and the boss battles or the battles against gods are an experience you want to have.

3)the story is well made and there are so many side quests and secrets you can play this game for hours.

4) I played arround 30+ (payed) VR games and this is the best out of all of them.

All I can say is buy it and enjoy :)
Easily one of the best VR title out. So immersive, in-depth and entertaining. Combat took a little white to get used to but is so fun when you get a hang of it.

One of the greatest and the best games on VR so far. It has a huge world and so many contents to play. You can do side-quests, main storyline, craft potions and armors, gamble in the tavern. It's just an amazing game to play in VR. I've felt this level of immersed in few games and this is one of them. It's a must-have.

And plus, thanks to Oculus, they've gifted us this beautiful game.
Shockingly good. I'm blown away with how amazing this title is!

review_title: One of the greatest VR games out there
one_reviews_text: I thought it was a great experience with a nice story length.

People, for the love of Norse Gods, please release this / add support for the Oculus Quest 2, as well!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
i tried downloading it multipl4e times spent 6 hours and it wont download im annoyed i wasted 40 bucks on nothing!

This game offers a great VR RPG Experience that Skyrim VR didn't
This is not just a good game but, This is the game U must play!
I can proudly tell that it's an AAA title

This game is the blue print for the future of vr gaming.  Its still got rough patches, and there is certainly room for improvement but there is no other experience like it currently in vr gaming.  This game makes me excited for the future of vr gaming.

Never normaly write reviews but had to for this game..It is so fun to play, controls are good, visuals are great, i spend 4 hours straight on it last night, love the god mode when you can interact with the enviroment and taking control of warriors and then command them to do stuff. The tavern is very nice, spent a while throwing apple cores and patrons lol... best game out there at the moment

I finished this game (main missions and few side missions) .. 
I'm really amazed with this experience .. This is how VR games are supposed to be .. Full immersed experience with full utilization of VR capabilities .. This is a game that stays in your mind for years to come. 
Graphics are another level .. some of the scenes and places look as good as a hologram .. it was smooth on 2080Ti .. but some crowded scenes had minor chopping (rare, but did happen) .. 
Sound effects and music are beautiful and fits the experience .. 
Nature of quests and difficulty is very balanced and gives you choices .. Example: You can focus on collecting items to upgrade your gear, on just focus on collecting cash then you buy the parts from vendors .. so it fits different styles of play .. If you play easy, then you are OK with main quests .. but if you want more challenge, then you need to do some more side quests to improve your gear faster and be up to the challenge .. 
What I loved the most is the idea of the companion animals .. I believe 10 animals is a bit overkill though .. I think 5 or 6 should've been enough as some of them aren't used as much .. nevertheless, the idea is amazing .. 

I highly recommend this for anybody with Rift/Rift-S and good graphics card .. It's a must-have ..

It‘s a amazing and awesome Game,but my English is not so good for all conversations and Quests.Can you take at least Multilanguage Subtitels in the Game???Please!!!
Edit:After the Multi Language Patch the Game is perfect!!!

review_title: Makes me want to kill myself
one_reviews_text:
This game makes me so frustrated because it is very good in parts, then terrible in others. I am not sure if it because I am using a Quest, but my PC is overpowered, yet this game lags terribly during any big fight with multiple elements making the game completely imbalanced and un fun. My PC has no issues playing ANY other games including Half Life Alyx, which is a much better game. It is unfortunate, but I have to request a refund since the glitches make it impossible to get past the first boss. Very sad, but typical of anything Facebook touches...even under the name Oculus.
Edit: Beware, Oculus knows the game is broken on Quest, which is why they do not allow refunds. These were the last dollars Oculus will get from me, hello Valve.

This game looks great, and the general mechanics are pretty good. I could only last about an hour though, the scripting and voice acting are just atrocious. Not sure if it gets better, but there's just better experiences out there, not worth the 120gb install.
So if you bought an oculus and connect it via oculus link you get this game free as long as you do it before jan 31st 2021

Update Sep 2020: Ultimately, it was a fun game but I've been stuck at a part that I simply can't figure out what I need to do to progress the game.  Really frusterating because I played the game for over forty hours only to not able to finish it because the developers couldn't just give me a little direction to progress the game :/  I enjoyed the game when it was a fun action VR game, when it was a boring chore in simply figuring out what I needed to do next, it wasn't fun at all. 

-----

For me, the game was at first unplayable due to the horriable stuttering and Frame drops but after I updated my drivers that issue was gone.  The game is amazing and so well designed, just make sure that you have a powerful enough computer to handle it!

I took a star off because as amazing as the game is I found myself just constantly getting stuck in the game not knowing where to go next.  Once or twice through the game would have been fine but it seemed like every couple hours I would come across a spot where I just didn't know what I needed to do next to progress the game and it got really annoying.  I really wish the game could have offered some hints if it sensed you were in the same area for more than an hour because it seriously took a lot of the fun out of the game.
Wow, what an experience! It’s the best game ever everything about the game is amazing. I can’t wait for a sequel!!

Quote possibly the most fun I’ve had in any game in years. I wanted to play and finish to the very end. I don’t say that just because it’s VR. The skill based melee combating was especially unique, there are loads of different ways to beat an opponent.  
The very first opening sequence was what VR was made for, my jaw dropped to the floor. 
Criticism is that the in game sequence is quite linear, after the 3rd or so hero it became predictable but still fun. Games are about having fun, and I had fun.
The interface and switching and exchange of weapons was natural, the combat was most enjoyable.  
Puzzles was not too hard, even for me that avoid games with puzzles. 
Graphics jaw dropping, the feathers of the eagle hero was visible. One of the modt beautiful looking games ever, flat screen included and VR word maker it even more real. Being stared at by a statue was so real I had goosebumps!
Sound design, absolutely great.  Sound create atmosphere and can compensate for what is lacking in graphical finesse. 
Replayable ? Yes, in about 12 months from now
Asgard’s Wrath was an exceptional purchase,  I got mote than my money’s worth.  Asgard’s Wrath is fun and a interesting take on Norse mythology. Go buy and play it now!

This game give me one of the most exciting experience I've ever had.
must buy
Is it worth waiting for Russian localization? The game is super, but.. 3 stars because of this
The game is good, a few problems here and there. But I spend hours playing this game and to me it's has my vote.

About 3 hours into the game; and it's...fine. 

The combat is pretty obnoxious, but not entirely terrible (gripe 1 - unless playing on easy, many enemies are invincible until they finally decide to make a special move and you successfully parry it; gripe 2 - your attacks stun enemies, but they'll sometimes recover instantly in order to perform a headbutt that doesn't seem to be parryable). 

The graphics are fine, but slightly on the lower end compared to some other VR titles or even VR ports of games like Fallout or Hellblade.

 The story so far looks like it has potential, but not much has happened yet; only veeeery loosely based on Norse mythology. 

The "hints" from Loki for how to proceed get extrememly annoying if you get stuck or, gods forbid, decide to explore a little to find loot or try one of the many many side objectives it throws as you, as he repeats the same thing every 10 seconds or so.

review_title: This is the single best game ever made
one_reviews_text: In the history of gaming. I stand by my case.

After playing a few small VR games i decided to pick this game up and now i have a hard time putting it down! The game ticks all the boxes(good combat/visuals/interactivity/core mechanics/tracking) and i couldn't be happier with my purchase, and i look forward to new Sanzaru releases in the future.

I really recommend this game. Price is not low at all but it's totaly worth. Please make more games good and long as this one. I found only 1 con and it's bug - AI of followers. Sometimes you need to parry enemy to destroy his armor and your follower interupts him. It's annoying. But graphics are insanely good, fighting mechanics good, story good, level design good, weapons, looting good... We need more good and long games as this one <3 thanks

I just got a powerful computer this month and i got hlvr, boneworks, and this at the beginning. I pushed this on off at the time because I really just wanted to play the other games I got. I had started the game in the middle of my hlvr playthrough and didn't get too far into the game, mostly because it looked so bad. The reason it looked so bad was that I was streaming it to my quest into another room, but I wasn't getting those visual problems with my other games at all. So a month after I got the game I decided to try the game teathered for the first time, I got it set up just to see what it would look like, so I just got a sort of short charging cable for my phone and set up a really small play space. And at that moment I had realized what I had been missing out on. Gosh this game looks and plays so well. I've been playing the game so much recently and I've been enjoying it so my, everytime I meet with my friends I bring up the game and just start drooling about it. I love the combat so much, at first I was really sad that it wasn't like the combat in boneworks, but this 1to1 combat is extremely fun, I'm able to play this game in such a tiny space and its fine, but sometime i'll get too immersed and i'll get close to unplugging the quest. I havent finished the game yet, but i'm at the old man. What has kinda bitten me in the butt is that I really haven't been playing attention to the story too much, I'd say it's good, but I really don't know. But what I do know is that the story is better than boneworks for sure. One part of the game that I find impressive are the lighting effects, the reflections, shadows, and flares just look so good. This game is the game that made me play less flat screen games. If you can paly this game get it, it's a must buy.

review_title: Just popped up in my library one day
one_reviews_text: I don't know how I got this but ill take it.

review_title: Lack of subtitles for deaf people
one_reviews_text: I did reseached and read, they said they worked on subtitles, but it's more than year, and no subtitles at all for this game.

but it isn't triple A for me with only 1 language. where is German language??

update! and now is it triple A... Great !!!

A real must have. I am planning on playing this a few times all the way through.. few games ever hold my attention like that. 

More please! I'd pay good money for this kind of content.
Takes hours to download. Then when I try to install, it restarts download. What crap. About to request refund

review_title: Blown away, only has one glitch so far..
one_reviews_text: This is a stellar blow-you-away kind of game. Phenomenal. I haven’t played anything like it in VR, despite all the great VR content. This whole game package works so well. The only quirk, playing via Oculus Link on a as Quest 2 (both with a cable and with Virtual Desktop), is that the interstitial slides with a blue title and texts do not display in the VR headset but you can see them on the laptop screen. Very strange.
a great example of what vr can do and finally a game thats not just a few hours long
Idk if i got it free forever or just until the end of month?
This is the most deepest VR games I ever play. Combat with initiatives tactics, great puzzles gorgeous graphic. This game is the must!

This game is the best thing I haver ever played, the only downside is bugs(Probably just my headset though,). Playing it messed up my guardian once.

The rest of the bugs are probably from my headset though, Still an amazing game.
playing on a i5 6600 and a 1650 super just a few moments of lag , but still good gaming  action.

It's a fantastic, full game. Full inventory system and much more complexity than I've encountered in most of my VR games to date. Melee combat is excellent with a parry and blocking system. You can craft, play mini-games with a drunken fish creature or throw axes with dwarves back at the inn. It's freaking awesome. It took me a little bit to understand all the controls and systems. I think a lot of that has to do with the bar not being that high in terms of controls and systems in VR games. This is a good look at the future of VR gaming. I can't wait for other developers to catch up and make more games like this!

review_title: Deeply Immersive, and Hours of Fun
one_reviews_text: Many of the VR games I own I really enjoy, and think of as amazing games, but often there is only so much playtime before a VR game gets boring, whether it is an arcade game without enough variability, or a really short story mode game that once you complete once you never return to. However, Asgard's Wrath is different. I have already played for about 3 hours and I feel like I've only just begun a story filled with lots of mesmerizing scenes and satisfying combat. I expect to play through this entire game, which with the amount I use VR daily, will likely take over an entire month. If you are looking for a game which is both beautifully crafted, and one which will last you quite a while without getting boring, this game is for you.

if i compare this with elders scrolls is 1 or 2 stars... thew game is super slow and very very directed like only can follow one path.
the graphics are good and the game play is good. 
but the general slowness make it boring.

Wether you love RPG or hate them, love vr or hate it, love video games or no just play it.  just play it because you will love it so much. it's increadable well put together with awesome mechanics and graphics story line characters. everything is so good in this game simply buy it.

There is no inbetween in this game, game either looks decent but runs terribly, 
Or looks terrible but has a better fps
If you put graphics tp anything less than epic(even high) game will look like ps1 era game.

I cant even refund this game, coz prologue was intentionally long, and everytime game would crash i would have to start again

This is my first vr game. I gave it a 2 star review ( at first ) because part way through I had some sort of glitch and had to re-start the game . I am not very good with computers . I realized it was my fault - not the game. This is excatly the game I wanted ! Absolutely must have ! Easily one of the greatest games of ALL time.

My textures would load all blurry, and then flicker to normal textures, but only for a second, then back to blurry textures for a couple minutes. I also couldnt parry, because it wasnt a very great combat system. The worst part: They wont give me a refund on an expensive game that literally doesnt work on my computer.

A brilliantly executed foray into the role playing genre, Asgards Wrath is superb. Other titles should aspire to its magnificence. Highly recommended, and one of the few titles truly worthy of 5 stars. 

Longer review to come... must play more first!

In the first minutes from the game you need to speak with a guy and cheer a pint with him. Is impossible to get the pint from the table to cheer and the game wont go further if you dont do that .... so ... a little bug there i believe
Too heavy, graphics on quest 2... a little meh, and repetitive.

Cant say good enough about this game . First game in a long time that I can say you get more for what you pay for . Lone Echo was first , this is much better . I forgot how many hours I played already and im not finished . Graphics are great , so many options to chose , places to go , go forward and come back to finished the task later and stuff like that . Sometime is hard to find the way to get some things but you leave it and come back later when you figure it out . The only thing i wish is that i can find a guide , but i guess that is why you play longer . 
You have to get this game , its worth every penny and more .

Good:
- Style is good, envoroments and characters feel right.
- Sounds, voices and music are good qiality.
- Fighting is not easy, you need to master it.
- Switching between god and character mode is fun!

Bad
- Loading times! Even on a very powerfull rig...
- Some dialog is just cringeworthy! Like a child instead of a grown up character.
- Installation needs special adjustments and no other game needed this.
- Might not be fair now, but I just finished Alyx before this and the interaction of items and the world seems off sometimes.

Will continue to play, its fun and the style/world makes dealing with the bad worth it.
THIS IS THE ONE GAME WHERE IT JUST DOES NOT WORK

This is a little help guid for the people that DO NOT know how to fix the so called anti-virus
Step 1. Open the search bar at the bottom left of your screen (on windows)
Step 2. Type "add" 
Step 3. Click or press the button "enter" on your keyboard or whatever your using
Step 4. Once your in the "Add or remove programs"  Scroll down to oculus
Step 5. The oculus may look like a setup but it's not
Step 5 1/2. Click oculus and press "Modify"
Step 6. The oculus download thingy should pop up then press "Repair" now you wait and you should be all ready to download when the repair is over!
Im glad i pick this game very immersive,interesting puzzle to figure out plenty to do if you do not rush the story such as dungeons and side quest  it is must buy for people who love rpg's

review_title: Not at all what I thought it would be
one_reviews_text:
This game is sick!

very good scenery, and a really awesome idea for a VR game in general. The concept is very interesting.

the fighting is the best I've seen in VR so far. Not too easy, and not too hard to get the hang of either. The graphics are pretty awesome for a VR title as well. Having a ton of fun with this.
you saw it ... very nice

Not only does this have an insane amount of content for a VR game, there are a lot of fine details that make it really fun. Some examples:
-You can hold your weapons with a reverse grip
-You can catch enemy arrows/bolts/axes out of the air and put them in your inventory or throw them back
-You can scrape arrows off your shield with your weapon
-You can manually climb a ladder or rope with both hands or fast travel
-You can fast travel up and down stairs/ramps
-You can shoot birds out of the sky with projectiles
-You can do torch challenges while in god mode
-You can harvest items in god mode
-You can throw your weapon into an enemy, run up to them and grab it and continue swinging
-You can give a thumbs up to your companions and high five them
-You can play catch with your companions
-Your companions' expressions change depending on how much they like you
-Your companions react if your swing at them
-You can pick up the faeries at Yggdrasil
-You can smack Tyr across the head with a bottle
-You can throw apples at Aesir (or anyone else)
-You can eat pretty much anything
-You can slash plants to harvest them
-You can optionally pull corks off potions before drinking them

RPG mechanics and customisation in this game as you progress is awesome, great to see a full fledged game like this in VR, i haven't even scratched the surface of this game, so far i have 4 of the companions and i am having an absolute blast!  Worth every penny, well done Oculus Studios! 

Make sure you run this on a SSD, HDD will stutter like hell. I had to move the files around and after that textures popped in before the scenes were ready. This is what causes stutter as the game seems to load things on demand.

Looking forward to more games that are like this with similar levels of depth and personality

When I saw a trailer for this game, it convinced me to try VR. I bought a Quest and a cable that's link compatible. When I tried this game, it was so buggy and stuttery that it was almost unplayable. I have a good system, so there's no reason for it to run this poorly when other demading games play well. The level design is okay, but the combat is also a sore spot for me. The number of times I went to parry and it didn't register was a little ridiculous. The breaking point was the boss battle with Tyr at the end of chapter one. It was having a horrible time registering that I was pulling the bow, so it just fundamentally didn't work. I don't know if these issues were an issue with the Quest, but the fact that no other game I have played had these issues is a pretty good indicator to me it's not the quest. I tried so hard to enjoy this game because it should be for me, and apparently it's for many people given the sales figures and the reviews, but it was just a mess that seemed not fully developed. I wasn't expecting Elder Scrolls 6 or anything, but I was expecting a game that worked. Very disapponted it didn't click for me because I knew this was the one. I'm giving it 2 stars because it's not the worst, but it wasn't too playable for me.
i andlenty hit the hard one and now i cant get pass level 1

review_title: A lot to love here, but not the combat
one_reviews_text:
Pros:
-Excellent graphics, sound, voice acting
-Solid VR implementation (with 1 exception in cons)
-TONS of content
-Feels like a real AAA game
-Lots of puzzles, secrets, and exploration if you enjoy those
-Great selection of options and customization features

Neutral
-Nice selection of different followers, but they aren't very helpful apart from puzzles
-Nice selection of different heroes, but at the same time limits how much you can customize any given one
-Upgrading things can get pretty grindy

Cons
-Using items in combat doesn't pause/slow time (minor complaint)
-Some crashes (minor complaint because the game does a great job autosaving)
-The combat is either ridiculously easy with no challenge at all (Normal mode) or extremely tedious and unimmersive due to runic (invincibility) armor.  This is the only major complaint, but as over half the game is about combat, its a huge negative and really ruined much/most of my enjoyment of an otherwise fantastic game.  First off, normal difficulty offers no challenge at all.  None.  Zero.  The other two difficulty modes add what feels like purely artificial/contrived challenge by making certain enemies mostly invincible until you wait for them to do certain moves and then parry those.  Once you get the hang of it (or just wiggle around certain weapons really fast) it doesn't add any real challenge, it is just boring and tedious.  The rest of the game is so amazing, but its hard to get past what could be considered the single most important feature (combat) being so lackluster.

How are there so many good reviews of this?  This only looks like a good advert for VR until you play it and find its definitely not. I wasted my £30. Just jumped in expecting something exceptional after reading reviews. Jeez what were they playing before they played this and found it so goodThis game reminds me of a text only RPG but this time with decent visuals Every time you start the game you have to hold your hands out to calibrate your controllers. Why! Other games don’t ask for this. Every time !!!

The fight tutorials at the start are so frustrating. You have to watch a “how to”  demo first then you get the chance to try. If you fail the attempt it resets and you have to sit through the demo again! You cant skip. You must pass the tutorial. Why?! What a frustrating pain in the ... The animation of some of the characters is meh
The game look good as long as you don’t go up to anything to touch it or try interacting. There’s nothing to touch unless its on the storyline and you need to interact with it.
The interaction with the level furniture or props is non existent. Like when you grasp at something and your hand just passes through it or when you have your sword and shield in hand and expect them to clash when you strike them together but they don’t. Simple details for a decent developer
Floor textures are flat with the odd tuft of grass poking up through the flat surface
When you walk to the edge of a drop your character just stops and slightly hovers over the edge like there is some invisible barrier. You cant walk off a surface and drop down to a platform or even your own death for being so stupid.  Meh! 
Your standing at the bottom of a flight of stairs.  Glide up or teleport up. Thats it no animation or different sound effect. Standin at the bottom of a ladder you can only teleport to the top. How crap is that in a premium game

just came back to oculus after selling the original rift.
now have the rift s and must say very nice, playing this game opened my eyes
to vr again fantastic game and wow factor.
running on a gtx 1060 superb performance outstanding graphicts.
glad to be back in vr land more games like this should be made.

This game is everything you want in VR, Awesome graphics, Awesome atmosphere, seriously the best oculus exclusive to date, I have been blown away how detailed this game is and how much hard work must have gone in to bring us such a glorious VR game. Thank you to the Devs for making this game it’s such a bright light in dark times.

Even after reading the great reviews from the industry I wasn't prepared for how cool this game is.  I recommend not watching gameplay videos (you can and should read the reviews) so you can be surprised by the opening scene as well as "other" game mechanics.  Stunning graphics, fun, and all but one or two spots the mechanics are great.  This is not a tech demo or partially implemented VR add on.  It's a full fledged adventure, on par or surpassing most "standard" games.

The support from the developers and distributors is the best I have seen in all my years playing games.  I had an issue and looked for help on-line, couldn't find much.  I headed to their Discord channel and everyone responded immediately and thoroughly.  Other developers should take this as a model.   Thanks Evan and Mike!

This game is amazing, I put this up there with Alex as far as gameplay. I would give more stars if was possible. Only issue I had was installing the game. I am barely into the game but can't t wait to get back to it. Alot of fun. Developers did a fantastic job all around. This is a must have for VR.

Ok I make the effort to write in english for you!
Thank you for the update! We finaly have full french voices and texts!
I understand that it's a huge work to record all voices in different languages, but I think that, for a VR game and experience, it's an obligation.
Thank you again, of course you derserve 5/5 stars!!

Lets start with the good. Well made, beautiful environments fun puzzles, and fun RPG mechanics. Great game, if it wasn't plagued a single thing that just screws it all up

The story, is there. Unless you're a massive Nordic mythology buff, its meh at best. Personally not my thing, but I knew this going in, so no minus points for this. I was hoping for good gameplay, which bring me to the big crux that takes this game down.

The combat, oh dear god, the combat. I've not seen such horrible combat since the Nintendo Wii, and god some of those were bad. How bad? Just wiggle. And I can hear you think: "Well I don't have to wiggle, I can just pretend to have a normal sword and strike normally for full immersion." Yeah, no playing the game properly is such a clear worse strategy and you get punished for it with its "Wait to be attacked" mechanics. 
Just attack? Nope he has a helmet and no other armor, so he's immune to attacks so you have to wait for him to do a specific attack so you can parry it.  And of course parry doesn't always connect properly. You also have a helper, but unless you're sporting a specific potion, he is pretty much useless in combat.

Now why does this merit 1 star? Because over half of the game consists of combat, any fun and immersion is consistently and constantly broken by combat. Meaning that every time you are getting immersed and enjoying the game you will immediately be taken out of it by the horrible broken combat.

TLDR; Reasonable game, but combat breaks it massively
Outstanding game.  This really is a must buy.  Very high quality.

Took three shots to install. What ever you do pausing the download will cause it to fail. 
The game is very pretty, only stutters in a few places but the load times take a long time. Perhaps some eye candy would help on the load screens. 
I have only played for a couple of hours, its a fun game and combat so far is nice.
This is not a Skyrim game, it wouldnt be fair to compare the two. I have over 1700 hours in Skyrim. I dont see this game being as long playing at all.
Its very scripted and not an open world.

We will see as I progress if I feel the same. 

4 stars due to the install issues. 3 stars because it has crashed, said it was due to a rendering error.

Update: I really wanted to like this game. It was beautiful at first but eating up half my hard drive space on one game is just too much.  It just couldnt keep my attention.  When I needed space I uninstalled this game without even thinking about it. Lesson learned..

I'm not one for Norse mythology, but...
After playing just one hour of this game, I already like it.  To say much attention has been given to detail is an understatement.  It does take a little getting used to the controls and gameplay, but so far so good.  With what I've read of other reviews, I figure there's much MUCH more to learn about and do in this game.  There also seems to be a loooong laundry list of achievements, which should keep anyone occupied for a while.
If I were to put a rating on this experience so far, its right up there with the likes of Lone Echo, Robo Recall, Gunheart and Stormland (all great AAA titles).  The polish on THIS title take the visuals to a WHOLE OTHER LEVEL and are very beautiful, from what I've seen so far.
Transitioning to god-mode was a great experience and I hope I'm not wrong in saying that this title is the first to offer 2 perspectives in a single game while maintaining interaction with the environment/characters.

**** UPDATE ****
Now several hours into the game and having gotten the hang of it, I AM HOOKED.  This game keeps me coming back... and I like that I can take my time to FULLY explore every nook and cranny, which is rewarding on so many levels.  Add to all this that there are also a plethora of side quests to keep things interesting.
You guys have a gem on your hands and I'm glad I took the plunge to find out for myself what EVERYONE was raving about.
**** End Update ****

VERY WELL DONE team Sanzaru!! This title is worth far more than what it is listed for.  I hope this is the start of more quality titles like this.  Keep it up... and great fortune.

review_title: Best VR game I have ever played!
one_reviews_text: Where do i start with this game? The graphics are stunning for a VR game, the gameplay mechanics are top of the line, so far the story, from I have played (about 3 to 4 hours) has been amazing and action packed. This is litteraly hands down, the best VR game I have ever played. This game needs to win an award or something because the Devs did a hell of a job on this game. Props to the devs for making an amazing game.

Although it is far from close to being true to norsk mythology or Asatru, it's a awesome and pretty much epic experience. Combat has a good flow , the visuals are really good and the gameplay uses most of what VR has to offer. Basicly this is for Oculus what Half Life Alyx is for Valve.
Fatal error!
Rated as mature 17+ Should be 17 and under . Goofy dialog written for a younger audience.
The game doesnt get 5 star because the game stopped the download 2 times at 99 percent and I had to restart

This is a fully fledged RPG with a serious Skyrim style. The graphics are fantastic and the game is well optimized. The story is pretty great so far and I'm really enjoying it. Some things can feel a little clunky or confusing at some points, but the game does explain most things very well, but it doesn't really hold your hand all the way through. 

There are some very cool ideas that they implemented here and they work great in VR. The dialogue can be a bit cheesy at times, but it's no big deal. Really cool story, really cool ideas, and some of the best graphics I've seen in VR. 

This game is WELL worth your buy if you enjoy things like crafting, searching the world for materials, sword play, and a cool story with godly mythology behind it. 8.5/10 for me.

I haven't played this game for very long, but I'm loving it.

I'm so hooked on this game. Amazing story and mechanisms for fighting and weaponry. Be aware that if you're not use to the VR it will give you motion sickness but for me it's worth the few times I gotta puke.
This game really surprised me. I didn't expect it to be so amazing. It has great graphics and very fun gsme mechanics . This game is a must buy
Great game. All it needs now is towns, villages and cities, with friendly NPCs.  That would bring it up to the same level as other games like Skyrim VR.

By far the most thorough and complete gaming experience I've had in VR. Great combat, great Metroidvania exploration and secrets to uncover when you backtrack later. Each character plays differently and they're all interesting. Highly recommend.

review_title: Bought the game and can't play it
one_reviews_text: I have repaired my oculus app, turned off the antivirus, and put in on another drive this is my second time trying to buy and dowload the game. I had already bought it once just to have the same problem and this is terrible I will request a refund and never get this game again.

I really wish I liked this game more. After a few hours I just got bored of the combat. I wish I had asked for a refund before I passed the time limit. If you ever played the infinity Blade mobile games, you have a feeling for the counter based combat that feels like you’re waiting around for the right animation to do damage.
I would love to rate this game higher however I am unable to install the game. After a lot of research, this is happening to a lot of people and there is no real path to get resolving it.
spent days trying to download this game only for it to lag every step i take and the loading screens are longer than anything i have played before.

review_title: My favorite VR game so far after HL Alyx
one_reviews_text: Simply a great game and a must have for any VR player who likes RPGs.
Game seems a bit over rated. Graphics dont seem to load properly and it just seems clunky to play.  Massive load times and a messy stucture. Maybe worth buying on sale.

sorry can't give much details since this is the 3rd time I've tried to write a review but the dumb oculus app straight up cancels if you click anywhere outside the small text area, so forgive typos,  I dare not look up correct spelling.   This game is a real dissapointment so far.   Interactions are very very shallow and graphics seems so dated.   I recently played the new half-life alyx and was amazed,  then I took up lone echo which had been sitting in my library for awhile and that was great as well.   This was supposed to be a great game it even got great reviews.   But seriously?  So far about 2 hours in I'm bored to tears and super unimpressed.     I had more fun with wilson's heart which is also not a great game.  My recommendation is to wait for this to be on sale, if you really want to try.  If you've played lone echo or half life you will be kinda pissed how poor this game is.
Just amazing! The size of the game for a VR title, the creativity of the different worlds, and the stunning scenery to name just a few things.

I played this game alot now and i still have no words to describe how good it is. 1. AMAZING grapics
2. AMAZING combat
3. Amazing battle animals. I call them pets/warriors/combat buddies

It is a good game ! I mean there is good work that was done. 
The immersion is great. The bosses' combats are pretty epic and it is beautiful, there is a wow effect and the decors in general are pretty nice. 
Now the thing is that I spent more time resolving puzzles than anything else actually + the puzzles are pretty easy so not very interesting. the combats can be intense but unfortunately it is always the same thing and becomes a bit boring (except with the bosses). Also the game can be finished almost without upgrading any equipement, the menu of the blackmith is not pushed enough. 
To conlude, it is a good VR game but if it wasn't a VR I'm not sure I would have bought it.
took a little bit learing the game but thats only because its so in depth and amazing. This is one of the most fully flushed out REAL RGP's in the VR market. Definitly one of my favorite game to date

Hey! Guess what? I finally got it to download and install (no thanks to anyone from Oculus or devs), I bought this game twice and twice I had to request a refund because it just didn't download. Hours, days spent trying and retrying and always errors. Well, in light of the quarantine in my area and with extra time on my hands, I decided to give it another try (3 months after last try). And, wow, it downloaded 1st try and in about 2 hours! I don't know why, since I have the exact same system I had in Decenber, but who cares. Now it works, and it looks fantastic. Have only played an hour or so, but so far, it's the best VR RPG I've played on Oculus Rift S.

After watching the reviews on youtube I was somewhat skeptical because of the high marks given to this title.  After playing it...WOW! This is incredible and the reviews didn't do it justice.  I have never enjoyed a game more and probably nerver will again.  I am sure I will buy anything this company puts out in the future, highly recomended.  Well worth the price, you're in for a treat!  Please make more!

Playing this game was amazing and the graphics were beautiful. It felt like I was in a trues fantasy world. Had a problem with crashing often which mostly fixed when I turned everything on low, unfortunately. I was able to look past it though because going around and chopping down foes was extremely fun. Wrath mode provides a true challenge but became easier as I learned more about abilities and potions/elixirs. Overall a memory I won't forget anytime soon.
good game

It’s intuitive, long, fun, the graphics are amazing, stays close with Norse mythology. The story line is long and interesting. The fightings style in very cool, with lots of enemies, weapons, and fighting styles. Having a quickly accessible inventory and quick travel map makes it easy to navigate, and switch between weapons, potions, etc.




My only problem was the download. I downloaded this large game 5 different times, and my internet is garbage so it would take at least 9 hours for each download. I ended up getting it to work after turning off the Microsoft antivirus protection and turning off the real time sensor, and repairing oculus. BUT IT WAS WORTH THE WAIT.

This game has nothing to offer.  It's extremely linear, terrible voice acting, basic fuzzy graphics, pathetic story, garbage combat, and awful UI and menus.
You can do very little in the game that is not scripted and you are guided along all the time by Loki.  It's like a assortment of boring mini games with the same old puzzles repeated over and over.  I think the only way this has got a high rating is because everyone is starved for VR games and they will give any old rubbish 5 stars.
Not worth the money, not worth your time.

RTX2080ti
AMD 2990WX

fatal error

EDIT: still crashes at THE BEGINNING dialogue
EDIT: since last update I can get past the beginning dialog, but something crashes and I only hear the story continue, no image in the occulus
EDIT: still....
EDIT: still....!
EDIT: works now, thanks!

Although at times i wished for a few fights that were more realistic sword combat, the design of the fights is quite masterful, in my opinion the first fully flushed out campaign experience besides maybe lone echo. It feels like a full AAA game that was made for vr and was what i needed.
When you first start this game you will have no idea what you are doing but then you start to get the hang of it and its pretty cool and really fun to binge.

I’ve not even played an hour and I’m hooked on the game. Only reason I’ve not done more is because I purchased it about 930pm and needed to get up at 4am for work. I do think that there should be a run or locomotion move to make the character move quicker. And when “cutscenes” are on that you can freely look around would be nice. Other than that it’s a 5* from me :)
The price tag on this is a steal, it’s easily one of the best games that VR has to offer to date. It takes up a lot of disk space, but worth every gigabyte.

review_title: my peak VR gaming experience so far
one_reviews_text:
caveat:  I have always loved PC gaming, but I have always been pretty bad at it; in that, Asgard's Wrath is no exception -- I've been playing avidly for a couple of weeks and I'm still only 20% through it.  BUT... boy, do I love it.  I played (BADLY) WOW off and on for years, and this one could really be evolved (with great ease) into VR WOW.  I STOPPED playing WOW because it was just ultimately so repetitious -- just doing everything over and over again, but as a 100 instead of as a 90, etc....  SO I actually LIKE that AW has an "end" to it (almost as much as I like that I am still nowhere NEAR that end!).  I never thought I would ever quest and farm crafting mats again, but I am doing all of that and more with gusto in AW.  The combat (which I still suck at) is hella fun, and the puzzle challenges and novel "games within a game" are all very inventive and fun, just as WOW is at its best (or WAS, anyway... dunno these days!).  I'm loving the companions with their special skills.  Loving "God Mode," where you tower 100 feet above the landscape you've been traversing and can make some moves you cannot manage "on the ground."  (This aspect is somewhat reminiscent of Moss.)  The game is very intricate and well thought out, and... well sword and sorcery RPG has always been my milieu, and this one is a total triumph so far.  (Kind of like what that Skyrim port MIGHT have been, maybe, if that had not been such a lame port.  This is no port, it's VR from the ground up, and it is truly mega-enhancing my covid confinement!)  I've played, and enjoyed, about 10-20 VR games over the past 18 months, and this one is the winner so far -- it's brilliantly conceived and executed, and it's LONG (esPECially if you suck, but even otherwise, at least comparatively).  

And a final note for my fellow bad players: AW death is quite gentle and painless.  No corpse runs, and any mats you expended in your losing fight are refunded upon revival.   So jump right in and fear not!

I hate to say such a thing about a game that has had so much effort put into it but it is hard to compliment an unplayable mess. while playing, I encountered several MAJOR issues, most being with the game's performance. the loading screens are On average (I kind you not, I timed it) 9 minutes and 34 seconds long, and given that you have to travel back and forth from midgard to asgard fairly regularly for upgrades and quests, this can be kind of grateing. But what I can ABSOLUTELY NOT UNDERSTAND, is that despite the fact I have a fairly beefy PC, that I have it running on the lowest graphical settings for EVERYTHING, that I have supersampleing at the optimal settings, that I have all other background tasks and apps closed, AND that my drivers are up to date... I can only squeeze 10 fps out of this game... IF I'M LUCKY. the game freezes every other step I take. I cant swing my arms, move, or turn my head without causeing it to freeze for a few seconds. Naturally, battles are vituably unwinnable bevause of this, especially in the pink spirit trials. I often find myself just holding down the joystick, frozen in place, hoping to dodge, and suddenly being shown my corpse. As it turns out, movment is important in a first person melee, and statues are an easy target. But the villiage is BY FAR the worst. in a game where the enemys are capable of landing devastating lethal blows that need to be dodged at a moments notice, and are INVINCIBLE, until a percision parry is landed, frame rate is...well... KIND OF IMPORTANT. not to mention, that each of these (extremely numerous) deaths are then followed by ANOTHER LOADING SCREEN (although these ones are only about 2/3 as long as the original ones) Even in reletivly simple environments like loki's training arena, I get only 30 fps MAX, AND IT STILL FREEZES. I've looked up tutorials for this, and followed them all, with only minimal improvements. I would love to love this game, but until these MAJOR ISUUES are fixed... I can't...

Played this game for about 10+ hours. I have been through three boss fights and three stages. Its linear but open. The combat is absolutely attrocious(air tickle fest). There is no feedback on any part of combat(besides throwing axes which feels kinda cool but not there). There is no weight to any of the weapons you use in this game. Absolutely no physics. RPG mechanics are tedious and boring( Im an avid RPG fan since BG1) There was one fight where I felt cool, besides the opening. The story is boring. The follower mechanic is tedious and boring to me. I get that its so you HAVE to use all of your followers, but its just tedious. Being able to thumbs up your follower and them noticing and replying is very cool. Or the fist bumping. All in all this game has/had a lot of potential. The graphics are good if your pc can handle it. I would most definitely wait for a sale on this game. It just wasnt worth the 40 bucks. 20 bucks? Yes! If you want a real fun RPG for VR dont look here. I was had by all the 5 star reviews that get pushed to the top. I dont know if they get paid or they just arent gamers. I take reviews here with a grain of salt unless someone states theyv e been gaming for a long time. Most are just casuals who have never witnessed masterpieces. Im giving 3 stars for trying something somewhat ambitious and cool graphics. Other than that look elsewhere.

Stunning visual game and great gameplay. I just can't take more than 20 minutes at a time. The walking controls cause me a lot of motion sickness. I wish this game had a teleport option, because the developers did a fantastic job. :-(
I have been playing this game for weeks and it just doesn't seem to end so much fun and action packed really keeps you busy! Good job this game is amazing!

Specs: i5 9600k RTX 2060 6GB

I preordered the game with high hopes of leading to an amazing gameplay. But all I've had for the couple of days is the game closing itself randomly because I open Oculus Dash or the loading screen finishes whatever it was doing. The loading screen takes me 10minutes to finish, I started the game at 11:28 and entered midgard and I'm still waiting to get in and it's  11:39am now. I downloaded the game on my HDD drive so it would he faster but it always take ages to load. And even when I do make it, it crashes itself from time to time. I'm not sure even waiting to preordering this thing was a good idea to begin with.

Update: I managed to reinstall the whole game again during the COVID:19 event and it runs waayy smoother than before; i can progress further in the game and enjoy all of the features/graphics that the game offer. A 10/10 for me.

Moss is great.  Lone Echo is ground breaking with the zero g and the loneliness of space.  Stormland is visually captivating.  But this title is so unique and special for an RPG.  The content is deep.

I wish I could play this on high graphics settings, but even the basic game challenges my computer to keep up.  16gb and a Ryzen 5 are just not enough.  Despite my reverting to the lowest graphics settings, this is certainly still the best looking VR game I have yet played.  Beautiful and engaging.  I often buy these premium games and just let them sit without playing them, but this one is drawing me in.  But if this really has 25 hours of content, then I will probably never get around to finishing Lone Echo.  So there is a downside.

I got 40 hours in and- this is an all out spectacle. High quality through and through. Great set pieces. Fun companion system. Fun writing and imaginitive world.

Don't get people complaining about the combat- they are used to Blade&Sorcery or something, this is not that, this is Mike Tyson's Punchout or Infinity Blade. Or that Fight til You Die game. Why complain that Zelda isn't like Mario? The fighting is challenging enough while being fair. 

Is the game perfect? No- but what it has is miles ahead of most other VR games. Truly a masterpiece. Now only if it ran better on my high end PC. It stutters even on low. But whatevs- 

Hey devs, what specs did you all test this on? What is the ideal machine to run this on High settings at 1.00 resolution?

After people play HL Alyx and say, "there are no more AAA games to play now!" Yes there is- it's Asgard's Wrath.

review_title: Better Graphics AND stop game crashing..
one_reviews_text:
test this out, it switches TAA off and the picture is more crispy! 

Asguard's Wrath how to turn off temporal AA?

Edit2: This post could be useful to fix this, I'm still working on it https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1313703067

Edit3: Okay I found sound setting that made a big difference. If you can make it even better let me know.

Navigate to C:\Users[your username]\AppData\Local\WrathGame\Saved\Config\WindowsNoEditor\GameUserSettings.ini

Add this to the engine.ini file

    [SystemSettings]

    r.DefaultFeature.AntiAliasing=2

    r.TemporalAACurrentFrameWeight=0.2

    r.TemporalAASamples=16

    r.TemporalAASharpness=1.0

    r.Tonemapper.Sharpen=1.5

and this to scalibility.ini

    [PostProcessQuality@3]

    r.DefaultFeature.AntiAliasing=2

and in the gameusersettings.ini

    sg.PostProcessQuality=3

seems to make the taa a lot less blurry with these settings.

Edit: You can also try r.TemporalAASharpness=2.0 r.Tonemapper.Sharpen=2.0 to make it even sharper, and it seems to exponentially get better with more supersampling. On the rift you can use the oculus debug tool to do this.
*******************************************
have  fun, it takes 5 minutes and it looks even better!


FOR USER WHO WILL CRASH AT STARTUP!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
Set your swapfile to (for example) double ram value and set min/max value to the same value. For me, the game always crashes in tavern (asgard). I have 16gb RAM and when I set swapfile to 32gb fix. the game runs fine! I am lucky to found this tip before trying to refund the great game!
************************************************************

Haven't finiahed the game yet, but so far wow!!! Everything about the game is outstanding. I will recmommend this game to all my friends! Only thing I wish someone would do is change the way you hold the shied. I'm in no way a shield expert by any means, but it would feel more immersive if the position of the shied was more toward the arm and not just the hand. The only VR game that I know does a great job with a shield is In Death, using the shield felt great! only thing messing was the sowrd lmao.

After downloading (which takes a staggering 20 hours!) I can't install the app. I recieve a notification "Sorry, ik looks like you antivirus software blacked the installation of Asgard's Wrath. Visit Oculus Support to get help". In the end I removed all antivirus software from my PC, but still the same issue after re-downloading the game (3rd time... can't even turn off my PC in between because then the download restarts...). I would really love to play the game, but this installation procedure just sucks!
Not sure if the game-devs can do something about this, or whether it's an occulus issue though.

EDIT:
After several attempts I've managed to fix the issue. It's either due to switching my installation location to my SSD instead of HD, or because of some genious called DonSeita who posted an obscure solution here: https://www.reddit.com/r/oculus/comments/ehqsdd/asgards_wrath_not_installing/ (I executed those commands during download, and didn't need to restart my PC afterwards. I was afraid the download had to start all over again...)
Hope it will help others too!

ps. not going to update my review, even though the first chapter of the game works fine, just because this awful first installation experience!

Oculus sucks at delivering software...this is the third game I have bought from oculus for pc and the third to not work.  Have tried to download 7 times and each time it fails to install with no explanation. I have over 500gb free space on my drive so space is not an issue. I have purchased 6 games from steam without incident, I wish this was not an oculus exclusive.

Ok i still think this game is poorly optimised, BUT, a recent dicovery gave me a HUGE boost, i disabled nvidia geforce experience overlay..This reportedly causes serious performance issues on other games as well.. I am still going to give the game a 3 star because, companions are irrelevant in fighting on high difficulties, mant things to craft but they are maybe relevant in the highest difficulty so if you play on normal difficulty crafting and side quests become irrelevant..And playing high difficulty is not fun because of the stupid timing of the blue attack, add it the constant respawning of enemies and you hardly have energy to proceed in a huge game like this

Phew finished the game at last, Last boss fight !??!?! what a joke, even the first encounter is better and some several in between..I have played a lot of Vr games, what i found out that semi scripted encounters and fight + exploring is the way to go .. i did not like the fighting at all, collusions etc...What i enjoyed the most are some boss fight, there tons of items and crafting but it throws to you so much that you just say "meh" at the end

review_title: Amazing experience from start to end!
one_reviews_text: This game is so well done.  You'll see people talking about AAA game studios making immersive games like Skyrim VR that they charge $60 and can't even make it VR interactive.  This game was built for VR from the ground up.  It's got a great story, great combat, cool visuals, and lots to do.  It could be easily sold for $60, at $40 its a great bargain.  Scr. ew games like HL Alyx where they only give you 3 weapons total.  This game has at least 3 per hero.

Weapon feedback could be better.  A bit more like Blade and Sorcery with some feedback that I hit something.
------
Okay after some months pause, upgrading my PC to a 3700X (with 32GB RAM, Vega 64) the game performance is still bad to average. I also asked a friend who has a RTX2080 TI watercooled, same problems. You can't even play on high without getting for instance blurry hands while moving them fast.. everything feels like you drunk too much, so back to mid settings. 
The battle system is just the same over and over, block no.. maybe smart hitting and outplaying the enemy noo.. you have to parry .. hit them.. parry hit them.. parry, hit and so on.. 
I really try to love this game and I gave them time to fix the issues but after 6 months the game is still far from polished. Everything feels like forced and not loved.. there are VR games where I play 2-3 hours a session and forget to eat.. but this game I want to quit after 30 minutes.. 
The game has great potential but its not loved and don't expect updates from the devs which will improve the game.. 
I'm disappointed.. and somehow I will force me to finish the story at least.

review_title: I dont get where the hype is from
one_reviews_text:
The game is mediocre at best and i tried to like it.

Ill give the reasons why the game didnt work for me.

tl;dr: Loading is long enough to alt tab and watch youtube and when its done its laggy the first time you meet anything cause it hasnt been loaded correctly. 
Combat goes from Interesting to tedious before you even really get into the game. Throwing accuracy feels off. Allies get in the way. Tutorials are given after you are forced to learn it yourself. Parry hardly works.

First of all the tutorials not showing you how to dodge until you are a few hours in is just weird. The time between tutorials is odd as i started trying out things because the game wouldnt give me a tutorial. When i suddenly did get a tutorial (Ally boost elixer) it felt too late.

The swordfighting is amusing for a short while, then you realize that parry'ing hardly works. When you stand too close to an enemy and try to parry them you might accidentally hit them causing you to miss your parry. 
If you can do anything with your screen white half the time cause they just spam 
 knockback at you.

At first i thought ill time it better, but nope. now your chugging potions waiting for their rage to kick up again enough so you can attempt to remove their armor. And when you do you are so bored of all the waiting you just wristflick your sword to get the enemy down.

If you choose a melee ally, i only got 3 when i decided to drop the game, they get in the way preventing you from seeing the enemy casting their blue heavy attack cause they're blue all the time cause your ally just keeps mashing into them.

Now you missed it and have to wait again for it to charge up.

Its unfortunate cause the story seems as if it might become interesting, i just cba to continue because of the mechanics of the game.

my set up ran asgard's wrath very decent on release.  Made it probably halfway through the campain.  Just started now and I'm getting way more stutters and overall a bad experience even on low settings.   I cannot reccomend this game in its current condition.

review_title: BEST VR GAME OUT SO FAR
one_reviews_text:
WHY DOES THE GAME NEED 133 GIGS FOR AN UPDATE????  CAN U PLEASE FIX THAT? EVERY TIME YOU HAVE AN UPDATE I HAVE TO MOVE ALL MY GAMES  FIX IT PLEASE!!!!!!!

The reviews are REAL this game is THE BEST you wont regret buying it, graphics,content,mechanics #1 YOU WONT be able to put this game down..

BUY IT PLAY IT    LOVE IT

Love the story and the gameplay. Thanks a lot for the French version, helps a lot to get in the game and the story. Really great sensation. Would love to have the same kind of experience in the Greeks mythology.
Why do I keep having to go through the same training after I lose to a boss, can you just let me skip this after Ive done it once...... uggggggggggggggh

Screen freeze after some minutes of playtime.
Oculus Quest + Link
RTX2060Super

review_title: Not Amazing on Low or Even Medium PCs
one_reviews_text: On anything except a $1500 PC this game will look and run like trash. I have a $900 PC with a 3gb GTX 1060 and I face load times from 3 to 10 minutes on my measly 220gb SSD that I had to spend 3 hours trying to get this massive game onto, and once it finally loads the textures of this game are extremely lazily compressed to make everything look like absolute trash since the standard textures dont fit into my RAM. I found myself getting constantly confused at what to do in game mainly because of these horrible textures and lack of immersion. In combat the general premice of how it works is fine, but i found myself constantly accidentally grabbing weapons when reaching in the quick menu for heals, and every blue-colored attack varies wayy to much at how soon they will hit you, so some attacks might be pretty good to try to parry and others you will only have time to flick your wrist a tiny bit and thus not parrying it, immediately getting hit for all your health. Progression is fine and weapons are for the most part pretty fun to use the times I actually hit 90 FPS.
Very Good

review_title: One of the many people who can't install
one_reviews_text: I did everything i found in the Internet about the problems to install this game and at 100% it says i should contact oculus support. I was trying to install the game at least 10 times. Comon guys, that is a bit unprofessional!

This game actually has ruined many VR titles for me. I think all the positive reviews are from people who didn’t finish it or just really wanted to love it. 
What made me really hate this game is that puzzles became a chore, and since some really amazing games in VR are just puzzle games the association of puzzles from this experience has soured others for me.  


The world they created is beautiful and I really wanted to go out and explore it. 
However they filled it with puzzles.


The combat isn’t rewarding, so no character progression (killing enemies doesn’t level up your character or anything). The only way to level up is collecting drops to your inventory is filled then returning to the game hub to store them. Eventually you’ll have enough materials for the recipe to upgrade to the next level. 

The options for difficulty in this game are basically too easy or boring. 
In boring some enemies are invulnerable, shielded by a barrier that only breaks if the enemy decides to do their one move that allows you to parry. In some cases they just spam unblockable attacks on the spot (not even targeted at you) while you're just standing off to the side waiting for them to snap out of it. 
Easy doesn’t have shields so just run up and hit them really fast. Your followers are supposed to help but they don’t really.

The puzzles are not rewarding. Something in the game has an icon for one of your followers so you switch to that follower and select that something. For example there is a follower that only exists to get things behind bars, so for some areas there are little rooms behind bars that have a key you need to progress.

There's tons of missions that have no point. I went about collecting all these seeds for this massive world tree and nothing happened. Not even so far as a voice line. You complete all the missions for the black smith and at the end there is just a text that says no more missions available.

So much potential in this game. What happened?
One of the best VR games at the moment.
Amazing gameplay and story! Definitely my current favorite VR game.

review_title: A great VR game with tons of content
one_reviews_text: This is a drop dead beatiful game. After you are done with the main storyline there are many side quests. I am a fan of the combat mechanics and love that you always have a variety of sidekicks to choose from.

review_title: This is what VR needs most!
one_reviews_text:
I'm just about three hours in, but I can already tell its an amazing game! ... on any platform content is king and VR is no different. And although I really like games like Beatsaber and Superhot, I like games with a proper story, exploration, character interactions, scale, immersion and beautiful visuals (& sounds) the most (and there haven't been that many games or experiences that accomplishes that). In my view the developer has done an amazing job and hope this is just the beginning (for we need plenty more games that make VR shine ;-). In short: killer game or system seller!

(edit: after round 50+ hours gameplay I can honestly say this is one of the best VR experiences I've ever had... tons of exploration, lots of side quests, gorgeous graphics/textures and also music, decent story progression, nice mix of puzzles, combat and exploration, or just enjoying the amazing environments, and I could go on and on... everything just breathes triple A... many praises and love for the developers and I hope they are allowed to make an even better and bigger sequel! ... best game of 2019 (and perhaps of all VR-times) ... many thanks! )
The game looked really good and was fun when it ran smooth but the loading screen and lag really ruin it.

UPDATE:
Looks like wasn't enough space on ssd, so now i have succesfully install the game on hdd
In my opinion, you shoud have at least 260 gb free for full install  first try
Old Story:
I Had 175 GB on my ssd, full download and when i checked the game, it says install I press the button many times with nothing happened.I restart the oculus and try again and nothing happened. Finnaly it start download again......wait, what?????Wtf
I already download the game.
I check my drive C and the sapce used was gone.
Now i have to download another 24 hours
I hope this time is working because i changed the drive
I will try more times even if this time wont work because i really want to play this game.
I see a lot of people like this game and they succeed installing the game
If i cannot install it, i wil request a refund 
I hope is not oculus software's fault

Take blade and sorcery for example. This game is poor made arcade sword shaking at best. There is no feed back from it with super broken hitboxes and parrys. This is a massive waste of time for the price it is asking. Super dissapointed i cant give this crap back.
its one of the best vr rpg's ive ever seen

This is a really good game. It's got a lot of content and is good value for the money. I spent 44 hours and I had several epic moments in this game. The ending was especially good. However, it has a lot of repetitive gameplay. The runic armor combat system was nice at first, but then towards the second half of the game, it becomes a total slog to go through several enemies in a row with several chunks of runic armor that you have whittle away at. Some of the puzzles are really good, but most of them are just too simple and a few are just annoying as hell, especially those that require quick & precise throwing aim.

I enjoyed the majority of this game. It's good overall, but just falls short of being great. For every epic moment, I also had one where I felt very frustrated, especially when dealing with some of the bugs in the game (errors). For me it's just a 4/5 star game, not GOTY material. 

You can view my full review here: https://youtu.be/htXTlLcEpFQ

Ok so apart from the hella long download it is a great game. However I know that oculus is mainly responsible but it is 132gb so yeah. The story is satisfying and combat is better than most but not the best. Overall if you have the money definitely buy this.

review_title: Game over for right handend persons
one_reviews_text:
Why? Because in one of the last levels you have to play an avatar, who shoots projectiles with his left hand and there is no way to change this. To open a specific gate, you have to shoot floating orbs in a small time window. Problem is: You have to charge your weapon, anticipate the direction of the chaotic movement and aim correctly - what seems imossible to me, since I am right handed and can´t aim precise and fast with my left hand...
The game was "5 stars" great until I reached this point, now it is just a pain and not solvable for me.

I have a nice gaming pc that will run all other vr games perfectly, but for some reason the bows in this game never work. They always bug out and I can never change the dirextion of the arrow once i have pulled back the sting. This makes it so I can not defeat the god of war, witch limits me to the first section of the game. Other than that the game is amazing
i would like to recomend this game but i am on my 3rd download of it.  It takes 45 mins to download on a high speed connection.  Then it wont install and has to be downloaded again

I'm a die-hard RPG gamer, and have always wished I could jump into a game and experience it as if it was real. Well, this is as close as it gets! I am blown away by the amount of detail that went into this game. Visually, it's absolutely beautiful. I spend way too much time just admiring the views. It's so close to being visually real that sometimes I get fooled into thinking I can smell some things! And, the encounters with creatures and monsters are no joke! The combat mechanics are spot on. Worth twice the price, IMO. Great job!

I’ve seen console games not look as good as this! I can’t wait to see what Sanzaru has to offer next now that they are funded by Facebook! I do wish that this game being as big as it is would give you items for your oculus home so you could show off. At least when you do something impressive like collect all of the Devine artifacts or do all of the ancients quests.

review_title: One of the most overrated VR games
one_reviews_text: My biggest complaints are its gameplay and story, which is the most important to craft a good game. With the gameplay i encountered game breaking bugs during combat in which when i would equip a weapon in the inventory menu and then re-enter combat the game would only render one of the lenses and begin to stutter and then crash (even with a  high end pc).  As a result when leaving the inventory menu you are unable to equip an weapon to defend yourself with out the game crashingThe combat features a hot menu bar which is useless  as you can't move and navigate the bar to select what you want during combat. There is also a god button that's never used in combat and i wish you could re-map the x and y button to a favorites buttons like health potion and full health potion so you wouldn't have to pause the game every 10 seconds to heal yourself. No ebb and flow to the gameplay. Game has poor optimization. Even on a 9900x @4.7 ghz 2080ti hybrid on an m2 with 32 gb ram if would see dropped frames all the settings were on medium. I then tested and found out the shadow setting was the culprit i could have all the settings on low and shadows on medium and i would get dropped frames which means the game is poorly coded. Technical issues and gameplay aside the story wasn't good either and very minimal. I found the looting tedious and game to be very linear in upgrades that were available. Didn't feel like a true rpg no reall skill or ability tree or decision in it its narrative. I experienced about 40 or so crashes during my 50 hour play through which is atrocious. Good sense of scale and excellent music couldn't save it, felt like a mobile game converted to vr.

review_title: One of the best VR games ever
one_reviews_text: I am playing this after having played Half Life : Alyx and this game still feels fantastic. I have been wanting a great RPG experience in VR and this definitely scratches that itch.
a bit too hard on mortal and left arm lags
This game looks cool; I even got it to play for 10 minutes once.  It crashes constantly, however, on every single load screen.  No other game I have ever does this.   Unplayable.

After initial troubles with the install, now I can finally play the game. It is a very well done VR game with tons of variety. There is a lot to be admire. Good single player story game for the VR. You can feel the amount of work that has been put in that game.

I've replayed the boat scene intro four times now, because everytime I to the the lampreys the game would stop detecting my left controller. Always my left, and every time. I never had any issues in any other game, and I tried playing other games both right before and right after the issue cropped up in this one. I replaced my battery, took my battery out and put it back in multiple times. Eventually, it just worked. I don't know why, but I managed to get through that intro. Will this problem happen again? No idea because I didn't get to find out. When I oet to the next loading screen and the game froze. So I shut the game off, boot it back up, happily select the auto generated save file so I don't have to do that intro again, and I load into a new area. I push the menu button to see if there is a menu, and the game freezes again. Quit the game again, and go through the same process. I boot it up, open the save file, and this time I don't even get a loading screen. Just eternal darkness and silence. I might try and reinstall it, but it's an almost 80gb game that took 3 days to install because Oculus has a terrible downloader for games and more importantly, I'm just frustrated at having to deal with problem after problem.

EDIT: Reinstalled the game. It fixed the issue. Nice game. Unfortunately, due to some issues unrelated to the game, I had reinstall yet again. On my third attempt at installing the game, (the first two times it outright failed about 20gbs in) It got everything downloaded, it was done, only for the download to fail after it was complete. I have no idea why, and at this point I seriously couldn't care less. I'm not going to figure out why, I've wasted far too much of my life on this game and after I finish this review I intend to never think about it again.

And sorry, I'm a little in love with Astrid (not spoiling who she is hah).

This is a beautifully crafted RPG. It is linear, at least so far, I'm four hours in. 

You have two perspectives, mortal and god, and I have to say the latter node really illustrates the fidelity of the game's visual crafting. Most VR games I've tried have been lighter weight in graphics compared to something like Assassin's Creed Odyssey. This one is not. Your companions can be examined closely and they're just beautifully modelled, textured and animated. And, tbf really engaging. 

Combat is solid, works well even with my old oculus setup with two sensors a bit ranomdly placed. Sword, sword and shield, dual wield swords are all possible. And throwing axes doesn't get old so far. 

The inventory seems misleading if you can't equip an item - you merely have to grab your item and exit the inventory. 

If you like rpg at all, or have no idea if you would, this is well worth it. 

There is a fairly decent and varied puzzle element to it and you'll need your companion's help. Also, these guys pull their weight far more than most companions I've met in other games. 

The team should be proud of how well realised their creation is. Its going to be a while before I see something quite as engaging character wise as this. And, as I mentioned, I've not see anything in VR games that is as graphically compelling - though I guess it will become the norm soon enough. 

Niggles - the only one that I notice at all, related as much to my old oculus rig and somewhat causual placement of the sensors. On the whole this game does a very good job of spatial placement, such that I end up not realising I'm no longer facing the front!  However pouches can sometimes be a bit finicky but that's been my only niggle. 

I'm sorry, I wanted to present an honest review but can't pick any real faults lol.

Game style: linear RPG with puzzles, companions and a good combat setup, visually compelling and with companions that wonderfully

I've only played about an hour of this game, and so far it's very very good. The reason I'm reviewing now is to counter some other really stupid reviews I've seen here. I run a 2070 Super rig, and I run the game on high settings on a CV1 with only the occasional small stutter. It's a huge game with incredible graphics, it runs really smooth. 

That being said, the recommended GPU is a 1080 or equivalent. If you are complaining about "lag" and you are running a 1070 you're an idiot. I've seen multiple people here comment that, you have less than the recommended specs. what do you expect? One guy complained it didnt run well on his 970, I mean come on dude that isn't even good for VR period.
