This game is by far the most visually stunning VR game out there. It has a skyrim vibe to it and is one hell of a game. Buy it you wont regret it.

review_title: Still hour left for refund limit
one_reviews_text:
I got still the other hour left for refund limit. Did read other 2 star reviews and did realise that this is not the game that I was expecting by the 5 star reviews. Not going to need the other hour I stop suffering with this game for this... Had no perfonmance issus with my old man's medium- rig. Had issue with the game - just felt no reason to continue with this. Just finisshed HL Alyx the other far over rated title, but Alyx is still in diffrent good games universe than this one. Next Lone Echo...

Oculus refund is hard as Epic Games at it worst. Can not find Purchase History page ( there is My Orders page, but no refunds in there ). Created ticket asking refund. After sending ticket got info that ticket systems is moved to other place!

Now recomending to avoid oculus shop totally and recomending to use steam as you shop and skip this crap.

...running low on budget. The further you progress the more obvious it becomes. It's like a lot more was initially planned than we see. Chests are not quite rewarding, wasting a key to get a potion? Exploration is mostly worth it to only see new incredibly beautiful locations. Boss fights become shorter instead of the opposite, it's like epicness is slowly deflating with story progressing.
Difficulty is poorly balanced. On medium difficulty you have to break the armor in order to kill your opponents, but on easy it's like the easiest of all easy?
"I can't carry anymore" - is the most popular line you will hear in game.
Lacks feedback on weapon hit not only in battle but also with crates. You just wiggle through it and can't say for sure if it's a bug or a feature.
Auto equip is annoying. I want to use Siri' rocket fist, but instead I am grabbing a sword on my hip which I didn't even equip. In other words, there was not enough testing and analyzing in development of gameplay

Overall, I am fascinated. Last time I felt this way was when I was a kid playing 16-bit adventure rpgs. And I am genuinely surprised by the abscence of encountered bugs. I have PC AAA+ PTSD, you know, when you pay for expensive hardware, preorder a hyped game, and realize that you actually paid to be a beta-tester... You have to wait 2 years after release for a bugfest to become a game. And, my traumatic experience led me to a conclusion, that with vr games it will be even worse, since the audience is much much smaller(or maybe faster fixes instead because of how demanding this small audience is). But since it's single player, bugs won't be as infuriating. So I bought it and bugs were already fixed. It seems like Oculus considers itself as a gaming platform, like Playstation or Nintendo. It might be that exclusives put their reputation at stake, so Oculus exclusives are likely to become playable sooner(around few months?) after release than flat PC games. Can't be 100% sure, but we'll see.

review_title: The best VR game I have ever played.
one_reviews_text:
This is it, this game is just a masterpiece. I don't understand why I only found out about it now. I am really missing words to describe it. Let me give it a try... It is like God of War with a slight touch of Elder Scrols. The music, animation, controls, and menues everthing is just extrmely well balanced and smooth. review_title: A Symphony of Love and Passion
one_reviews_text: I don't want to talk about the graphics or gameplay. I think everybody know that it's absolutely awesome. I want to talk about my feelings. To the Devs: Thank you so much for making this game! I can't descripe how much fun it is and how much it touches me. There are a lot of AAA VR games like Alien Isolation, Stormland, Resident Evil 7, Skyrim etc but this game makes me feel love and friendship in a way I never felt before in a game. It is the first time I had to wipe away the tears while playing a game. This game is just made for the players and it is just a Symphony of love and Passion!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!!!! (Pls excuse my english...I'm german.) Update after playing 50 hours: Everybody is waiting for the Killer app which will push VR forward. To all gamers out there who haven't got a VR headset yet...You don't have to wait for Half Life-Alyx....The Killer app is here and the name is ASGARDS'S WRATH!!!!

review_title: Fantastic Game, don't heed the naysayers
one_reviews_text: I've been using VR from a time when you would buy controllers separately, and I've played TONS of games.  This is absolutely one of the best VR games ever made.  The story was engaging enough and the visuals are absolutely stunning.  I don't understand reviews that give zero stars for download issues and I wish that wasn't a thing.  In this VR world I've come across a number of player types and the "it was boring" crowd, usually tend to be "those people"...the ones always looking for an issue with the games.  The fighting mechanics can be modified to your liking and there are several side quests in addition to the main story line (some folks here claim it had no story...which makes me feel like they may not have actually played it, just wanted something to complain about).  I've always loved Greek mythology and I enjoyed all of the hours I sunk into it.  Sansaru did a fantastic job and I highly recommend experiencing it for yourself vs. relying on some of these reviews.  If you hate it, refund it.  But be advised it is a HUGE download so be sure you have the space.
i have the game installed its a decent game the graphics are a bit iffy even though my computer specs are higher then needed. graphics only suffer when you take control of the hero

I was tempted to give 4 stars because of the install process but this is on Oculus (the game actually requires almost double the disk space to install and to apply patches, it is beyond ridiculous).
With that being said, the game feels, looks and plays like a high quality AAA RPG game. Varied weapons and abilities, a lot of characters and different weapons + a lot of locations.
It is a fully fledged RPG with dozens of hours of gameplay. One of the few RPG games where you pay for the actual amount of hours.
Recommended.

review_title: An amazing title, and a must play
one_reviews_text:
What to say about this title? It is what other VR titles should strive for, both mechanically and graphically. It is hugely entertaining and offers a multitude of things to do, including a quest system, a fairly complex battle system, a large selection of animal-themed allies, and multiple characters each with their own quirks.

Graphically, this game is currently second to none on VR, but you could've already guessed that with a 70+GB download and a 130GB install.

The only reason I can't give this game 5 stars is because of the Oculus software used to launch and update the game. Oculus' launcher requires you to have the full game's size in free space available on the install drive to download any updates, even if said updates amount to 1.5GB. This limitation makes updating this monster of a game extremely tedious, and, in my opinion, detracts from the experience.

So, after playing for nearly a month I'm starting to give it up. I took one star away and not because the game is bad. On the contrary, it is a great game. There is only one but.... I'm frustrated at this point, because I can't get past the  God that heaves havoc in the small town. I have to shoot arrows on the red balls he throws at the character, in order not to lose lifeforce, have to shoot the blue ones to hit him and then pull parts of his armor. I manage to do that, but every time I lose a lot of lifeforce. I managed to kick him a few times, but then he gets his armor back and in an instance he kills the character, having to do everything all over again. BOOOORING!. I looked for days to find a trainer, where my immortal character cannot be defeated or die. The only one I found is one I have to pay a monthly fee for. NO GOOD. Why can't the makers of the game have this mode built in? It is not a multi-player and I'ld like to enjoy the stunning graphics of the game, the puzzles and of and on the fighting. If trainers can do that, why is it not possible for Oculus or the maker of this game possible to offer this feature. I payed for this game to enjoy, not to get upset or angry because I can't survive a level.
Anyway, I stop here now and dive into the game, hoping to beat that sucker this time!
This game restoret my faith for VR gaming!

it's really incredible that at every update we need ... 130 GB of free space ... and half this to download ... Please do a few optimisation.... everybody doesn't live in a Datacenter ...( specially now ...)

I've downloaded this 3 times now.  It's a large download, and every time, it downloads, then fails to install.  Save your money (and time) until they fix it.

This is a Fantastic game Truly AAA VR Infact id say AAA+ as a game in general... When you can get it to install.

The Downfall of this Tital is the instalation issues that have been going on for Months. However Two workarounds. 1. Start the install with the HMD Completely unpluged from your machine. If you still have install issues (Failed to install due to antivirus) which is not actualy the antivirus causing the issue, then. 2.  download the game through a VPN. Many seem to find connecting to a server in New Zealand works. No idea why this is an issue or why this fixes it but i worked for me. 

As far as the game. The Onboarding is Excenent. The Tutorial play does a realy good job of nurturing you though especialy if you are new to VR games like this. You dont feal overwhelmed or at a loss of what to do like you can in some other VR RPGs. 
The Visuals are stunning even in the Original Rift Truly AAA+ Quality and even more impressive is the Quality of the NPCs and their animations.
If you love vr you should definitely check this game out. Even tho it is a little much it is really worth it.
Overall, a super fun single player game. I would definately recomend this to other people. Only things that I would change is that I wish that there was some way to play multiplayer with friends.

this is how VR should be, feels like an AAA game, playing on the rift s , still have a few stuttering problems now and the, doesnt seem to matter what setting its on, still a great game  just wish it would run smooth after each update.

First real AAA game in VR! A lot of things to do in a very long adventure for the price. A must have! I could buy it for more than 40$ as it's a REAL game! I don't understand people who doesn't put 5/5 stars... This is obviously the best VR experience!

+ The first real AAA VR game (more than 30 hours) and very polished game
+ 4 playables heroes with differents abilities, weapons and upgrades
+ Many differents followers with differents abilities
+ When the game is finished you have to come back in area to unlock things (to have 100% completion, every area is "reset" with new enemies, challenges, etc...)
+ Many quests and challenges
+ Crafting and "ressources farming"
+ Good graphics

- No subtitle yet, but devs are working on (it can help people like me, even if subtitles aren't in my first language, english subtitles can be appreciate...)
- Size: More than 120 GO
- The game have to be installed on a SSD to have fast loading

THANKS DEVs AND OCCULUS, WE NEED MORE (LONG) GAME LIKE THAT! FIRST TIME I HAVE THE FEELING TO PLAY IN VR ON A TRUE AAA GAME!

NB: I really need Asgard's Wrath 2! Please, make this dream true! :D
The only thing that I hate about Asgrad's wrath is that load times are so long.

review_title: Great game but Memory error problem
one_reviews_text: I love the game so far of what I have seen which isn't much, as I keep getting out of memory errors, even though my cards is an RTX2060 super with 8GB of memory.

After reading reviews of the game, I really wasn't sure what to expect. The graphics are of course wonderful, but what I really liked about it is that I didn't get sick from walking around and looking at the scenery and interacting with the npcs. I own several fantastic VR racing games, which I cannot enjoy due to motion sickness and this game does not make me sick. I would recommend installing this on a SSD though, I installed it on my HDD and I can notice some lag and loading issues, nothing game breaking but still annoying when you're used to quick load times in other games. This game gave me some hope that VR is here to stay, and I didn't waste my hard earned money just for vr porn.
Finally a worthy VR RPG. It is about time we got AAA VR games.
Excellent game, and thank you for the translation, with voices !!!
THIS GAME IS SPECTACULAR!  THIS GAME IS PHENOMENAL!

This game is nothing short of amazing. Hours upon hours of gameplay and there will always be opportunities to go back and complete quests or challenges down the road.￼

You become immersed in the graphics when in “God“ mode. You have to think in order to get through some parts, and that in itself makes the gameplay outstanding.

My only downside is that it takes a while to load, but that is on my old spinning disk hard drive and I wish I had solid state.￼

I believe that vr is still in its infancy stage. Too many wave shooters, rythm beat games and very short "experiences" don't get me wrong. I love these games too, but we need more, we need killer games. Asgard's Wrath is one of those games. It sets new standards on what we should get in a vr game. If vr ever really takes off (and I think it will) Asgard's Wrath is a game people will look back on and talk about for years to come. A highly recommended title to add to your library

Graphics are undeniably great, the story is allright and overall i nejoyed it a lot. however the melee combat really feels off and not very rewarding at all without the feeling of weight in weapons, (as seen in other games) and collision. Now this is totally a personal opinion and especially if this is your first melee fighting game, you will probably love it. review_title: Buy it now! you wont regret it
one_reviews_text: This game is awesome, exactly what I wanted from VR, a fully blown title not just a gimicky game you play every once in a while or just for 10 minutes at a time. This is by far and away the best VR game I have played and I dont see any other game that comes close yet. I was a bit hesitant about the price tag but its definitely worth it so if you are thinking about it, do it!
This is a big game that really immerses you in the world of Norse mythology. While not perfect, this is a rare example of a fun, big budget game that has many hours of gameplay.

So the scale of it is obviously huge story-wise when it comes to VR games. But I LOVE the actual size stuff, I always find it neat to feel huge or small and that's one of the main mechanics of this game. Being feels incredible, picking up tiny animals pinched in your fingers squiggling around and stuff. And sometimes tiny in the big world seeing huge people and monsters. 

Plus your animal companions are fun and neat to interact with and have around. There's also SO much content. I've read that there are 25 hours of main story but there are little puzzles and stuff all around to do if you want to find extra chests and such. A taste of metroidvania. 

Anyway, I love it.

Videos don’t do this justice, I was blown away after playing the first 30 minutes. The detail of the world and the natural feeling controls are great. If only I can get past the motion sickness so I can play more than 30 minutes at a time, I will be happy.

Got my first VR-Headset as a present. Asgard´s Wrath was my first RPG i bought and I am flashed by this game. Up to now I played nearly 15 hours and still at the beginnig (3rd budy) The graphic is awsome, Story and Gameplay perfectly set for VR. Fighting is not to easy but also not to hard (don´t forget to reduce difficulty like me, I forgot to reduce it from legendary and died a lot :-)
Little Tip: Do not enter the Arena to early, I died very early because i am (i was) not skilled enought to fight several Enemys without my budy.
Craftingsystem is at the begining a little bit confusing but you will make it 
Good-Modus is amazing, and not boring for example you need it to solve some Puzzles or move your budy to get him to other positions.
I am German so my English is not so good but I can say: This game is realy the money worth. Played with Oculus Link no problems.
When we were young we dreamed of retirement and LAN-Partys now i have only 20years left and have to hope that i am agile enought to move my body in VR :-)

review_title: Great but could be better engineered
one_reviews_text:
I'll start by saying that the game is awesome!
You can spend good 40-60 hours here. I've finished the main story by now so hope my review helps from that perspective.
The story, mechanics, characters... all is great.
But there's a huge thing that almost made me rage quit multiple times a session (2-3 hours) - that is lags/freezes. Game stutters from time to time but that's beareable. What's not beareable is when game freezes or straight crashes!
Most often it happens on bosses when you move between the menu (to heal yourself) and back to the game - it'll freeze here loading for no good reason. I've monitored the resource use of my PC and it's close to 0 at this point so looks like a software glitch to me. Graphics quality is irrelevant here, I had this on max and min quality and I have core i7/ geforce 1080 / 16 GB ram setup.
When it runs - it runs well... but when it doesn't (which usually is in the middle of the fight) you want to rage quit =(

Most if not ALL of the game breaking "lost assets" have been corrected with the latest update which is much appreciated--just wish it was released after these bugs were sorted out--"details" show~40 hrs of gameplay- Not many titles especially, in this genre can entertain anywhere near that amount of time--This, Stormlands,  and Saints and Sinners(TWD) are some of the best made for VR titles with RPG elements and good campaigns-If you have the HD space then give this one a go! (Make sure you're using some sort of SSD as the mechanical drives will not be a pleasant experience

Dissapointing performance ruins what is in itself a great VR game.

The loading is atroscious, the stuttering is consant and in my initial 5 hours of playing I've spent more time in loading screens than actually playing.

When I did play the game I had constant stuttering all the time, specially during fights which resulted in a mess, the exploring portion was filled with bugs, glitches and all sorts of other issues, I've got stuck on objects several times and had to waste time on another load screen to fix it. Once my inventory was full I had to spend several minutes at 2 loading screens to go to the hall to unload inventory then to go back to playing the game.


Oh and the game is 120 GBs. 

I heavily discourage anyone from buying this game at the current time.

Buy it.  You will not regret it.

While I personally wasn't super-into the block-and-counter combat flow (and had some really frustrating battles against the first tutorial enemy that required it, mostly due to the tutorial itself being unskippable), the game does come with difficulty settings that let you tone that down (or amp it up) as you desire.

The story is both entertaining and lengthy (both a rarity for previous VR games).  As of this writing I've clocked in just over 40 hours, and while I've finished the main story and most of the side quests, there's still a few things remaining.

Another excellent aspect is that you're not playing as one character all the time -- it's broken up into chapters that each star a different hero, with different weapons, different combat styles, and different enemies and puzzles to face down.  And once you've cleared a section you can go back through with any other hero you've unlocked either just for fun or for bonus quests and collectibles.

And who would have thought I'd ever experience playing beer pong in the halls of Asgard?  Not me, but it's a great deal of fun all by itself.  (Except for the fire shots.  I never figured that one out.)

Installer is not working
I

Ok so here it is... I had lots of trouble with the game which caused many problems gameplay & graphics related. Oculus updates late last year destroyed this game & other games unfortunately which seems to have been the cause.  Since the  latest update / being part of beta testing, the game is working much better though between oculus & the game itself their are still frequent crashes between the two. That aside i am loving the game & yes it one of the best games on VR.

I've played quite a few VR titles and there are a lot of great experiences out there but not a lot of actual good AAA games. Asgard's Wrath is an actual good full game, regardless of it being VR. If you liked God of War or Skyrim, this game really mixes the feel of those two while also doing a great job of being like it's own unique game. The 70GB install size just shows you how much content really is packed into this game. Fun, looks amazing, great story, and full game length. Easily the best game on Oculus hands down.

Up until now my rig managed to run every VR game on high or ultra settings. Lone Echo was probably the only game, where I had to settle with medium settings to get good performance. 
But this game manages to run extremely poorly, even on lowest settings. 
I would really love to give this game 5 Stars and even more, because I absolutely love what I could experience so far. I could further elaborate on the beauties of Asgard´s Wrath and why it´s inarguably the best VR experience currently available, but countless other reviewers described all there is to love about this game far better than I ever could.

But to say, that this game runs poorly, would be an understatement: long loading times, stutters and arbitrary framerates. Therefore I can only give this game one measly star, but will glady change my review once performance becomes acceptable.

---UPDATE---

Performance increased dramatically since the last time I played it. Maybe it was the 1.3 Update, but most likely recent Oculus software updates fixed performance issues within the Oculus runtime (which were also caused by less recent Oculus updates). 
Therefore, the error was on my account, thinking that the game itself was the culprit when Oculus actually messed up. In retrospect, I likely came to that conclusion, because back then Asgard´s Wrath was the only game, that ran poorly on my rig while playing other demanding games at that time such as Lone Echo. 

Final conclusion:
Pros:
+Almost everything, definitely worth playing
+Only game I sat through the whole credits, because they are so awesome
Cons:
-Stale and easily exploitable combat system combined with way too many enemy hordes in order to artificially stretch playtime, which on my part mostly resulted in frequent boredom

review_title: Problems with TAA on RIFT S
one_reviews_text:
Firstly i want to start by saying that from what ive played the game itself is very good, good combat and RPG elements with the ability to level, up not only yourself buit also your followers.  
I started playing on CV1 Rift and the game looked and played amazing on my overclocked 980Ti, it never seem to have a problem even with most of the settings on epic.
When I upgraded (or sidegraded lol) to the Rift S i went back to my game only to find it looks awful on all settings except for Low annd struggles to play smooth on medium / high.
After some research online it became clear the the problem lies with TAA on headsets that feature an LCD screen like the Rift S, on low setting everything looks crisp and clear but obviously void of any grass and effects.
Ramping up the settings to anything above low becomes a blurry mess in comparision.
The devs included no way of disabling TAA whilst allowing the extra effects of the Medium/High/Epic presets, therefore the only current solution is to edit the gameengine.ini file to make some adjustment to TAA to make it less blurry, its still not ideal but at least it becomes somewhat playable again.
Hopefully they will add an option to disable TAA or even a slider to adjust its effect in game, until that happens if you own a Rift S be warned it does not look as good as it does on the old CV1 even with reduced screen door effect.

The price $39.99 might scare some away but it's a full blown AAA game with great combat, great visuals, great puzzles and story. It's an essential game for all Oculus owners.

It easily ranks up there with the most essential list alongside Beat Saber, Super Hot,  Lone Echo and Moss. You are doing yourself a diservice by not picking this up.

review_title: Great game let down by tedious combat
one_reviews_text:
It's an impressive game, and visually one of the best I've seen on VR, but I feel sadly it doesn't live up to the hype.  The story is good and engaging, but I bought the game based on it's reputation as a hack and slash dungeon crawler (some reviewers even go so far as to liken it to Diablo 3).

Unfortunately the combat is what lets the game down for me.  Perhaps I've been spoiled a little bit with games like Blade & Sorcery, but the weapons feel light and certainly don't feel unique in any way.  Melee combat has no real impact.
On top of this, a lot of the battles in the game will pit you up against one or more enemies with 'ruinic armour'.  This works by essentially making them invincible until you get them angry enough to do a special move, which you then need to parry and land a follow up strike.
In theory it's a good mechanic, but in practice the game seems to rely on it to try and make encounters harder and it ends up feeling tedious.
It's further compounded by making shields more or less useless in these battles (you're better off going in with a weapon in each hand), and more often than not you'll find your follower getting in the way and making the enemy much harder to predict.

I'll give it another try soon though since I really do want to like this game, but for the moment it doesn't quite scratch the itch.

review_title: Asgard's Wrath as a Relaxation App
one_reviews_text:
So since there is already ample commentary on the gameplay, I'll go in a different direction with this review. I own every "Relax and Meditate" Experience worth playing; it is why I got into VR. I purchased Asgard's Wrath [AW] solely to enjoy the scenery; for me, any gaming value beyond that was simply a pleasant perk. Consequently, this review is SOLELY from that perspective.

The thing that attracted me to this game was the possibility of enjoying a relaxation experience (think The Impossible Travel Agency, Perfect, Guided Meditation, and, yes, even Mind Labyrinth). The difference was that I would be relaxing on the Bifrost, or in the fantasy tavern (with five save slots, yes, you can do both; indeed, you don't even need to use one for the Bifrost, as it's first up... and is ridiculously beautiful). What I didn't expect is that the God Mode would prove relaxing as well. If you liked the overworld map mode in Farlands, you will absolutely adore looking at the landscapes in AW.

I can't say enough about the visuals in this game. They aren't quite on par with the most detailed aspects of Perfect, but they are very close, and they remain smooth as you walk with a surprisingly generous freedom of movement around each environment. I probably spent twenty minutes looking out over the frozen sea outside of Aegir's Hall.

I was running this on a Rift S, with a 1080ti and an I9 7900X -- both at stock speed -- and 32 GB RAM. I was running 2.0 SS, through Oculus Tray Tool and max resolution in-game. As some others have said, you do need a somewhat beefy rig to run this on the top graphics settings smoothly; I didn't have a problem, but it is something to consider. That said, the result is absolutely gorgeous. I can tell you this: From a strictly "Relax and Meditate" perspective, this is easily on par with any other app, and the ability to move around and interact with the environment places it at the top. If anyone needs me, I'll be on the Bifrost, staring at the stars.
review_feedback:
We loved your fresh perspective on the game. We love to hear that players enjoyed the work that the artists made. 
Thank you for the review!

review_title: 5 Star doesn't mean perfect, but buy it
one_reviews_text:
Best game visually by a long shot. (Jan 2020) They have really reached for the sky and done well on visuals.  I run an older i7 3770 clocked to 4.0 GHz, 16 GB of DDR 3, MSI 1660 TI .. the game runs well but you can tell it's being pushed and the auto detected settings are at medium. It still looks better than most games set to ultra. I'll be needing to upgrade to SSD now as well. I don't mind slow load times but this beast is pushing 1-2 minutes on my old spinning 10k RPM drives. NOT a fault of the game. 

I was looking for a Fantasy RPG as I'm about done Skyrim VR and I may go into withdrawl. I've tried and returned several games on both Oculus and Steam. This one seems a keeper, and worthy of taking up the quest. 

Something to note when purchasing. The game is 77 GB to download. It took a couple of hours to download and install. For me, if I played other games while this downloaded, I had install issues. It failed twice, and I actuall had refunded and given up.  A week later I tried and again and just left the computer alone and it was successful. Just be patient with the download and install. The reward is there.

Game mechanics are a bit cumbersome, but not bad.  I like buttons for arming weapons rather than trying to find that magic spot on imaginary tool belts. It's just more trustworthy, especially when playing seated. 

The sound is excellent. They've really crafted the clarity and 3D positioning of the sounds. Top Notch. I will say, that the NPC companions make an lot of noise that makes you think things are behind you and that is a minor annoyance. I silent mode for the NPC's would be good.

This game is incredible, but the not perfect parts..... if you click the wrong button after a training session, you get sucked back into that. Some things aren't explained well.  I had no idea my sheild needed to be grabbed by reach over my back. 

If you're looking for that premium game to impress yourself and friends...  I really thing this is the one.

I only recently got into VR and I was blown away by some of the games like Lone Echo, Superhot VR and Budget Cuts. If they were flat, they'd be mediocre games (I didn't even like the original Superhot), but they're completely transformed when played in VR, because the actions there felt natural, organic, everything is interactive.

Asgard's Wrath, on the other hand, veers more towards standard game interactions. You don't have to pick items from the ground, just hover your hand towards them and grip. To interact with levers you just hover your hand, grip and make a vague gesture. Throwing axes just doesn't make sense to me, I can barely target what I want, and I tried assists on and off, it just never feels real. Combat feels ridiculous, as I wave my sword like an idiot and just wait to parry, which doesn't even always register.

It has high production values and it's much longer than a typical VR game. That's probably why it's so beloved by everyone. If it weren't VR it would have felt like poor man's God of War.

review_title: After 10 days still waiting to play it
one_reviews_text:
Update - finally thanks to some workaround (i made several copies of the file in download ) I started to play. The expectations were high and I can say, the game is absolutely amazing. I hope the Oculus team will take care of improving the installation system, so to let the poor customers enjoy the full experience. Only for this reason, 4/5 stars . The game itself is surely a "killer application" and deserves to be bought.

Dear Sanzaru Team,
your game looks so beautiful, but the installer is a real pain. I suppose this is not your fault but please, try to check it.
I have tried some other app on the Oculus platform and went fine, probably because are smaller. Since I don´t have a super fast connection (8Mb) it takes ages to downloaf the game , and the worst point is that differently from other famous platforms , at the minimal problem (net connection or whatever) the installer loses all the data. Very frustrating. As soon as I will play this game, I´m sure i´ll write a fantastic review. Thanks for any evetnual suggestion.

I cant acutally play the game as it keeps chashing before the main game starts. The first time it crashed it killed my Rift S for 4 days, I had to raise a ticket with Oculus & and eventually after days of trying different things a manual uninstall got my Rift S working again. If you cant get the game working can I please have a refund? Happy to send you the error message.

i got asgards wrath ages ago i thought it was amazing graphics are amazing storyline is amazing it is really good howerver it made me annoyed by freezing every 30 seconds after i was fighting a mini boss and it wouldnt let me move and i kept getting killed so i got really angry but overall it is good but freezing is very common

The game seems properly amazing, but I'm having trouble running it with my Oculus Link + Quest.  The textures look very bad and blurry on all settings except the higherst, which my pc can't properly handle. This is not intentional, it is an issue. I'm playing now on highest textures and low everything else including resolution, runs fine but it is far from the experience I was looking for. Any help with this issue would be greatly appreciated. 
I was looking very forward to this game but as it stands it is close to unplayable for me. If this issue were fixed it would be an easy 5/5.

Ok, so obviously this is not darksiders. for starters its norse mytholagy over the four horsemen. HOWEVER the game play is exactly like what one would expect in a darksiders game. To make things simple if you enjoyed the darksiders series you will enjoy shredding your foes to pieces in this great game!
for some reason i can't install the game and i don't know what to do any help is appreciated

review_title: Easily the best game in vr
one_reviews_text: It can hold it's own against normal non VR tittles; the only downside being that it may be hard in combat to parry if you are new to vr.

review_title: Not a review, just an installation thing
one_reviews_text: So I had trouble installing. Did 4 tries at about 2 hours per download. Each download resulting in the same. For me ... the solution wasn't blocking firewalls or virus protection. I completly uninstalled Oculus, re-installed. Deleted all libraries, so it would be installed on same C: drive as Oculus (Setting C: as default). It is late now, time for bed, but before I do, I am moving it to my 2tb drive where all of my other games are located. I was able to get it installed this way, but I do not know if after the move, it will still work. I will post more tomorrow. I was able to open the game and play the first 10 minutes and it looked pretty good, exeptional.

You have to experience Asgard's Wrath to understand the hype.

This is the best VR game for people who like RPGs.

I absolutely love it!

was exited after waiting for this game to release, hower upon waiting 2 hours for it to install, it did not allow me to play due to anti malware when disabled it let me download again and had to wait another to hours. not impressed with the way most oculus games have this issue, ecpessialy when i am paying 350 for the headset and £30 on this new game. NOT HAPPY

Awesome game.  Extremely immersive.  Switching between god mode and hero mode is awesome and makes for some ingenious puzzles.  

Combat is NOT as fun or innovative as has been reported.  Parrying doesn't work about most of the time and you have to parry to damage most foes.  Upgrade your hero at every opportunity.  

If you get frustrated, just hang in there.  It gets better.  If you have to, move it down to easy.  The combat becomes less stressful, but it opens up the rest of the game, which is amazing even without the combat.

I have put in quite a few hours already and hands down this is an amazing experience. From the first moments you step into the game it feels epic. The combat is very smooth and in depth, crafing is solid, progression has a good feel to it. Everything in it is crafted amazingly well. Awesome job devs for this amazing game. We definitely need more!

this game is filled with tons of action and the puzzles can get challenging but eventually i figure them out. one of the things i LOVE about his game is the storyline because there is all sorts of twists and turns and sometimes it can be funny. another thing is the graphics are TOP NOTCH! and the fighting is super realistic. finally i want to thank the devs for spending so much time on this game. DEVS IF YOU ARE READING THIS YOU GUYS ARE THE COOLEST!!!!
review_feedback: We are reading it! Thank you for the nice review!

review_title: This is by far my favorite VR game.
one_reviews_text:
The graphics & gameplay are incredible. This is truly what VR was made for and I fully enjoyed it. The characters were fun and interesting, and the various weapons you could use were really cool. Being able to fight as a giant god is super cool and fun. The next part of my review is based on the ending so spoiler warning:
==--==--==--==--==--  ENDING SPOILERS AHEAD!! --==--==--==--==--==

The ending to the game was surprising, to say the least. It was completely obvious that Loki was the bad guy from the beginning, but that the Tavern was an illusion & a prison for Loki I definitely didn't expect. After I fought Loki and was trapped there, I was surprised & dissapointed. The fight with him was a little bland and I was expecting a second phase or a special cutscene but no, the game just ends and you are left with an Ankh on the bar. Speaking of the Ankh, it's from Egyptian mythology, so I can only assume that there will be DLC or a second game with Egyptian gods, and all I can say to that is YES PLEASE! Devs, if you're reading this review, please make some sort of second game/DLC that would be amazing. 

Overall, 9/10. Absolutley one of, if not the best VR game I've played. would would be a 10/10 if it had a better ending, amazing work on this game!!

Thank you Sanzaru Games and Oculus for creating and  bringing this amazing VR groundbreaking game and experience into my life! 

Asgard's Wrath is a first of it's kind and truly on a higher level of graphics, architecture, design (and of course gameplay) than  any VR game I have experienced before!

Goodbye Skyrim, goodbye God's Of War, 
I don't need you anymore!

Asgard's Wrath is a must have for any VR gamer!

It's unfortunate that a few people are having an issue running the game. This in no way should affect the score of the game. Judge the game on the quality of the game, not whether or not you can run it. The game works fine. Fix your setup.
If you find this game to be 1 star, your expectations are ridiculously way too high.

review_title: Becase shrek and his puzzles is annoyin!
one_reviews_text:
Great game but this green shrek and his puzzles when you need to shoot fast on moving target... I bet alot of poples just give up on this... I wish i can skip this to finish the game... 

I buy it to enjoy the game not to suffer because of dumb puzzles...

WARNING FOR RADEON USERS: game performance is horrible. My system is above the recommended specs and the stuttering in game is unbearable. This seems to be caused by Radeon poor performance in VR plus the latest oculus update in December. There is no fix for it. A lot of people are having the same issue. DO NOT BUY, YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO PLAY IT PROPERLY.

CPU: R5 2600 OC'd at 4.0 GHZ, Radeon Vega 64 (undervolted and optimized), 16 GB RAM, M2 SSD.
Very poor performance while my GPU stays at 60% usage, cpu under 20% usage (!!!). Updated drivers, clean system, tried various tweaks and fixes, nothing helps.

UPDATE: The above applies to Radeon GPUs only. With a new GTX 2080 installed, oculus updated to 13.0, ASW off, performance is better, now playable at 80 FPS on high settings, still with short frame drops that are independent of quality settings when loading new assets (entering new area, enemies spawning, turning around quickly). Leaving the initial review as a warning for Radeon users.

This game doesn't need another 5 star review, but I'm playing it on Quest Link with graphic tweaks recommended on the Oculus  forum.  The designers and developers did a fantastic job.  This one game is worth buying a Quest or Rift S.
Great job to everyone involved!

review_title: I want o love this game but i can't
one_reviews_text:
The good, The graphics are great the story is solid. the basic game play is fun. I enjoy the characters and locations the controls are responsive and  after updating to the latest nvidia drivers from nvidia the stuttering is mostly gone. Its got intriguing puzzles that require some creativity to solve. 

The bad  The parry mechanic is just so out of place and  requiring you to be pixel perfect or you miss the enemies will start with an overhand and then do a low slash the movements are hard to predict and even when you do put you blades in the appropriate place  you still get dead. This is a piss poor gimmick that dosen't belong in any game let alone this one. Do you like frustration and agitation then this game may be for you. Its like the develope has never attempted to even weild a sword let alon parry with one. It requires god like reflexes and precision to do it right and im playing on mortal. I'm not a god i just play one in vr. I really hope th developer removes the mechanic entirely its just badly done.

Having a full blown rpg pulled off in vr, in both an immersive world and story, as well as really well done characters, minor interactions (I always give my helpers a thumbs up, and seeing them give one back is so rewarding!! This as well as when I toss a healing item to one of them and they actually catch and eat it! So amazing, I love the small details!), overall amazing gameplay, swordplay feels good, bows are fun to use, full customization of what gear you're using based on what you scavanged, optional harder enemies, new-user friendly with the lower difficulty setting (not having to parry on the lowest). Everything overall is just what a Vr experience should be. It doesn't have to be constant action for it to be fun like some may think. Just be in the world and live like the h*cking god you are
The story is beautful and the gameplay is super good, one word, Wonderfull

I've read all the reviews and had high expectations, yet from the very start was impressed. Putting aside gameplay for a moment...wow the graphics are just tremendous and in VR it is really just a wonderful experience to be in such a beautiful and other worldly place....places. I have a 1060 6 GB and an i7 7700k and was able to run very smoothly on High Graphic settings. Be sure to save this on your SSD if you have one. If you have issues be sure that your GPU drivers are up to date and that other programs are not utilizing system resources (check Task Manager)...I'm really enjoying this game, playing with your animal minions adds companionship that I really appreciate. I feel a bond to my followers like I would to a human companion.

I find the combat to be engaging, satisfying and at times exhilarating. It really requires skill and timing. There are three levels of difficulty and you can change it at anytime. The crafting is great and I am so grateful that they added this mechanic. There is just an abundance of options and upgrade paths for you and your followers. Oh and their implementation of God mode is really impressive. There's really just too much to write about. I just really love this game. Thank you Sanzaru & Oculus.

review_title: The game that pushed me into VR....
one_reviews_text: Amazing experience so far ! That's a kid's dream fulfilled ...

Decent graphics and some inventive touches do not a big boy roleplay game make. Get Skyrim VR if you are serious about roleplay in VR. Otherwise, this is a decent distraction but not an AAA game in my opinion. Also, since I purchased it there have been some serious glitches like vanishing for a fortnight from my library and the last update now takes an eternity to load (on a high end PC where all other Oculus and Steam VR games work fine).

I gave it a 1 star because i can't continue to play after i pick my movement option (start of the game) the fire keeps showing and i does not continue. Somebody an idea what i need to do, can't even play the game now :(
review_feedback: Hello, we are really sorry. Patch 1.4.0 has a fix for people that had the same issue as you. I would hope you give it a chance and see if it works.

review_title: First ever VR game that I actually enjoy
one_reviews_text:
Im 37, and i get bored very easy with games, I have always seen VR as a future tech, so close yet so far, either the games make me sick or they are very basic, nothing that keeps me engaged enaugh and the graphics are very basic.

With that said as soon as i stepped in the game I was throwing axes and fighting and for the first time i felt trully emersed in a game.

Pros: graphics, no motion sickness, nice fun envoirement, very good physics and interaction, fun puzzles.

Cons: to much grind for item upgrades, more monster types.

Overall the best VR game by a mile !

Producers: you should feel proud as you created a work of art that is going to be remembered as the first VR  AAA game !
review_feedback: It's very very nice to read comments like that. The team really appreciates it.

one_reviews_text:
Ok so the game is really good... for the times it works, that is. My main weapon of my character sometimes decides to completely disappear when i go in my inventory. How am I supposed to play like this? This happens not rarely, it happened 2 times in a row at the same fight today. 

Also the blocking sometimes feels so wrong, and sometimes it just doesnt work at all.

This game is real deadly. The graphics and world are just real good (no cheap graphics here). The story will make you say "Holeh! this is epic". The combat is challenging and will make you say, "Watstaggats! This is hard." but Skoden would be proud. 
I give Asgard's Wrath VR 5 pieces of Kokom's bannock out of 5.

hands down one of the best games I ever played. The story, the game play, the attention to details, even the cridits scene was a work of art. I never finished a game and watched the cridits with a smile on my face from start to finish. 100% worth the money I spent on this game. I highly recommend it.

Due to how many praised this game I made it my mission to finished it, and I did, took around 30 hours I believe. While many claim it's the perfect VR game, my impression is a bit different. You can read about all the good points in other reviews so I'll go on a nit-picking rampage.

1. Almost none of the world reacts physically to you, swords go straight through rocks and walls, you can push your head through anything, using room-scale to walk through walls.
2. Many puzzle actions are abstracted to your companions, you don't get to do them, they do, so it becomes like a point and click puzzle game.
3. It was noticeable that animations that could have been canned physics simulations, like when the draw bridge falls, were hand animated and looked very fake in VR.
4. The whole upgrade system is all about crafting, this meant you almost never got any interesting loot or drops, it was just always crafting reagents to be used in the home base. This made rewards uninteresting in general.
5. As mostly anything that drops can be used for crafting or side quests, I ended up picking up absolutely everything I could. It didn't take long until I just wished I had auto-pickup. This also meant inventory juggling every time I was back in the base.
6. Walking is dreadfully slow, it made exploring time consuming and tedious. Not sure if this was to make it comfortable, but for me it was an immediate turn-off.

All in all it felt like I was playing a traditional ARPG that had been ported instead of an actual VR native title, which surprised me. Due to the game being so high profile I did clear it, but I felt done with it after 2/3rds, the last 10 hours were a slog. 

It does still get a few stars due to the world building, the play with scale, the highly detailed assets, but I deduct stars for everything mentioned above.

review_title: First proper AAA VR title, bugs resolved
one_reviews_text:
Turtle won't move properly, and then attempting to 'recall' him the first fire tomb has him standing elevated off the ground with no option to direct him to the traps, looks like I have to restart my entire game which is infuriating.
UPDATE: support on reddit got save game to me, but did loose the first part, hopefully won't happen again, otherwise seems like as decent game.
UPDATE: 12/29/2019: finished the game, really great experience especially for VR.  wish the loading times were better but can't fault it too much

review_title: I lost time in this one!
one_reviews_text: I thought I was playing for an hour but was playing for two! That's hard to do in VR. The gameplay is so rewarding in everything from building up my hero to solving puzzles from the hero and the god's perspective. If you're on the fence- let me help you: it's worth it.

Seriously impressive, the main hall scene is exceptional to just look at. 

Cut scene can take a long time.

Is it possible to walk in a direction that you are not looking? Head direction controlled movement is not good. Also, can you access setttings as it is greyed out on mine?

First time playing it but so far it look awesome.

Would of had 5 stars but the load times are insane from HDD. I dont have the room for this monster on my SSD. Load times are minutes long every time I die and I like to play a harder game so die more often.
review_feedback: Hello! We recently released patch 3 (version 1.3.0) that reduces load times between deaths a lot. I hope it makes your experience better!

review_title: Amazing game - beware of motion sickness
one_reviews_text:
I would instantly give this game 5 stars: the level of detail is impressive, the rhythm of the game keeps it fresh and engaging, etc.
BUT
How good is all of that when the game makes you feel dizzy and nauseous within 15/20m? It's a pity that they didn't add other ways of moving around such as teleporting, which has never made me feel like this.
I get it that some people will get used to VR and stop being sick. Unfortunately others, like me, won't. We'd love to, but we can't.
In my condition I cannot enjoy this beautiful game and therefore I have to rate it lower than 5 stars. The developers need to start caring more about this, because it's not just "comfort" we are talking about: it's more about health and safety.
A game that makes you feel nauseous isn't just uncomfortable: it's bad for your health, and completely unplayable. Locomotion matters heaps!

If you are used to sliding locomotion and don't suffer of motion sickness at all, you'll love this game.
If you DO suffer of VR sickness and feel nauseous with the sliding locomotion, you won't enjoy this game unfortunately.

Hopefully one day the devs will implement other locomotion techniques.

Love everything about the game. Very exciting and a good work out. The only problem I'm having is that I can't fire an arrow with my right hand with the bow. I can't pull back the bow string. Tried everything they talk about online but still no resolution. Big problem fighting Tyr because of the problem. I can fire some arrows left handed, but only every so often. Also have problem just picking up items, like coins in the ale house to play the game against the bar fly. I tried changing from my oculus s to my oculus rift, but still have the same problem. I have extended my arms out as far as I can at the beginning of the game. I also tried changing settings from right hand to left hand. Still no change. Any solutions would be greatly appreatiated

You know what I am going to whine about. That REALLY obnoxious parry system and the Runic armor. Making your enemies completely invunlerable till you do a little minigame is OBNOXIOUS. It puts the control of the entire combat in the AIs control. In addition, motion controls still need more percision. I am watching the enemies sword phase through my sword while trying to meet their swing. Now I have red flashes from the enemy and I can't do anything about those so I am assuming its an unblockable attack. Would have appreciated a TUTORIAL about that since they force every other tutorial down my throat in PAINFUL detail.  I realise I have this button on my controller that teleports me a very short distance away, again not tutorialized for me, which I assume I am supposed to use to get out of the way of those attacks but it has a cool down and they will SPAM those attacks one after another. What am I supposed to do then? Run around my room? I have enough room to move around and swing about but I dont have enough room to be running around the place so what am I actually supposed to do? 

Critical, why do I move around the map with the speed of a slug? I get that you are worried about motion sickness but I am immune to that non-sense. Level traversal is a MASSIVE pain when it really doesn't need to be. I thought I was on a quest of vengence, not a casual stroll on the beach?

I think the main reason this game receives such praise is because it is unique. I appreciate them going for challenge instead of babies first sword adventure like a lot of these other VR games are like. However, I dont think the technology is there yet (or the programmers didnt playtest) and ruins this experience.

The thing wont install, plenty of space on hd, I disabling a anti virus to install a game is stupid. Fix this crap. I searched the web for a fix, looks like the developers haven't fixed this and its been an issue for others for ages. Sad..

Dear developers,

The game of the current VR, there are brilliant games but yours is the best with no doubt. The closer experience to a traditional AAA game.

Well done and hope to see your new project soon :-)

 I have ony problems to load my settings, the game is always loading to low settings :-(

Oscar

review_title: A cool game that shouldnt be a VR game
one_reviews_text:
Wanted to put this first since it is mentioned quite a bit. I didn't experience any noticably long level load times like some are claiming, and I don't really have a powerful rig (maybe low mid-spec) or SSD. The installation, however, took five and a half hours.  That's not an exaggeration or misspelling. I DO have smoking fast internet, it just takes forever, and it apparently occurs in batches so it looks like it is failing and repeating. It's not. I recommend starting the download before bed, get it rolling, and then leave it alone until morning, or night, or whenever it is you've awakened after getting a clinically responsible amount of sleep. 

On to the game...

Maybe I'm not seeing it? There is a lot this game does extraordinarily well. Putting the VR controls to genuine use beyond pointing and clicking or wire-whisking your enemies with a massless sword is not one of them. I was blown away by the visuals, the story arc seems solid, and Aegir's Hall was straight magic, but the controls and gameplay seem wooden and shallow given how many more involved and immersive VR titles are out there right now. Don't get me wrong, though, this game is well done, polished, and professional. The VR implementation is just kind of... pointless and definitely hyper-simplified, and for me, that was the whole point of the purchase. I probably won't finish it.  There are too many more engaging titles out there than this, and at far lower price points.

Update: Uninstalled to recover disc space. Just couldn't get into it. Just using VR for 3D and point and clicking made it feel like a kid's game.

Best VR game I have played to date, this is what VR should be like.  Very smooth game play great graphics, and so far this game is HUGE, I played Skyrim and though that game was fun in VR, this game blows that one away just no comparison in my opinion, no stupid menus to navigate everything is made for VR, very good game

Important to note, the experience I will explain here is on what I think most would consider as a high end machine (GTX 1070, i7 7700k @4.9Ghz, 16GB RAM at 3000Mhz, 256GB Samsung SSD that is used as the game's storage).

Now starting off, I can't say anything else good about the game, as it's nearly impossible to experience the game. The first noticable issue is the loading, which takes anywhere from 6 minutes to 20 minutes - never more, but more importantly, never less. Finally loading in, I notice the graphics are just "muddy" (as the best way I can describe it). Even on high settings, nothing looks spectacular and certainly doesn't meet the expectations from all other reviewers considering the game "a gorgeous graphical feat". Staring at anything at a low to medium (few meters) distance makes the subject completely unrecognizable. Now given these judgements were based on High settings, I  ended up never actually playing on high settings as the game would also very often hitch, stutter, and just generally run poorly in most areas; so playing on low was the only fix. Though "fix" should be taken lightly as most often it would still hardly ever reach the 90 frames per second goal, and instead consistently stick to around 20 to 30 in larger areas. (Again, I've mentioned my PC specifications above - My system far exceeds hardware requirements).

Luckily, Oculus reviews have character limits, so without explaining each gripe with the game, I'll list the remaining biggest issues that make the game unplayable here:

- Combat is, simply put, sloppy. Blocks and attacks also don't register or register at the right time for the enemy, so you are killed and sent back to up to 20 minutes of loading.
- Crashes are frequent, at least once through every session of mine.
- Intended visual effects result in sickening, confusing, and simply hard to look at visuals.

- Lastly, I can't get my refund since I spent more than 2 hours trying to troubleshoot and play this game at all.

review_title: Its not bad but I prefer SkyRimVR
one_reviews_text:
Sorry, I just didnt like it that much but that may be because I had the wrong expectations.  I was hoping for a Skyrim clone with better VR melee combat, but its actually more of a puzzle solver to unlock the next little area which I found a bit frustrating, especially when I got stuck in the dark elf area and in the end uninstalled at that point.   I just prefer the open world nature of skyrim, that magic and the variety of weapons there.   The followers in AW are a bit non-lore to me and more like childrens comic characters which broke immersion in Norse mythlogy for me.

Each to their own, so judge for yourself.

In Midgard, at the Tombs of the Brotherhood, Frodi can't fix the soul pire (sic) as the top is missing from the game. As a result, as a god, it cann't be retrieved and placed atop the broken piece. Just another glitchy moment creating more Wrath! As a result, you are stuck at this point and have to forget Midgard. Really frustrating!

I have been playing VR games since PS4VR released.  With that said, Asgard’s Wrath is one of the best VR RPG’s I have ever played!  This game is fun and exciting.  The puzzles and the mini games are super fun!  The worlds are well detailed and thought out.  They put the work in and it shows.  I love that you can choose between “I get motion sickness at times” to “Full Emerson experience.”  This game is truly worth $80 or more...easily!  Trust me, BUY THIS GAME!  You will not regret it!
Hi, I’ve pre-ordered the CV1 4 years ago and have played nearly all major titles. This on is it. This is what VR games should be. 100/100
I've lots of VR Games, but this one is the best IMHO.

Freezes with my AMD 2990WX 32 core 64 thread processor when I enter the portal in beginning of game.  Would be nice if this could be fixed, so I don't have to disable half my cores to get it working.

Great game otherwise.

Took ages to download.
Started once, played first few minutes, scene with Kraken , now game does not load, task manager says game not responding, can,t play LOT of money spent for a blank Screen, Makers please respond you cannot expect payment for Game that is not working.

review_title: Best VR game I've ever played
one_reviews_text:
I love this game, yes I have some problems running it because I have a GTX 970, but that wont affect of how much I love this game, guess I'll have to change the GPU, but anyways, I HELLA LOVE THIS GAME

Update: Fianlly changed from the GTX 970 to an RTX 2060, and even though there is just a bit of a lag (Compared to when I was using the 970, there is not lag at all), this game is just PURE GOLD and no wonder why is it nominated for VR Game of the Year!

review_title: Great game, 1 star reviews are dumb
one_reviews_text:
People are giving it one star because it doesn't have Spanish voice acting, and I even saw a 1 star rating because someone didn't like a person that gave it a 5 star review...wtf??? 

In any case, this and Lone Echo are the pinnacle of VR games right now
review_feedback: Thank you very much for the nice feedback!

one_reviews_text: Breathtaking visuals and very immersive.  I'm only 2 hours in and I already know this is probably the best game made for VR so far. highly recommended. That makes me want to get a new PC to max out all settings!

**UPDATE 2** I'm now at 52 hours and 76% completion. I'll update a 3rd time when I earn 100% completion. 
--------------------------------------------------------------
**UPDATE** I beat the main campaign at 39 hours (w/ some side missions). Wow, what an experience! This is a must play VR game! My save files says I only completed 53% of the game's content. Time to go back and complete those side missions! 
----------------------------------------------
Thank you Sanzaru for this amazing game and VR  milestone. Sword combat is fluid, feels great, and the parrying mechanics are a lot of fun.  The environments look AMAZING !!!  There's crafting, native VR interactions with grabbing and weapon holsters, and my many many animal companions (loving the shark guy *fist bump*).  This is a game that rivals SkyrimVR and surpasses it because of the native VR controls.  Dont miss out on this title. Stop reading and buy the game already !!!

review_title: Amazing Game Well worth the asking price
one_reviews_text: This is a brilliant game. It is the height of VR. Next to Lone Echo this is my favorite game by far. It is so immersive and fully interactive and deeply layered. It is a vast game but an amazing sense of detail. This game is a must-have.

The game is a little expensive, but I guarentee you that you will not walk away feeling that every penny was not well spent. This is not a 45 minute game, it's atleast 40-60 hours if you plan to do the side missions and upgrade your character.

A must buy, but be warned the system requirements are higher than most games so far.

review_title: A 15 hour experience worth stepping into
one_reviews_text: Asgard's Wrath is testament that the player becomes an actor rather than a puppeteer. I believe VR will elevate the single-player games as an art form. Multiplayer has its own quirks and advantages, but for those gamers who want to become part of a story, then Asgard's Wrath will deliver.

This game doesn't innovate in anyway whatsoever. It's one of the most basic and boring action RPGs I've ever played in my life. The combat is on par with Skyrim VR's which is TERRIBLE, and that's a port! How do you make an action RPG built from the ground up exclusively for VR and have combat this boring? This game feels like a Rift launch title. The years of progress made since then seemed to have been completely ignored during the development of this title.

Most reviews here are from newcomers to VR - they don't know there's far better experiences available. If this is your first VR game, you'll probably love it! But if it isn't, this game will bore you to tears.

Blade and Sorcery is a much more exciting, fun, and satisfying experience. What it lacks in visuals or story it makes up for with actual gameplay. Asgard's Wrath is all flash, no substance.

No controller oriented movemnt Is a big no for me. Once again the focus on player comfort and lack of options to make it more enjoyable for really experienced VR users end up making the game boring. Click a button to climb ladders, Menu based inventory, extremely slow movement speed. I'm sure newcomers to VR will love this but I find it to be really slow and boring with nothing really exciting or unique to it.

Not much to add to what has been said already, but wanted to say this is the type of quality VR game I had began to think would never come.
Everything about this game is top notch, the graphics, sound, music, story the list goes on. 
It does have a few glitches and performance issue but I’m sure they will smoothed out in the upcoming patches.

Highly recommended.

This game is captivating and engaging and you will not forget playing it (unlike many other games that leave you feeling empty and disappointed).  I thought that in terms of length of play and graphics Lone Echo and Arizona Sunshine were going to be difficult to beat,  however, this game tops both of them.  It costs more than a lot of games but that’s because you get so much game!  The graphics are stunning and the music sets a great atmosphere, feels at times like your in an epic movie. You get to play as a human or as a god. Switching between both is great fun. Plenty of content, weapons, puzzles etc. So far I have played 70 hours and just finished it. I am going to restart missions and do all the side missions / quests now....  This is how VR games should be. I would rather pay a high price for a full length game like this than £7 for a game that’s over in an hour.  The creators of this game have done themselves proud and I look forward to the next game.

review_title: Must have for any VR Player!
one_reviews_text: I'm not to far into the game, but WOW. This game really feels like a fully fleshed out AAA title and the download file was HUGE 131? I believe.  It truly is worth the wait though, I do reccommend placing it on an SSD if you have it available because the load screens are pretty long.  Other than that this is a FANTASTIC MUST HAVE RPG!

First real Triple A game on VR. My ony issue with this game is that i have stand for long hours on my feet which is painful for me as i have PLANTER FASCIITIS ! It says in the game details that it can be played while sitting but thats not true.

The best VR game I have ever completed. From start to finish it's gripping, lengthy, and has more than enough variety to keep you enticed. Every new champion brings a whole new game essentially. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a FULL GAME in VR, just like you would get with flat games.

This game is everything VR should be I've put over 40 hours in the game and still have plenty to do this game is a must have if your computer can handle it. I was using an MSI Stealth pro laptop with a GTX 1060 and I was able to play the game with minimal lag, now I have the HP omen with an RTX 2080 and the game is a work of art. Highly recommend.

review_title: Performance issues need to be fixed
one_reviews_text:
Great game from what I've seen so far but it really performs badly on my PC. I have way above the recommended spec 4.2ghz CPU, 16gb RAM, RTX graphics card etc but it jutters like crazy. Sometime it will play ok and then just be unplayable shortly afterwards in the same location. 

My PC is doing nothing else in the background. I know others are having problems too and there is no tweaking of graphics settings either making very difficult to address. I'll gladly update the review if they fix any of the issues but for now it's almost unplayable. I can run any other Oculus title without any issues!

review_title: This is what VR is for!
one_reviews_text: I'm only a couple of hours in and I'm very happy with this game. It's really inmersive and the gameplay is very smooth and fun. I recommend this very much. I thought all those 5 star reviews were fake, until I tried the game. We need more games like this. Also Greek mythology?? sign me in!

Length of the game:
When i buy a game the time i need to complete HAS to match the price, and welp this surely do match the price on the lenght!

Graphics:
another important factor for a triple A, and the game doesn't disappiont you here either, it's easily one of the most impressive looking games I've played so far!

Gameplay:
I dont really have anything negative here either, the way you move in the game is pretty intuitive, although if your prone to movement sickness you probably shouldn't buy it, since you move ALOT! 
though i guess on easy you can just wiggle your sword if your somekinda scrub? cant say since noob mode kinda ruins games for me and have in the last couple of years really not been impressed with games, with developers mindset on making the games so easy it's laughable, BUT if you have the same opinion on that as me you wont be disappionted with this game either! 

Lore:
the norse lore is a bit iffy, and kind of mixed together with some other mythologies, but it's not anything game wrecking, and if your not somekinda mythology nerd like me, they have gotten quite close on alot of things, and the game lore is quite enjoyable , and well put together!

Final judgement:
This game will be one of those games that are gonna be remembered for VR, like DOOM is for pc (by having taken gems in the rough, polished the ____ out of them, and incorporated them into their own masterpiece!), and are gonna set a new bar for vr games!
Soooo if your in any kinda doubt (and dont have somekinda potato computer), you should really give this a go, cause if your any kind of rpg gamer, then i will guaranty your gonna enjoy this game!

review_title: Very Pretty But Spoiled By Quirkiness
one_reviews_text: The game starts off very pretty and intriguing but then you feel as if there is too much "welcome to Vr" quirkiness which breaks the immersion. The game tries to make it seem like there is a learning curve for VR which there isn't! because it is like reality. I don't think there is any special design requirements for Vr and ports like fallout 4, skyrim vr and doom vfr turn out better than this spoonfeeding pantomime quirkiness they are trying to make for us.

This looks like a great game but unfortunately the screen keeps going black in critical moments. As an example - when the kraken grabs you on the first stage the screen goes blank. It looks an excellent game but considering a refund due to this issue. None of my other games experience this. This is the reason for the 3 star.

i think its really good game but the only thing that sets me back from playing all the time is the loading time. for me it takes somewere around 15 minutes. ok maybe not 15 minutes but that's what it feels like realisticaly it would be maybe 3 minutes idk. so if your getting this game keep that in mind

review_title: I love it! - Here are some combat tips
one_reviews_text:
From the first moment on I loved Asgard's Wrath. It's really immersive and fun and it has a very minimalistic HUD.
But then it happened... After I reached the enemies where you have to parry to destroy the armor I died. Again and again. I got a little bit frustrated.

...until I learned how to "fight the system" so I could fight the enemy. Here's why I got problems:

-I repositioned myself the whole time and got too close to the enemy. If this happens, you'll get kicked back, which is frustrating, if it happens all the time.
JUST STAND STILL if your enemy is approaching you in close combat. (unless he uses his red glowing attack, of course)

-My animal companion attacked the shielded enemy (which does no damage this early in the game) and interrupted its attack animations. This made it more difficult to parry the attacks.
COMMAND YOUR COMPANION TO STAND IN A CORNER if you're fighting a single shielded enemy.

-I fought back. Yes, that's a problem. And yes, I knew you can't damage shielded enemies (at least on the higher difficulty settings). I just thought it's stupid if I just stand there and parry/block until the enemy does his blue attack. But hitting the enemy in between its attacks made it difficult for me to react fast enough to parry the blue attack. So...
JUST STAND THERE AND BLOCK/PARRY UNTIL THE ENEMY UNLEASHES ITS STRONG BLUE ATTACK to remove its shield. And only THEN start to fight.

Now I still am not perfect, but atleast the combat is now fun and engaging and not frustrating anymore.
(I reached an arena where you can fight infinite (?) waves of enemies and with this tactics I got to the boss with little to no problems or frustration. AND IT WAS EPIC.)

Man, initially I just waited for Stormlands and thought this is an okay looking game, but now I can't get enough of it.
This is the best game I played in my life! I‘m 53 years old and I played many games. But Asgard‘s Wrath is so exciting. I makes me feel young again!

Buy the game. It's very good. If you like God of War, Skyrim, etc.. you will like this game. It has all the elements you would expect in an RPG. It is well made, presented well, and plays well. Best full RPG style game so far, bar none.

WARNING ! The first couple hours are slow. I almost returned it because it seemed shallow at FIRST..... KEEP PLAYING. As the game progresses, so do you ! You gain new weapons, abilities, etc.. Enemies get more challenging too. At just over 5 hours, I LOVE this game. For those complaining about physics based combat : there is a place in the gaming world for both. Physics based combat doesn't always work correctly either - and in a fantasy RPG, I think it's better this way. Why would it be fun to just one 'stab' kill every enemy. There would be no reason to make your weapons more powerful if they all kill with one stab or whatever. 
As you move on. The game get's really cool and varied. Best VR game I've played yet, and I've played a TON of them. BUY IT NOW, THANK THEM LATER !

review_title: Run Great and looks even better
one_reviews_text: This game run great on my Ryzen 1500x, GTX 1060 6gb and 16gb of ram. From second I turned the game on I was in awe and amazed by the scale, you cant tell this games was made from the ground up with VR in mind. A real VR game with over 30 hours of content and no microtransactions is well worth the $40.00 bucks.

So if you read some of the other reviews you will expect to this to be better than Skyrim and Lone Echo.  I'm going to be the honest one and tell you its not better than either. Skyrim offers by far the longest and very immersive RPG game play when you mod it and while this offers some elements its not really close if I'm being honest. Lone echo offers THE most immersive gameplay of ANY VR game to date and this while being very immersive and a good story isn't to the same level, it's close though. But there are positives to the game.  It is fun although its three difficultly levels need to be reworked as they are each rather close with very little difference.       
The dynamics and puzzles in the game are fun and the graphics are rather nice and add to the enjoyment. 
If you are on the fence in your choice wait for a sale. Get this at 50% off and it will be worth it.      
Hopefully by then all of the bugs will be worked out. There are numerous folks, myself included, that have issues with stutter during the game and also the game does end up crashing at times even with a beefy gaming pc like mine.   
The ending is a bit anti climatic to be perfectly honest. I won't give it away but lets just say you'll probably be asking what at the end.
I do think DLC or a second part would be a good choice, maybe explore the Greek mythos as the Viking mythos is way over done.

I really hate all the liars..some people aree boosting the can play game on max with anti alysing on 2...this is a NOT possible. I have a 2080ti. I9 pc. And it stutters low fps. Its horrible. Also this game is beautiful yes. But its nog sharp at all. Its low res. Its horrible. Give option to put anti aliasing off. Also graphic option are lame. You dont even know what you are changing. I try to call company no answer i try to email. No answer. This is crap. I dont want refund game is verry good. But pleas...fixthis mess
review_feedback:
Hello, we are really sorry that you are having issues with the game. 
The best way to get support is through Sanzaru's discord. https://discord.gg/BmvdCP

We added some fixes in the first patch, and we are adding new graphic options in the next patch, that hopefully make your experience better.

one_reviews_text:
Finally a great game, sure there are other fun games out there, but this one seems to have scale to it, and arent as repetative due to the combat system, that puts you inside different characters. 

This is a must have game, one that puts down a yardstick, for future games of this kind, to be messured against.

review_title: Awesome RPG. Runs Greats on my GTX1080
one_reviews_text: Im only a few hours in but this is one of the best RPGs ever. There's a reason its 160gb. it's because the textures and characters are absolutely beautiful and very detailed. Runs great at 100% resolution scale on my GTX 1080 founders edition, i7 8700, 32gb ram, and generic SSD. Very little ASW. Load times have never exceeded 20 seconds either.
Varied gameplay, great esthetic and graphics
Best VR game yet!

This game is awesome! It starts very simple and easy but becomes difficult after some hour of gameplay. There are many places where you have to return to already played places to unlock new sidequests and paths. Graphics are also very very good my Vega 64 cant play it on Epic(but on High and it looks great). I already played around 10 Hours and i dont even think about "well its enough". 40 Euro is a good amount for a VR game since many VR games are more like Demo Games. This one is a real Full RPG Single Player game with easily 30h +! This game is well programmed and i didnt had Bugs or Crashes. Its worth every Euro you will spend. Take it and be happy :)
I have looked everywhere for a dragon egg and cant find one i sold my first one and was wondering if there was anyway i could find a second or do i have to start over

review_title: THIS IS WHAT VR WAS MADE FOR BABY!!
one_reviews_text: Amazing!! ive put in 8 to 9 hours at this point and still seeing new things! Ive unlocked multiple characters with different moves and attacks. Its hands down the best game in VR at this point. There needs to be more games like this one! Thank yall so much! Worth the 40 bucks!! A MUST BUY! STOP READING THIS AND BUY THIS BABBBYYYY!!!

I’m only 3 hours in and feel like it’s just beginning to be the greatest adventure I’ve ever experienced.  Will update! 
Update : I’m 18 hrs in and I’m still engrossed in the story and insane amount of content. I never want it to end.

review_title: Ermergard ashard. Finally a AAA VR game
one_reviews_text: It’s just amazing. So much detail put into this thing. Only issue I have is it takes 5 FRIGGIN years to load anything.
