I have a decked out machine but this thing is massive (at over 120gb of HD space, which says a lot about the quality too). You will feel like a warrior — a god — a bad A magician. This game tops nearly every VR game built when it comes to graphical quality, fun, story, and thank god — length of playability.

review_title: Good Game. All is saying but ....
one_reviews_text:
1/2 Star is loosing because a AAA Game must have more Languages.
1/2 Star is loosing because I don´t know how I can youse the Things what i have found and there is no help how I can do it. For PRO Gamers in that category it will be easy Thing but not for me.
It is time after some Years that I will ever give no Star for not enough Languages 
for a AAA or over 29,00  Euro Game. 
But a lot of other cool Things are in that Game. Buy recommendation from me.

After some Hours I must say that that game is to hard for me.
The Language is the biggest problem to mix that komplex items with the story.
My weapons are sometimes lauphable. Nothing happens to my opponent. 100 and more hits are no problem for them. You must do the right thing but what is the right thing??? 

charging process between is to long

Oh my lord. Iam a quest user and this game was one of  the reasons I was so excited with the quest link that I purchased a decent vr pc. The game is a m a z i n g... The graphics are superb the motion the magic. Everything. I wore my manowar t-shirt and iam ready for battle. Lol.One question to the incredible devs. I own an i7-9700f with RTX 2060 6gb and 16gb of ram. The game runs very well in high settings with  very little slightly drop frames if it gets into too much action. I know I can't play in ultra settings.to you think by updating the ram to 32 gb I could play in ultra? Coz I wont change the gpu so soon. Thanks a lot. Greeting from Greece

Ok, so far I've only done first 3 tombs so I'm only starting, a bit of exploration (read - picking flowers) and only just gotten into some fight and I'm having a blast. I really love Lone Echo but Asgard Wrath seems to be the first game that really got my blood pumping. I can't really say much abouit the story, it's too early to judge but the gamplay so far is amazing.
Performance is very good. I run it on Epic setting on i7-7800K @3,7GHz; GTX 1080 and 32GB DDR4 RAM, but I do have it installed on SSD.
I get some stuttering outside when I move to fast but in general can't rally fault anything.
I will update this once I finnish the game but so far it's excelent.

And Oculus, so this runs on my mid range laptop through oculus link and I am loving it. OK so the setting are pretty much all on low but it works which I must admit I did not expect - I thought I would be needing  a refund. This must be very well optimised thank the (Norse) gods. Looks amazing to me,  I can't imagine how good this must look running on a beast at full res.
This is exactly the kind of VR experience we have all been waiting for, epic, beautuful, detailed and long.  Dont think I want to play flat screen games again.

This is absolutely a AAA title. My sister and I were both blown away by how good it looked, how smooth it has been playing(I7 7700 + 1060 6gb + 16gig ram) we didn't realize the Rift could reach such fidelity levels.  

The load screens can be a bit much, but everything looks and plays so well after them, and there aren't too many, that I didn't think it was worth docking a star, especially since I am on a Laptop with a 1060 not the recomended 1080. 

The movement controls work very well for me on the medium settings while my sister uses the full immersion. I was able to play Skyrim VR but it did give me a bit of motion sickness pretty much from the getgo. That was not the case with Asgards wrath, however I did start to get a bit of tightness around my eyes after about an hour or so of play so I did need to set it down for a bit. I can play beat saber for hours on end no problem, but free moving games like this or Az Sunshine can somtimes trigger motion sickness like symptoms for me. By and large though I did not have any major motion sickness issues and look forward to many more hours of play. 

I really can't over emphasize how amazing everything looked, particularly the character models in the tavern.  There were definitely areas where I could tell they were using very flat textures, practically painted on, but again given the hardware I brought to the table, the smoothness of the experience, and the broad visual fidelity I remain blown away. 

Gameplay wise I like the parrying system, absolutely love being able to go back and forth between "God mode" and "mortal mode". The puzzles are fun and I am really looking forward to getting into the crafting system. 

If you have been waiting for a proper RPG, this is the game for you.
review_feedback: Thank you so much for the review. We are glad you enjoyed it!

one_reviews_text:
"The best VR game yet" seems a strong statement but I honestly think it's true, this game is a serious AAA quality masterpiece.  Everything about it oozes class - the graphics are stunning, the gameplay is both fun and challenging, and the sheer attention to detail puts this head and shoulders above pretty much everything released so far.

Edit: Just completed the story after 35 hours and it was a brilliant journey. Still a few dungeons to find though and tons of small stuff to do to head towards 100% completion.

review_title: A long high quality VR sword game
one_reviews_text:
For those who wanted to go into VR and have virtual sword fights, this is as good as it gets before we get vr treadmills or force feedback.

This is no skyrim, you aren't in a sprawling open world you can run in every direction. But the combat is solid, the graphics are great, and it has a ton of content. This is the closest we have to VRs system seller.

It does have its limitations though. Namely, its single player, so those who are mostly social VR players, you might have to pass. But anyone who enjoys VR, god of war, and dark souls might find this as some happy medium.

In my opinion this is the 1st must have game in VR. This is why i baught a VR head set. To be honest i have been a bit disapointed so far with a lot of 2-4 hour games that i had some fun with or a ton of wave shooters but nothing i really loved to play. I know VR was not a money maker for developers and they had limited resources BUT i think thats turning aroud. Epic Job on this game!

Not that far in yet but good lawd. This is what VR games should strive towards. Controls are great, smooth frame rate, sound and voice acting are on point. I did have some problems when my companions would try and high five (noteably the turtle) and it wouldnt complete but outside of that an A+ experience so far. Can't wait to jump back in.
VR is here to stay and this game prove just that. Asgard's Wrath is hands down best VR first person game experience ever. I'm very sensitive to motion sickness but haven't once experience any.

review_title: game is awsome, but performance issues.
one_reviews_text: so i went and bought a new processor and MB and new ddr4 ram, new powersupply, basically every thing new except the GFX card. but i still have stutters when moving. i had a 2070ti that i tested on it, but with older processor, and had the same issue. right now i have a 1060 6g and that should still play fine when turning down many settings and tweaking.  sucks becuase the game itself is purely amazeballsogna

I'm very impressed  by this game , just wow !!!
PS: i had found a bug  in the first quest where you need to find the six patrons : when you enter the "inn" , there is NO music , the orchestra  is playing muted , that's weird.

I was almost losing hope to get a great game like this in a near future - and then, bam, this beautifully done, solid, fun & engaging, full-length (multi-day) RPG. Easily my favorite VR game so far (sorry Lone Echo, you've been moved to the 2nd place :))
The game doesnt download. After 10 or so gigs are downloaded it resets back to the start :(

This game is great, until its not. And it often isnt. 

My god the loading screens. I play vr to be in the game. To be in the world. NOT TO SIT STARING AT ONE LAME QUOTE FOR UP TO 5 MINUTES>

For point, I play on a 16gb RAM SD harddrive supported by an i7 7700k and GTX 1080ti. This isnt a hardware issue its a assest loading issue. I kept getting so annoyed by it I dies half a minute after loading........... IT LOADS THE SAME TIME! timed it. 3 28 secs. awful.

So listen the game is great when you can play it. and if you dont mind standing in your house staring at nothing waiting to try the lame battle mechanics again because of the unblockable attacks and dumb lack of hit boxes when I LEGIT THROUGH AN AXE THROUGH THAT GUYS LEG AND HE IS UN DAMAGED cause its a parry system???? Bother. not for 40 bucks. not when the game decided to waste 2 hours of my time because I pulled up the giant draw bridge pulley system too early or wrong and spend 2 hours loading back and forth trying to figure out what I didnt do...... nope had to close the game and reload it.

oh and oculus policy is two hours of game play......... THAT INCLUDES LOADING

so I will forgo oculuc exclusives and buy my games of a different platform from now on. You can shove fbook up your port hole with your terrible customer service.  Im gonna go sit at the DMV to recreate the FUN i had playing this game.... wait for me........
Exceptional game.

This is the best VR-experience, i've ever made...
It's a Full game with all a real game needs. good story, cool mechanics, puzzles, action, upgrades, loot 'n level, credible characters, a cool battlesystem, great graphics and a lots of hours of main story. And even if the story is done, theres still a lot to discover and to figure out. 
I think the game is compareable with darksiders, or soulreaver. you can always return to the older maps, and open new ways and secrets with your new abilities and companions. There are some different kinds of upgrades (Yggdrasil saplings, upgradeable hero gear, upgradeable companions, etc.). 
Usualy you buy VR-games, because of the VR-experience. But I think, I would buy this game, even if it where non-VR.

review_title: Best RPG for VR till now
one_reviews_text: This Game has very good controls, stunning graphics and a long playtime. But it's not just that! There are many gameplay ideas which offer a great variety. You are playing different characters which all have a different gamestyle and weapons. In addition there are many animal companions which can help you with different puzzles. And on top of that you often switch to the god form to absolve puzzles and even fights. Thats a variety which is rare in likewise non-vr RPGs!
JUST WOW THE BEST GAME I EVER PLAYED IN A LONG TIME..
Immersive and fun gameplay and impressive graphics, recommended for all!

review_title: VR needs more games like this!
one_reviews_text:
This is awesome, not just a mini game. A full game with great graphic and a story.
The possibility to play this with friends would be awesome :D
And a little change to enter the inventory would be great so you dont need to got to the menue first but its a great game.

Great environments, characters, animation and sound, with wonderful music, decent voice acting and, perhaps most importantly, plenty of content to sink your teeth into (if my measly completion percentage after several hours of play is anything to go by).

There's a lot more to like here too - a configurable inventory system which lets you place weapons in various locations on your body so you can grab your shield by reaching over your shoulder or draw your sword from your waist, without having to wade through menus as in Skyrim.

Switching between god and human forms also mixes things up nicely (from your divine perspective humans appear to be an inch or so high and the environment now seems like a cool diorama spread before you).

Having said that there are a few flaws. Firstly the menu option to disable head based locomotion seems to be broken which is really frustrating as it results in your avatar staggering drunkenly from side to side if you look around whilst walking. Please fix this devs - "controller relative" locomotion should be a standard feature by now in any VR game so it's disappointing not to have this working at launch. An option to move a bit faster would also be welcome, as would the ability to climb more (currently when you grab a chain or ladder you teleport to the bottom).

The combat is also a bit too event based for my taste. Many of the enemies are totally invulnerable until you parry their special move after which you get a brief window during which you can actually damage them. You can't just spot an opening and strike, and it really doesn't help immersion when you see your sword clearly slice through an enemy's neck but have no effect whatsoever.

Finally, the HUD can be a bit intrusive at times with prompts like "Press A to talk to someone" 3 or 4 times larger than they need to be. 

Anyway, hopefully some of these issues will be addressed in patches, but even in its current form this is an essential purchase for any VR gamer!
review_feedback:
We appreciate the great review. 
Regarding controller relative locomotion, we are planning to add it to the next patch. We are listening to the requests as much as we can.

one_reviews_text: The bar has been raised. Significantly. I am not a fan of this type of game. (Skyrim, etc...) I bought this because  I wanted to see what the 1st AAA in VR looks like. Within 1 minute i realized that this game is a visual and immersive Tour De Force. If you like exploration/adventure, you will not be disapointed. Every time i play this, i take off my HMD and feel like ive been on a journey to a fantasy land. This is the realization of the dream of VR, which is to transport you to "somewhere else" . Well worth the price. Easy 5 Stars!
review_feedback: Thank you so much. We love hearing that the immersion worked well.

review_title: Mechanics for the bow and arrow
one_reviews_text:
The mechanics for the bow and arrow feel good but not great. I feel the aiming is good but grasping for the arrow when drawing back could be improved. So far an amazing game. Can't wait to keep playing.

Sorry for previous review.

review_title: The New Bar Has Been Set
one_reviews_text:
Asgard's Wrath is what a quality VR game looks like. I've played other really good RPGs in VR. Skyrim, Fallout 4, Vanashing Realms, etc... None can compare to Asgard's Wrath (AW). 

AW has it all and it's all done SO well. Firstly, the graphics are incredible. My rig isn't the latest and greatest, but it gets the job done. I run AW on the lowest graphical setting. It looks amazing. Environments are so rich in detail, I find myself exploring every corner just to admire the scenery.  The characters and enemies you encounter are fantastic and varied. 

Secondly, the gameplay. Combat is smooth and incredibly fun. The mechanics feel natural. You parry, block, slash, stab, shield bash, anything you can do in a pancacke (flat screen) RPG, you can do here, but naturally. This isn't a flick your wrist until it's dead kind of combat. You actually have to develop some combat skills.

Combat is only a part of this game. There are puzzles galore! If you've played the Darksiders or Legend of Zelda series, you'll have an idea of the flow of this game. You'll find yourself gladly going back to areas you've already visited, to find access to new areas with the new powers you've gained. There are things hidden everywhere! You'll need to search in god and mortal form to find things. There is a ton of loot. Your enemies will drop their weapons when you defeat them. It's not like those games where you fight an enemy with a flaming blade and it disappears after the battle. 

Thirdly, the story. It's EPIC! The story is based in Norse mythology and is dripping in lore. I'm not going to go into detail here. You need to experience it yourself. Just know that you'll be visiting many environments that will keep you busy for at least 35+ hours. My suggestion is to take your time. 

FInal verdict: This is a true AAA game. If you haven't bought an Oculus Rift S yet, Asgard's Wrath is why you should. Well done, devs!

ive played alot of vr games at this point and seen alot of things done very well and others not so much this falls into the grey area in alot of places. a menu based inventory system in vr games is something i thought we moved past by now. combat while advertised so heavily has been lackluster. the impact of a hit visually just isnt there. i would like more then just some blood splatter to let me know this heavy looking sword hit the enemy. climbing really, no climbing just touch a ladder and teleport okaaaay. this feels exactly like every other AAA vr game, looks good on paper but its like the developers never seem to be actual vr gamers. but hey they know how to make good graphics so lets just take that and stand there and act happy right???

- Didn't enjoy the "wait for the blue attack" passive combat at all, and on easy it was just TOO easy.
- Followers totally useless in combat.
- No running/sprint outside combat... zzzzzzzzzzz.
- Object manipulation really poor.
- Primitive puzzles.

+ Really nice presentation - lovely scenery, good music, solid voice acting.
+ Entertaining story.
+ Lots of content, albeit repetetive.

review_title: Man created VR, and it was good.
one_reviews_text: And it was only the beginning.  Guy below me (TF2Pro), if you're not joking, may the Nordic Gods have mercy on your soul.  To review a game you haven't even played is to smite the developers who creatith it.  Your PC and most possibly wit do not contain the requirements to play it (get another hard drive).
If you liked Skyrim this is for you.

Think it's the first time a game as lured me to actually write a possitive review ! Have played only a few hours in and am already wanting to go back while being blown away. The content is massive and the controls are fitting. Took me a little bit of time to accept having a bit more narrow shoulders but other then that tracking and appearance is well done.

Story line, music play all align properly giving a true immersed experience ! Hoping to see more of these games coming from the studios ! 

As a last, for playing hardware i've used the below. I'm using a laptop as i'm quite mobile with my set throughout the country.

Settings have been maxed out (epic) with no tunneling and regular turning (i hate snap/teleporting). Played on a Alienware 17R4/i7/ssd2/16gb ram unit and the Occulus Rift CV1. 

Amazing. 9.5/10

So ive played all the "aaa" titles on the rift, and honestly havent been impressed with any. The big talk of games like lost echo and now asgards wrath with there" amazing graphic's" all look like old 360 games to me. But that aside ,full of glitches as well, my time played is as long as i could play, before the game broke and i could not toast loki. But the 10 min i played was...so-so

review_title: I need help and don't know who to ask.
one_reviews_text:
From the videos I've seen about this game and other people's reviews I DON'T doubt that this is an awesome game, I just need help to get mine running.

I get as far as going through the portal on the rainbow bridge and then it always crashes in the loading screen and I have no idea what to do. Hoping to get a developer response on this one because I'm not getting help from the Sanzaru discord.

I have a very high end system so I don't know why this is happening,

RTX 2080 Ti
i9- 7980XE CPU 2.60GHz
32gb RAM
Driver 441.41
What a game!!!! Glad I got it

This game is amazing.
Impressive work by Sanzaru. They made a real AAA game for the VR.
Finally we can enjoy a full RPG adventure in viking mithology and in VR.

The game itself is the mixture of different gameplay styles: there is a bit of skyrim, god of war 4 and many others but, this time, with the full native support of VR, thus making this game really unique.

Sanzaru made a wonderful job with the melee and ranged combat system.
You cannot anymore kill an enemy just waving around your weapon aimlessly.
You need to parry, block and attack at the right time and you also need to master those mechanics, otherwise you'll die badly.

The follower system is very good.
Those animals are not only your companions, they are also your pets, so you need to make a bond with them, show your appreciation and take care of them.
The more they are happy the better!
Sometimes they'll find objects for you, more powerful if the pets are happy and strong! So keep them happy and make them stronger!

The control system is almost intuitive, although it could be problematic for the left handed (I'm ambidextrous).
There are plenty of options for motion and rotation (but no teleportation).
I like full freedom in VR, so I'm using full motion and full rotation with no motion sicness at all.

There are 4 level of graphic details: low, medium, high, epic.
Of course, the epic setting level requires a very high end pc, but I'm enjoying the game even at medium with some compromises (some world details are missing to lower GPU requirements and CPU draw calls).

I'm playing with an i5 3570K@4.4GHz - GTX 1060 6GB - riftS - 32GB - HDD on MEDIUM with NO STUTTERS and almost no microstutters.
Loading time of about 13-18 sec between fast travel.
You can lower the loading time down to 9 sec with SSD but only if your PC has a good motherboard.

Although there is only the english language, and for a AAA game this is bad, I gave 5/5 because it costs only 40€ and not 60€
review_feedback: Thank you very much for the great review! The team appreciates it.

one_reviews_text: Great game but when I first bought it, it took several tries until the game downloaded but after being quarintined I thought to play it and relized how great of a game it is I recomend it.
I am a multiplat gamer and I buy every AAA title worth playing and this is not only the best VR game but also the best game of 2019.  No Boneworks and Beatsaber are not better games.

review_title: 5 stars is not enough to rate.
one_reviews_text: I cant stop playing this VR game it is amazing and by far the best game ive played hands down. I love it and I want to see more.

Up until this moment VR has been a series of casual games, tech demos and reskins. This is the first true VR game to ever be released.  The visuals are unmatched. The combat is kinda like dark souls, relying on parrying and timing... Which is tricky at first, but then becomes amazing.  The characters are interesting... And this is a FULL game. Like 40+ hours potentially. They did a great job of allowing people new to VR play it in a comfortable and easy way... Or give experienced players full control (including removing all UI elements). After 3 hours so far I'm hooked! Every new location is more beautiful than the last... It's the first VR experience I've had that I really feel like I'm in the game!

This would easily be $60 on steam. So thanks to the devs for the awesome price too!  To be honest tho... This price makes things like Vader immortal even more if a rip-off.

**Update** so a little tip.  Look into the crafting early.  There's no real instructions. I got to a point that I was getting hammered on every fight. I lowered the difficulty to the medium level and still couldn't win... Then I went to the Smith and realized I could level up my character... A lot... So the game difficulty was going up and I wasn't leveling to meet it... Lol.
Seems pretty good and well worth the asking price from the bit that I have played so far:).

review_title: A title worth buying a VR headset for
one_reviews_text: Absolutely love the game. This is the first VR title that makes me want to stay in VR for hours and keep coming back. Love the crafting, the humor, the puzzles. Just so many details that have been lacking in VR titles thus far. Very impressed and looking forward to more!

Where do I start? This is a AAA full length VR Fantasy Adventure. They have knocked it out of the park with this one. 

it's Exceeded all of my expectations.. This is how VR games should be, I am 44 years old and tonight I felt like a kid again. Grinning from ear to ear as Asgards Wrath unwrapped itself before me.

If you have a VR headset you need to get this game.. WOW.. WOW.. WOW

Worth every penny.

review_title: Great game! A word about load time.
one_reviews_text:
Like the a lot of the other reviews have mentioned, this game is a blast! 5 stars!

I did have issues with load time. It was taking 1.5 minutes everytime I went somewhere or when I died. It's a little frustrating that it unloads all the assets on death. Why not just keep the textures and models in memory and just reinitialize the objects?

So 1.5 minutes was way too long to wait. I made some room on my Evo 970 Pro NVMe drive. Load times dropped to 20 seconds, a sagnificant result. I've done this with other games such as GTA V and did not get anything close to that result. If you have enough solid state storage to spare, it seems to really boost load times.

There was one particular section where fire traps insta-kill you. I kept getting killed even though it seemed like the fire was not touching me. This was especially furstrating since every time I died, I had to wait 1.5 minutes (before I moved to NVMe). I would love to see quicker load times after death. Like I mentioned earlier, it seems a shame that the game does a clean wipe on memory when you die. Keeping the assets around in memory seems like some low hanging fruit in the quality of life department.

review_title: The VR system seller that was hoped for!
one_reviews_text: Excellent AAA RPG with tons of polish and attention to detail. Aboslute must buy for any VR fan.  I rank this above everything else in VR due to the amount of gameplay. Much, much, longer than those other top tier titles that this is being ranked with. And longer doesn't mean added fluff and simple fetch quests to pad out the hours.  Every area is very detailed and varied and the game gives you reasons to want to continue playing long after most traditional 'longer' games become boring - It has Excellent and varied VR combat with different upgradable weapons and abilities, different enemy types including bosses and mini bosses, different hero types with different upgradable abilites, different minion types with upgradables abilities, hidden and unlockable treasures that require revisiting areas after getting upgrades, excellent story and voice acting, incredible graphics (the best I've seen yet in VR)., excellent sound and music. I could go on and on. If ony we could get more of this type of game.

review_title: Great game, you won't be dissapointed!
one_reviews_text:
Since the excellent gamplay and visuals have been reviewed, I'll comment on performance.

Be prepared to swing with your melee weapons! This game has the added bonus of excersize.. I unfortunately broke my rift headphone when I stepped on the cable and yanked it off my head. However this was a blessing in disguise, as my performance was much better using dedicated headphones through my motherboard sound instead of the Rift's.  Something to try if you're having stuttering issues. I'm now running it on High with max scaling on an i7 5820 and a 1080ti.

This is by far the best Game-Experience ive ever had and still have!!!! I really love this Game and now cant live my Life without it, I AM TOTALLY ADDICTED TO THIS!!! 
The Feeling in Fight and Story is undescribeable (sry bad eng). After a few Enemies im soaked in Sweat from slaying and yelling, the Riddles are well done, i love this little Hulubuludun..(weird Name) Gnomes. The Animalcompanions are cleverly integrated and fun to highfive them :D the Enemies look awesome and are grim Fighters, i loved to tear off the Ogers 2 Heads XD but the most innovative and epic Gamefeature is that change from Ingrid to a God what you have to consider in many Riddles, great Feature! Asgard´s Wrath is the most Creative Game since a long Time for me! 
If you like Action-Adventure Games and nordic Mythology you will love this! 40 Euro is totally worth it with about 40 Hours of Content.

I'd really like to recommend this game - few others seem to have my problem... but it is game breaking. Most textures just won't load beyond the "low" setting, even when on medium or high. Everything just looks *terrible*. On Epic, it looks amazing, but it also makes me nauseous because I can't hold the framerate.

Oh, also the movement options are pretty bad IMO - head-steering movement by default? Man, barf-city. I turned it off, and thought that had fixed it, but after I while I realised it's not controller-steering (e.g. Onward), like most VR free-movement games nowadays, but still head-steering... just when you turn your head "forward" doesn't change. "Forward" was whatever direction you were looking when you started moving.

review_title: The best VR game I ever played
one_reviews_text:
The game is awesome! Seriously! The graphic is gorgeous, even with medium settings, and it runs smoothly even with my old 1060 6GB, and thanks to my SSD the loading time is no more than 10 seconds. The companions system is really great, the combat system of the "easy mode" is engaging and fun, the puzzles are cool and not too difficult, the story is good, and there is an incredible amount of content.
JUST BUY THIS GAME!!!

So, why 4 stars instead of 5, you ask? This is freaking why...
The combat system in "normal" and "hard" mode breaks a lot of the fun. The "armor" system used doesn't work so well. Enemies with an armor can't take any damage, and the only way to break the armor is by parrying theyr "special blue attacks" with your melee weapon. This cause a lot of problems at the game mechanics: 
1) You are forced to use a melee weapon. You can't have another style of combat, because there is no way to break the armor from the distance with an arrow or an axe, or by magic (except for upgraded weapons that you can craft in the late game).      
2) If there are multiple enemies with an armor, your companion will be useless because he can't break it. The only way to make him do it, is to use a Frenzy potion to activate his special attack. Otherwise he will die miserably because the enemy can kill him but he can't kill the enemy.    
3) If there is just a single armored enemy, your companion presence is more than useless. Is annoying. His attacks will break most of the animations of the enemy, included the "special blue attack", making impossible to break the armor.

Just an idea for Asgard's Wrath 2 (if it will ever come out one day) : breakable armor pieces on the body of the enemy. You just have to hit that specific body part to break the armor. This way you can choose how to do it (with a sword, with an arrow, with magic). This way you can also choose the right companion based on his style of combat that could have different ways to target specific body parts.

review_title: A Must have game , vr at its best
one_reviews_text: I got this gane after reading a few reviews and i have not been dissapointed. I have only played a few hours but i'm already hooked, i'm not usually an rpg fan but in vr it's a different story. This game does take up a lot of storage and you have to increase you vitual memory for it to run smooth(loads of info on the net about how to do this) but it does run very well. I did get a bit of a sick feeling when i first played but after a couple of sessions it has stopped. the position of your body in this game is spot on and when you get into battle you really feel like your fighting, you really do feel like you have been taken to a different land. Even if your not into this type of game i suggest that you get it, this is the future of vr and it shows what can be done. This game is a bargin at £30 and with the side quests and main game it will last ages, i can see myself re playing this game if i ever complete it. THIS GAME IS AMAAAAAAAZING, JUST GET IT.

Without a doubt the most immersive experience I've yet tried. There I was slaying ghouls, high-fiving my companion and drinking in the tavern after winning a game of coin toss to a drunk toad. And that is when I realized I was still playing the tutorial. The real game left me with tears of joy streaming down my (real) face. If this is VR today just imagine what lies ahead. Just absolutley mindblowing.

review_title: BEST GAME TODAY, loose other VR garbage
one_reviews_text:
@OCULUS GARBAGE: my installation is corrupt, WHERE IS THE VERIFY INSTALLATATION BUTTON WTF, gonna need 6 hrs again to put this correctly on my SSD, thanks facebook! >:(

Bought this on day of release and HOLY COW! (omg oculus censored pff) 
after an complete evening (6hrs!!) wasted and a few the day after of trying to install this 130GB!! (awesome!!) game through some broken oculus home app. i finally managed it to put it on my SSD drive. (moved from regular HDD, since 139GB seemed not enough to install)

BOY WHAT A JOY!
throw all your made in a basement garbage games in the bin and install this.

This is an really well put together RPG with a ton of content. 40 bucks is a steal if you compare this to all Garbage what is on VR today (few exceptions)

Best thing is i run this on my 3570k @4,3Ghz with an RX580 8Gb and this runs great and looks great as well! (might be medium settings, dunno

awesome job Devs, perhaps give a course to all other devs who make games with an ingame depth of a bowl of muelsi. (yeah like beat s aber i am not 10years old)

review_title: I would love to give this 5 stars but...
one_reviews_text:
So I will start with the negatives as everyone seems to start with the positives

Maybe I have been spoiled by  Blade&Sorcery when it comes to Melee combat because the combat in this is slow and painful it basically comes down to block , block , block , dodge the unblockable attack then parry their super and then get a few hits until their magic armour is gone then repeat till dead , it is very stale and boring so I mostly just sit there dodging as my companion slaughters everything because if I try to not play the slow parry game and instead try to parry then attack before their super attack then you get stun locked automatically by headbuts and kicks you cant block.

The loading times are mind numbingly long even with no background apps running and on a HDD with basically nothing else but other VR games on it.

I made it to the first boss fight with TYR before calling it quits I truly did try to get into this game as it has so much love put into it. Now the boss fight with TYR is basically a timed shooting mini game where you shoot these chained balls before they hit you then hit the blue ball to take off some armour its fairly boring , the best bit is when you get into a fist fight with him but then he goes back to throwing balls. Now the problem here is that after 3 or so shots of my god bow the bow despawns and then I have to regrab it , the problem is that its usually 3-4 shots you need to hit before the blue shot that removes his armour so I basically let the first two shots hit me everytime then shoot the rest and then re grab the bow and hope to god I hit his armour before he gets back up or I lost my chance.

Now on to the god , the textures are great as are the voice acting and enviroment , the puzzles are abit too constant and really break the flow how ever with the combat as boring as it is you're stuck between boring and bland puzzles and boring and bland combat.

How ever the immersion is great and so is the story and Loki is looking hot.

Looks amazing and a fun game but I can't play it because it makes me feel really sick. Have everything set to max comfort. Devs: please can we have arm swinging locomotion like on Westworld as that completely fixed the motion sickness for most people.

This is what VR gaming is all about. Great work by the developers!!! Well done. Gonna have to save up for a new computer though, first VR game that I can't play on max 😅
Buy this game people, it will not disappoint.

Best game availabine in VR hands down. There are little things that could be improved but the developers have a discord that you can raise issues with and they actually address them. Alot of my complaints they are planning on fixing already.

Ridiculous that some people are taking away stars from reviews because of their own mistakes. Lots of people complaining about how you teleport up ladders which isn't realistic.  There is a spot on the first rung that will teleport you but if you just grab anywhere else you can climb the ladder normally.  People need to play a little more before reviewing.

review_title: One of the best VR Games
one_reviews_text: Awesome
Like like like...

One of the best VR games i've seen to date. It's an action RPG with quests, crafting, a companion system and much more. beautiful graphics as well! Very immersive and addicting with fun unique gameplay mechanics. I could go on but just trust the reviews and get it, you wont be disappointed!
Great game.

review_title: Incredibly fun but burdened by issues
one_reviews_text:
To preface, I'd like to say I have a gtx 1080, a ryzen 5 1600, and 16GB of ram. The game is stored on a HDD. 

This game is super super fun... when it works. As listed above, I have a pretty darn beefy system, and yet (on medium settings even), when enemies spawn in or anything remotely graphically intense happens I get major stuttering and many parts around me are just black with the loading hourglass in the bottom right hand corner. This alone makes things really annoying. But aside from that, if the game is not on an SSD, the load times are a little riciulous. I end up waiting a solid 2 minutes and thirty seconds every time I die or want to go anywhere, which is not fun. Granted, this would probably be solved if the game was stored on an SSD. Additionally, combat can be super fun! ....if you dont get stuttering and random parts of your fov not loading in. The parrying system is a little strange - it feels really good when it happens the way it's supposed to, but this seems rare. Often times I'll go to block a swing with the sword in my right hand, but their sword will bounce off the sword in my left hand that didn't do anything. It's pretty glitchy at best, and it lead to a lot of my deaths where I was pretty darn sure that I parried it but their swing went through anyway. Maybe I'm bad, but it definitely didn't feel the way it was supposed to. 
Side note, and this may be a part of the game, but I was unable to heal many times when entering my inventory. I would hold the potion up to my face repeatedly and nothing would happen. Maybe there is a status effect that prevents this, but I don't believe I was told about it. 
Over all, as the title says, the game (when it works) is incredible. My problem is that for my PC, apparently, it doesn't work just enough to ruin the experience.

20hrs in at this point and still amazed. Story, characters, level design, combat, crafting is all very well done. The fights are challenging even on the medium difficulty.  This is how a (VR) game should be. Only criticism i have is, that puzzles are sometimes too easy and the combat could have been more physics based (just nitpicking though). Even though i may be halfway through the game, i already wish this journey will never end. It definetly has replay value due to constant new companions who will give you access to areas you previously weren't able to go. Nonetheless i hope there will be a successor or maybe some dlc in the future.  If you're looking for a full fledged VR game that will keep you playing for hours and hours with pure joy, look no further Asgard is the right place to be in 2019.

review_title: It's good, if you have a SSD
one_reviews_text:
So, the game is good. Nothing mindblowing, but a good and varied adventure game that's kind of linear with tons of secrets and sidequests.

However, I barely play it because each time I open it I spend almost as much time waiting as I do playing. And okay, I get it, I should have a SSD by now, will probably get one within a month. But, if you have a HDD, the loading times are a serious problem.

It's not only that each loading screen is close to 2 minutes, and that it's VR, so you can't wait while browsing your phone. It's that, until you increase your inventory through sidequests, you have to load a whole area to empty it, which doesn't even make sense in the first place. You can always just go to said area and dump your items, or go and grab what you need, so the 4 minute load (two to go to the area and two to go back) doesn't add anything at all to the game.

So it's 2 minutes of loading when you open the game, plus 2 when you change an area, plus 2 every time you die, plus 4 if your inventory gets full... And so there's a lot of just standing in your VR area looking at a loading screen. And I wouldn't really mind... If it wasn't because the 4 terrible minutes you need to empty your inventory are so incredibly pointless. It's just poor design. Reminds me of Fable 3.

Okay, so, there's my rant about loading screens. Other than that, it's a nice game. It's long, varied, and it looks good. So, if you have a SSD or don't mind the loading screens, it's probably a nice grab.

40 bucks is a steal for this game. I played for a full day and didnt get past 10 percent completion. The combat was irksome at first with the need to pary everything but I switched to Mortal difficulty and the game become so much more fun. You truly feel like you are on a heroic quest. Feels like AAA VR is here.
Loving everything about this game.

review_title: The BEST VR game out there!
one_reviews_text: This is by FAR the best VR game I have every played. I really wish the world had more titles like this one. Well worth every penny of the $40 price. I would have paid DOUBLE for it. A full fledged AAA game that will give you hours and hours of gameplay. I love the crafting as well. My personal thanks to the developers for making such a fantastic game. This is exactly what VR needs more of, and I hope to see future titles Asgard's Wrath as well. For those of you who are sick and tired of the same old short VR experiences and games, look no further. The amount of things you get to do in this game is unreal. Trust me, your money will be well worth it. I'm only a few hours into the game and I'm already overwhelmed by it. MUCH LOVE!

The game looks great story looks fun game mechanics seems fun
But the controls suck and arent VR I don't push the doors open they open as soon you clicked your trigger lots of triggers activated animations. Also cant climb a stair just click a stair and you're teleported :( also the fighting isn't really good when I hit an enemy horizontally I cut him in half vertically? How .. Lots of hype but not what I expected.
I love this game also hope came with german synchro

review_title: Do not buy this. it doesn't work.
one_reviews_text:
During the boss fight with whoever he is (other big god, the first one you fight after the Kraken), you're given some kind of bow that you're supposed to grab and draw. Sounds cool until the tracking breaks so badly you can't aim because your hands are sliding into the distance and getting stuck without any kind of tracking with a bow in hand while you're helplessly barraged by explosions. This isn't a hardware issue because it ONLY happens when holding that specific bow in that specific fight (though I couldn't get any farther than that fight because, oh right, the game doesn't work) and tracking (generally) functions just fine in any other circumstance.

I submitted a refund request, but because they have a policy of "2 hours of less playtime" I couldn't refund because it takes more than 2 hours to arrive at the boss. I am left with a completely unresponsive trashbag of a game that I can't even play because of nothing that has to do with me.

I have wasted my $40 and my time, do not buy this game, and frankly, buy any other game that isn't off the oculus store. Buy from another company, because this one is greedy and scamming.

As many have said, this is the kind of games that I was expecting when VR was announced and I am glad of having hold up until the release of rift S for the oportunity of playing games as well though out and made as this one.

Get IT!!!, you will have a blast with it!
Fantastic game, stop waiting to get get it, you won’t be sorry!!

review_title: Best VR experience money can buy!!!
one_reviews_text: Alright folks after i played this game for 2 weeks i can honestly say this is the best VR game i've ever experienced.It sets the standards for future Vr games just like World of Warcraft set the standards for MMORPG.The combat system, crafting,companion,revisiting zones for completion of  challenges like ancient challenges , target practices,puzzles, side quests with future companions is mindblowing. I must thank the developers and oculus for a great experience.I tried alot of games and movies in Occulus store...stuff like Shadow of legends, Elite dangerous,Lone echo,Vader immortal 1 and 2 and movies like Spheres.The only time i haven't felt riped off was honestly with this game Asgard's Wrath. I read alot of comments  with ppl giving like 1 or 2 stars for combat/language/loading time.Folks, you need to realize that this game demands good pc performance not to mention the crucial SSD  .Overall i'm very pleased with this game and the experience. I recomend to all the ppl passioned for Vr. I thank again the developers for doing a very good job for a fairly reasonable price. I imagine it was not so easy . I hope the future of your company will do great and continue to deliver amazing games and experience . The people will always pay good money for a product well done like yours.Keep it up

review_title: Best experience for me on VR so far!!!
one_reviews_text:
Really good game and there are some breath taking moments when you rather look around than continue your journey. 
The combat can be demanding and if you play on anything else than lowest difficulty then some fights can be demanding and pain ful if you not dodge/parry properly.
As you play many different characters, you get the taste of many different combat styles!
Thank you developers! Thank you!

First of all, I have to say I love the game. It looks amazing and on my i5-8400 and the 1080 is going great. I played it in the stream on medium and I think that I can play it without stream on high or epic. To all the complain because it is not so good with a 1060 or so, read what is recommended for a graphics card. The only reason why I give 4 stars and not 5 is because I would like a German voice output or a German subtitle.

Excuse my english. I translated it with Google because I hope it's more understandable then.
review_feedback: Hi! thanks for the nice review! Just wanted to let you know that we are actually working on a patch with translations right now. I can't give you dates, but it's coming!

one_reviews_text: Always get the error "Sorry we couldn’t install Asgard’s Wrath. visit oculus support to get help"

This game is truly the best VR game I've ever played. There is truly an amazing amount of expertly designed content, with perfectly executed gameplay mechanics.  I look forward every day to coming home and playing this, whether to just lob exploding hatchets or flip some coins with a water spirit.

Avast blocks that game.
I think something is wrong with our store.

Graphics are of the best available if you have a system to push it. I ran it on max with a liquid cooled system with no issues. Excellent Audio, Great voice acting. Engaging combat. A ton of subtle touches that really add to the depth of the game. I had no expectations of this game and it ended up being the best VR game I have ever played. Dense with 40 plus hours of game play. This has set a new standard for VR gaming that will be very hard to condend with. It is worth the value of a AAA console game. They have done something great here. People rating this low are obviously trolling or have a system that cannot handle this game properly. It is stunning. I stood there on every corner in awe of the landscape and design. This is a must  have title. I wasn't even aware we were at a stage that this could be done this well.
I felt transported to another dimension. This is such a beautifly done experience I found myself spend so much time just exploring and enjoying all the attention to detail put into this game. A+

This game would be amazing but it needs some major optimization.  Im playing with pm a i7 5820k (6 cores@4.6ghz). 32 gigs ddr4 quad channel and a 2080ti ftw3 ultra and no matter settings i use or resolution the game runs terribly.  Low frame rate and lots of studdering....sad because it could be so good!

Everything has already been said about this - it's simply a must play game, and unlike 99.9% of VR games out there is actually a full on, full length game.

The developers have also been active within the community, taking note of suggestions and ideas, some of which have already been confirmed to be making it into the first patches that are due.

It's worth being aware of the system requirements as they're certainly above the norm for an Oculus store game, but that aside, buy it.

This is the most significant game to come out this year, VR or otherwise. It is a masterpiece. No wonder Oculus and Sanzaru are so proud of it.

Everyone who likes video games needs to experience this.

review_title: Good game, killed by load times
one_reviews_text:
This game is impressive and great looking. But the load times feel like they're a third of the game (each followed by about 10 seconds of black screen). They are abnoxiously long and in one part, I had to sit through the huge load time to get back to the inn, craft an item, sit through a big load time again to get back to where I was to use the item, then sit through a big load time AGAIN to load the next area which the item gave access to for the next part of the story.

My otheer game breaking complaint is the enemy shield bash or kick. With the harder enemies always advancing and kicking/bashing you back when close, it means you must always step back to give ground, or move around. This doesn't work well in a tethered VR space. It means I keep backing in to my VR boundry and having to try and run around the bad guy. But snap turning and cables and not knowing if I'm in a safe place to fight in the physical word, often has me facing another wall. And I don't feel like the fighting in the game should include fighting with a VR play space (3x3 for me). This could be solved by the enemies moving back after a bash so you still get the challenging combat without being backed in to a physical wall.

I have really enjoyed the game though. But the two issues above may stop me from playing it or recommending it to anyone.  Please find a away to preload or lower the load screens, remove the black screen after a load screen and make the combat more VR space friendly

I haven't gasped and felt giddy like a kid playing a game for a very long time. Thanks to the devs/managers/product team/publisher/janitors and everyone involved in seeing this work through that realized we needed a truly VR first AAA title that wasn't some crappy demo turned into a product (there are a few exceptions but content wise and depth/width I feel like this is the first title that has really NAILED what VR can do). I truly hope this is a trend and you have earned a fan and a follower. Please tell me how I can support you to make sure you get to make more content for this game or your next VR title!

After reading reviews for a day, on and off I decided to purchase this game !! loan echo Has been one of my favourite Vr games with fantastic graphic and quality depth and storyline .
Now !!!!!! Asgard’s wrath is amazing graphics and stunning gameplay is Smooth The performance of the game is 10 out of 10 Worth every penny of the price it cost A definite VR game to be kept in your library get it you will not regret it. Thank you sanzaru truly amazing VR game long awaited

review_title: Best VR game ever made up to now.
one_reviews_text: This is the most polished experience I've ever had in a VR game. It is full of details in the environment, the textures, and the NPC's. It has a meaty quest system and storyline. There's so many maps and areas within the maps to explore. The gameplay is fun, there's a lot of variety in weapon types and ways to tackle fights. The companion system adds more depth to the game by giving you a reason to use them outside of battles. The menu system just makes sense for VR. It's very responsive, which I've noticed in a lot of VR games is not the case. The graphics are beautiful for a VR game of this scale. This is THE VR game to buy. If you are on the fence, take the plunge you will not regret it. 9/10 Best VR game ever. My only gripe is you need a decently large play space to fully enjoy the experience. Also when you die you have to load the area again but it's not bad if you have an SSD. This legit feels like the first AAA VR game, and it sets an extremely high bar.

review_title: Great Game But Seriously Large Files
one_reviews_text:
This is going to end up needing it's own hard drive! The latest "patch" alone is  130 Gig. It's a top game but they're going to have to optimise that.

I recommend an SSD as loading times can be long.

This is the game that I've been waiting 5 years for to arrive in VR. It is massive, the sidequests and labryinths will keep you busy for countless hours, and that's aside from the huge main quest. Unbelievable. It is a must buy.

Graphics are beautiful (5/5). The world has great detail and feels like it could be an actual place. 
Game Mechanics are ok (3/5). Gather stuff to upgrade gear and companions. Go to point A preform task, then go to point B and perform task to open up point C. God mode for a nice nostalgic Black and White feel. The menu system is ok but breaks the flow of gameplay.
Combat sucks (1/5). Fighting in the parry required system is not fun. Repetetive and immersion breaking. Using your companions in combat is also not satisfying. Big miss on this one. 
Story is not for me (2/5)? While there is a story I think.. It is not easy to follow. Why am I taking over this Norse hero? Revenge? What? The story just does not suck me in and drive me to want to push on futher. I enjoyed the narrative in Skyrim; but this one is lost on me.

review_title: DOWNLOAD DOES NOT COMPLETE: REFUND REQUE
one_reviews_text: LOOPS BETWEEN DOWNLOADING AND INSTALLING MANY MANY PEOPLE HAVING PROBLEMS ITS LIKE THE CORONA VIRUS OF VIDEO GAMES WEL DONE OCCULUS

i just cant give a 5 star review after exasting myself over even after the training i cant get them to open up for an attack. 25 min of combat on the same guy to me is too much time. some of the bosses were easier than some of the guys out in the roads. Parries only want to work like 1 out of every 100 times and only seems to get worse. I would rather fight larger groups of enimies with differnt weaknesses and openings than wait 8 seconds for some of these guys to swing and pray to the Gods that the parry will actually parry and make them mad. I have wasted my entire inventory on some of these guys. I have spent 2 days on this and I dunno if I'll play much further if its all just parry pray, and light puzzle solve. I want to enjoy this game but wtf. blocking hardly works, the knock you back 20 feet and stab you from 10 feet. you should be able to parry from inside the weapon to all the way to the shoulder. I still cannot figure out the right spot after 3 days and it hardly works at all. I have tought martial arts and this parry and pray is not cool at all. This is not RPG combat either. Don't like it at all. I get technical, statigical, mechanical, but this just feels like bs to extend the game. Make it fun yo.

review_title: Looks good but a dull bore!
one_reviews_text: Still working on getting a refund for this dull bore!!

Was unsure about the game for the first 10-15 minutes then the story began and its excellent, the 77gb download and 129gb (once downloaed may be an issue for some), we need more games of this standard to make VR the showpiece it can be. A big thums up for the Devs...

This is definitely a 5 star game.  Extremely polished gameplay.  You can really tell this was entirely designed with VR in mind.  The graphics are some of the best I've seen in VR and the game is very immersive.  This is a must have if you own a rift.

review_title: Holly cow ! the videos dont do this just
one_reviews_text: Granted that the models arent super next gen looking or the Textures super incredible..They still look amazing if the scale and feeling of things are right. And O boy do they play with scale brilliantly in this game. I downloaded this yesterday after i preorderd it some time ago.. My plan was to just try it out and play the intro as i had seen a few of the videos. But this game really gripped me and i wound up playing a few hours and sleeping less (This is something i used to do some time back with games very few games get me to do this now as i try to maintain a good lifestyle) ..But wow this game is brilliant its made for VR from ground up . so it isn't as massive as skyrim but they make it feel more massive with the mechanics and scale of things...The only critique i would have is that the voice acting could be done a bit better but i guess being over dramatic was the norm at that era lol.. Must buy for sure.. I am excited to see what future brings to VR after this one....Also i played on a RIFT S with a 1080 gtx at max and i have to say i didnt see any pixels or screen door effect..What kind of magic is this !.. I ALSO WANTED TO SAY IN CAPS..THAT THE DEVS DID AN AMAZING JOB AND I HOPE THEY MAKE MORE GAMES AND MAKE LOTS AND LOTS OF MONEY WITH GOOD CONTENT!

review_title: The VR Game We've Been Waiting For
one_reviews_text:
The title says it all. This is easily the best VR game I've played yet, and by a large margin. It is a fully fleshed out experience that involves an immersive story, challenging combat, and beautifully designed environments.

While not an open world game, there are side areas to discover and explore with meaningful side quests to pursue. One early side quest could be easily passed up, but actually adds depth to the main campaign.

The gameplay is where this game shines though. I've not yet played a full game that feels designed from the ground up for VR. You have to parry, block and dodge your enemie's attacks.. It's not enough to stand there and trade blows. Standing toe to toe with the first enemy that towered over me was perhaps one of my favorite video gaming moments ever. I had no idea how I was going to win the fight, and it was truly rewarding when I came out on top.

At a price point of $40, this game is an absolute bargain. I have played and struggled through the hardest setting for several hours and have just completed the first leg of the game. I'm very much looking forward to going back to complete the challenges I haven't and playing through the remaining campaign.

BUY IT. WORTH THE $$.

This may be the first VR game that is ported back to console/PC. It is fun, challenging, and beautiful. It is what all other VR games should be. They spent the time and money to get the gameplay/story right. If you don't buy it you should just return your VR headset.

Add multiplayer and  VR can stop evolving here. 

Lol. This game is everything I wished of VR. Story driven dozens of hours campaign rpg game in vr.  Skyrimvr is awesome but AW is topnotch. At 40$ its a steal. I am playing on Quest via wifi since at this moment link is not out yet. WOW. I hope this become a norm not exception. At last enough with the little vr experience. DEVS you are awesome.

After only one hour playing, i just can say you that this game is awsome !
The atmosphere is fantastic, graphics are amazing, controls very intuitive.
It's not necessary to say more because you're loosing your time : go and buy it, you won't regret it at all !

This is what I am waiting for!!!One of the best VR Games I ever played. I only played 2 Hours and i must say that this is the best VR expirience I ever had on Oculus! Pls make more Games like this!!! And THX :)!!!

I have purchased a lot of games - many of them highly prised in the recommendations. So far I have not been very impressed, lots of concept studies, minigames, demos etc. - often totally overpriced im comparision to a full tripple A game, where you can play weeks and weeks.

But this game here is really a marvel - just finished the bar mini quests - this details, this side stories, the god fights, the god mode, the crafting etc. etc. Every day I'm playing this I'm impressed again.

Together with Beat Saber this are my most played games - I can play every day or 2 days and I'm never done.


One problem are sometimes the graphics. I have a GTX 980 with 4 GB and often the textures cannot be loaded and then there are just ugly surfaces. On the other hand I have no micro stuttering like others.

My family would also really like to play this game, but the missing german localization is a problem. I would guess, that the game loses a lot of potential because of this, not many people  dare to buy a quest heavy english game as foreign speakers.

I saw this game coming from a distance and heard a lot of good things about how much content it would get. The characters are diverse, puzzles and levels are intertwined with the progress you make while keeping the story and narration simple but fulfilling.

You don't just experience being a god, but you also live the adventures of the people you posses making it a very diverse and complete experience.

I have been moderately playing this game since release, (3 weeks ago now), Not every day, but still a solid amount of hours went in it so far... And I am not through the full story yet.

Stop hesitating, it's definitely worth every penny.

The game is beautiful. The story is interesting. The attention to detail remarkable. But the one aspect that breaks this game for me is the combat. Being in VR, I expect to be able to be physically present. My real life movements should be used for virtual life movements. Not so in this game when it comes to combat. There are certain “unblockable” attacks from npcs. In order to deal with those attacks you don’t just dodge with your body or block with your weapon, you stupidly have to use your controller joystick and a button press to dodge. If this was a pancake game, sure that make sense. But in VR?  Really bad design choice. Takes my out of the enjoyment of the game. This game could have come out as a pancake only game as is. Maybe that was the developers purpose. But for VR?  Not the way to go.
Lots  of Chinese gamers are waiting,

I rarely write reviews on the games I buy, but this game is just so great and I wanted to share my appreciation with the developers. Good work guys - I'm so happy to have invested in this and happy to support with my purchase. I hope this will be profitable so we can get many more mindblowing games like this in the future.

I have never seen visuals like this before - I can't even image the hard work that must have gone into this. The game make me forget everything in the real world its so immersive and pure.

There is nothing to describe a game of this caliber. Amazing. Its the best vr game to date nothing will change my opinion about this game its so good about 30 hours of gameplay in the story and lord knows how much side content. You guys did great im hoping for the teased sequel.
Really good VR game

I love the graphics and the fact that this is a real game and not only an "experience" that is over after 2-3 hours. Sadly the mechanics aren't really fun - while the riddles and the switch between god and hero mode are actually fun - the fights aren't. Compare this to Blade and Sorcery and you will see what opportunity was missed here. Next hope: Stormlands

review_title: Best vr game i have ever played
one_reviews_text: Ok this is the best game i have ever played, 2nd best combat in a game ive ever seen (1st is blade and sorcery for me), The graphics best all the games ive played, its all around a five star for me and completely worth the 40 dollars, i bet youtube will hop on this in no time!

review_title: First VR game that feels like full game
one_reviews_text: To me this is the first time we have gotten a full game, it has proper inventory systems, map screens, different areas to visit, NPCs to interact with, a hub world where you can craft and barter with merchants. This is the game VR has been waiting for.

review_title: GOOD BUT STUTTERS FPS DROPS LET IT DOWN
one_reviews_text:
Running a 3700x, 5700xt, 16gb 3200 Ram and installed on an NVME SDD (with all my other VR games).
There is CONSTANT stuttering, and this is reported by at least 20 other people on reddit. It seems it happens when trying to stream a shader for the first time in a scene. Once down, the gameplay goes back to being smooth again.
HOWEVER, this happens all the time in combat, whilst walking about and makes the experience really awful - which is a shame, because the game underneath is very fun, graphically stunning.
OH AND FFS TURN OFF THE DISGUSTING TAA. I edited the ini files a reddit user found and the games looks SOOO much better when TAA is modified for a sharper image.
4-5 stars with these issues fixed. Your mileage may vary.
This is simply brilliant, playing via Quest Link and it is performing great. Do yourself a favour if you are on the fence and get it.

review_title: Its not the game its you!
one_reviews_text:
Alright, my fellow Asgard's players and future players listen in. I'm going to be letting you all know that this game is BIG(file size) so please make sure you A) Have an SSD, B) Enough room on said SSD, and C) 2-5 mins of patients for the loading screens if you decide to NOT install this game on an SSD. 
Needed to start with that because I am so tired of reading people rate this game 1-2 stars due to long loading screens...its not the developers fault, not the games fault, its YOU, the purchasers' fault for not taking the necessary precautions when buying and installing a 165gb VR game! It's 2019, if you are still installing games on an HDD, be aware that you will be experiencing long/longer loading times than if you had an SSD. (Load times for me are 10-20sec depending on area)
Now hopefully I can write a review on the content of the game, because its AMAZING. Just keep playing the game, it keeps getting better and better. Learn and master the ways of combat, uprgrade your Hero gear and companions and you will be having much better experience. I'll soon update with a more detailed review on said game, needed to get the SSD talk out of the way. shame

Really enjoying AW. Looks sensational, feels great to play and explore, and the attention to detail is incredible. Ive put a lot of hours into Skyrim VR and this is a worthy successor to that adventuring. Controls feel well thought out, great VR interactions, and even the menu's are a joy to interact with. Seriously impressed with this game. Just wonderful.

review_title: THIS is what VR should be!
one_reviews_text: I´m playing games with the Oculus since it was released. But this one is the first one, which is really incedible! This game show´s what is possible with the Oculus and VR technics. The setting is also really cool, if you like Vikings, you can´t stop playing it. Movment is also really good and the fight are great! I´d like to say, this is the best VR which i ever played! Please more of games like this!!!

I have played as far as Clan A£$%^&*D (No spoilers I hope) As soon as I started playing, I knew this was a keeper (Bar one small thing which I'll come to) The graphics are fantastic, The audio likewise and the gameplay is a combination of some of my favourite games. Zelda, Moss and God of War in particular. I'm left handed and the bow works great (I just found out :)) The sword swings and shield bash feeel good. I love the addition of the animal companions (Those celebrations!) and the idea of backtacking once more stuff is unlocked. The loading times are a bit of a drag. Now to the downside (I'm hoping the devs read this) As I've said, I'm left handed and movement is on the left thumbstick. While this is fine during exploration. It's terrible during combat. Trying to swing my weapon and control movement together is really spoiling the game for me. In fact I'm getting a 3d Rudder in the hope of negating it. The problem is I would then have to sit down to play. Which would spoil the immersion. If the devs are reading this. Please add movement to the right thumbstick as well. Or allow button mapping. Once again. Geat game. First game in VR I've truly though of as AAA.
I've played in VR for over 2 years now - this is one of the better solo games along with Lone Echo. Worth every penny.

Okay, it took me a while to update my system, and then get the hang of this game.  They did a great job with the game, the visuals are awesome, love the companions, the fighting action is fantastic, boss battles are fun, and the level progression is the best I've seen in VR.  The open world is great, and I love walking around and finding side quests.  

I feel like this game can't be rated the same way other games are rated,  it is hopefully the first in a long line of games giving us the full RPG experience in VR.  There is no other game like it so far, but there were some things that could have been improved.

First the game doesn't explain itself very well.  I have been directed to collect my reward at the world tree a few dozen times, but I don't know what or where it is.  Someone online told me it doesn't become available until later in the game, why direct me to it if it isn't available?  Am I going to receive a bunch of rewards once I get there or are they forfeit because it isn't open yet?  There are other things like that, where it just isn't clear what you are supposed to be doing and the big book at the tavern doesn't help much.  So far Loki has provided relevant information directing me to find stuff, but now all he talks about is the local barfly and I have broken bottles over the heads of everyone in the place and nobody reacts.  Who is this barfly and when are we having this drinking contest?

I love the companions but sometimes I have to dismiss them because they are more of a liability.  They jump between me and the enemies, and I spend more time trying to keep them from getting killed than I do fighting.  Astrid, you have a bow, you don't need to be between me and the bad guys.  If there is a way to direct them to be more cautious in battle I haven't found it.

There is a bunch of little stuff too, like thank you for making a one click process to go from vendor to vendor in the tavern, why didn't you think of that for inventory.  The belt is handy but another issue is I often grab for a potion and end up with one of my weapons in my hand.  Once I press the button to initiate the belt, that hand should be dedicated to the belt.  Also hands, you can switch your dominant hand but it doesn't really change much.  You end up having to move and grab from your belt with your left hand, and if your left handed that is your weapon hand too.  Also something visually entertaining or even a minigame during the extremely ling loading screens would be good, it's not like I can just pick up my cell to distract during those loading screens, the sensory deprivation feels like a mild torture. 

The jump between difficulty levels is enormous, runic armor that can only be broken after parrying is an interesting concept, mixed with unblockable attacks, multiple enemies, and a weird movement mechanic that seems to follow your view instead of your hands even when you turn that off...  it becomes way more difficult.  

Now don't get me wrong, it is still the biggest step forward I've seen in any VR game towards giving us a complete game experience, instead of just one mechanic made into a game.  Even things we've seen in other games is done decidedly better here,   Throwing the axe and pulling it back feels very satisfying, the sword play is really well done too.  More like this please!

I can see myself playing this throughout the winter.
After downloading numerous times it will not install and nowhere can I see how to get a refund. NOT HAPPY

... you want a "real" game: story, quests, semiopen worlds, challenges, bosses, crafting, equipment and magnificent graphics even on "low", beautiful artstyle.

the best vr game, would even be a great game without vr. comparable to god of war.
THIS GAME IS LIT I LIKE SKYRIM VR BUT THIS IS BETTER THE GRAPHICS ARE LIT THE GAMEPLAY AMAZING SKYRIM COULD NEVER BEAT THIS!!!!

I liked this game for the first hour or so but then it started crashing it got really buggy and had a lot of lag and my screen would turn white or it would go black I still had audio and stuff but I couldn’t see anything but I would go play beat saber and it would be smooth overall it was a fun game for the first hour but then it got bad
i had to delete all my games lose all my saves and i was not even close to the amout the game required and now my brother is getting it all back im giveing it a 2 because i liked the video

review_title: This game has it all and then some!
one_reviews_text: Hands down, the best VR game to date. Awesome use of the technology. A few missteps here and there  but not enough to detract from a fun and thoroughly engaging experience. Congratulations to the devs on a solid title. I love my shark buddy.

review_title: This is the future of VR
one_reviews_text:
30 hours of gameplay excellent graphics good gameplay this is the future for VR. I don't know how user's could rate this any lower than 5 stars.  This game sets a new level of how games should be in VR.

and all this for $40

review_title: Great game worthy of all the praise
one_reviews_text: A AAA level game for VR. I would wave bye bye to your free time after playing this game. I have found it some engaging and immersive I have spend ages just walking around and looking at the different ways I can interact with the world. I do not even like hack and slash games and this game has managed to keep me engaged and plugged in. The story is original and well done, the graphics are one of the best I have seen on Occulus. The length of play and replay value is great as you level up discover hidden pathways as you unlock different followers. You are most getting value for money for purchasing this game.

This game will blow your mind, and if you play and explore everthynig a lot, you will be extreamly happy ;) When you put your vr head set its the same as you go to Matrix with full mind and body ) Challenge your self with skill fighting !
Everyting in this game is 5/5 truly ! 
this game that im strongly recomend !

The reviews are right. This game stands on a pedistal alone right now. Im only about a hour in but my oh my has it been a magical hour. Game is super optimized im playing on epic settings resolution scale maxed out and the FPS is rock solid on my rig ( I7 8700K 1070TI 16 Gigs of ram ) Graphics put even Lone Echo to shame. Probably the best opening schene in a VR game to date, I genuinly felt like i was walking the rainbow bridge in to Asgard. This is a must buy! Support these Devs and let Oculus know this is the kind of quality you want from them in the AAA game space. I'm Blown away!!
review_feedback: Thank you so much for the kind review!

one_reviews_text:
Ever wished worlds like Warcraft or Lord of the Rings could be real? Well this is as close as it gets.

I haven't even played this on my home PC yet (it's currently installing), but I demod this game at PAX West in Seattle and WOW!.

It was the first day I had ever played VR, and it changed gaming for me forever. I went home from PAX and immediately bought myself an Occulus Rift S. Can't wait to show this game off to all my friends who game but haven't used VR.

Let's just hope my measely GTX 1070 and gen 7 i5 cpu can handle it.
I expected this to be good just not this good. Nice to have that work in my favour for a change.
This is the rpg VR game I've been wanting. Thanks!

Title says it all. It’s a masterpiece of game design. The combat system was frustrating at first but over time I’ve come to appreciate how much the effort you have to put into the sword play makes it that much more rewarding and immersive. Switching into God mode and spotting the subtle key to unlocking the next necessary step is an experience that can’t be matched by old fashioned gaming.
The loading takes too long and the frame rate constantly drops and this problem caused me to stop playing this a month ago due to all the lag. plz help me.

Love the environment despite being so linear, the nordic lore and puzzles but cannot stand the boss combat that requires parrying the same "rage" canned animation attacks to unlock the boss so they can be damaged.  Combat is the core of this game so this ruins it in my opinion, bring it down to 2 stars.  Give me Blade & Sorcery combat!  Even Skyrim melee is better because you have more options and freedom.  Memorize the few rage attacks and this game is way too easy.
suggest buying when they fix the graphics setting issue where unless you set it to ultra  it won't be a very playable game... graphics is horrible even at high setting...
Every time I paused and tried to download again , the game just disappear and restart the download with 0 % progress.

My rig isn't the newest, but isn't horrible, either (i7-6700K, nVidia 1080) but the load times are excruciating. It's worse than the original Skyrim on the XBox 360. Starting areas are as painfully slow. The graphics are nice like others have mentioned, but the game seems to move at a snails pace.

Waited 8 hours for this to download! then it said my anti virus was blocking it ,shut that off, then my whole downlaod started over!!!...i so im waiting hours again,, was so deflating...i hope it works this time...i know the game is amazing i have played it before...my worry is that its gonna this happen again,as i've seen online ppl with the same prob. ughhh...I'll update asap
I'M SO GLAD I BOUGHT THIS GAME, I'VE BEEN WAITING FOR SOMETHING GREAT LIKE THIS FOR A WHILE NOW & IT DEFINITELY DOESN'T DISAPPOINT! WELL WORTH THE ASKING PRICE! I'M VERY HAPPY.

review_title: Is really the best vr game
one_reviews_text:
I can only say it is really cool. If you have the Oculus this game is a must.
But be sure to have a very good computer it need a lot of power. Running wiht GT1070 8 gb cannot run in Epic wiht super sampling 1.3.

review_title: OMG This is the 1st AAA game in VR!
one_reviews_text:
I would have bought a flat screen version of this game, its HUGE, STUNNING and most of all MOT BORING AFTER THE 20+ hours i've played. Being VR I just cant believe it. 122gb I guess I can lol. Seriously this game is a master piece! - The graphics are 100%, game play is crazy good! I cant fault it. If no VR existed and this came to xbox or PC as an RPG, I would love it. I tried playing on medium and got maybe 7 hours in and fk it became so hard to fight. I went to Mortal and its still hard but ok (my arms are sore lol). Its a HUGE fantasy Asguard world. Stunningly beautiful, full RPG, detail is like going to a hollywood studio and looking at the made up characters.
