Cant believe you can play a normal character but then also traspose into a GOD and look down at everything still in full detail nd also interact - e.g. 1st area your small( wont say) but you can just transform into your godly form and pick up your characters and look in full detail. Look basically, you hav never played a VR game like this. So buy it!!!! its incredible!! Thanks you Oculus, this game will save VR for sure!
No complaints, anyone saying they cant run on a high end PC is lying, I have a amd 2600k and an amd Rx480 8B Card. Game runs 100% perfecfull EPIC GPX and Resolution 90% (can have 100% bu some areas are to bi).
My onl eoan times between wrolds, its no big deal, except when you die and have to wait 1 min on an M1 ssd to replay.
Otherwise 100 out of 100 for the first epic VR game!!!!!

***Update - why is the new update asking me to DL 139gb. Game is already installled, 80gb free on that ssd, yet the game fails to see this. HELP?

There are plenty of reviews that describe the game.  Awesome combat, terrific graphics, and one of the best storylines I've seen in a VR title.  Must buy. 

I've also been very impressed with the developers responsiveness -- both responding to feedback and helping customers with technical difficulties.

review_title: The best vr game out right now
one_reviews_text: This game has it all and for the price its a steal!!! You get 30 hours plus of content with side content that feels full and amazing for example there is a mission where you have to possess a side character you first met at the very beginning, you navigate aegirs hall as a tiny human in a gods world fighting enemies with a makeshift sword with brand new dialogue. This game also has superb combat with the weapons impact feeling physical and real and a focus on parrying which feels great with many weapons including ranged options like bows and cross bows. If you own VR buy this now!!!

Right off the bat you can see and FEEL and tell that this is not an uncared for project. NO SIR. they LOVE this project and once you play it you can see how much!
not very far into it, but getting off work tired as HELL yet still playing for about an hour says something!

AAA title here folks. bar has been set.

ONLY negative (if it really is one for some) is the file size. over 78 gigs? huge, but i see were it went! THANK YOU DEVS.
review_feedback: Thank you very much for the great review.

one_reviews_text: The best thing since chicken and rice!

The game is full of bugs including horrible textures, bad performance, lack of graphics setting. The game itself is amazing so far, just sort out the grapgice options and bugs and the game breaking quest in the tevern, then I can actually play the game.

This game is something else. Its not even on the same playing field. Wow. Just.. Wow.

The game 'steals' a great deal from God of War (2018) and a *bit* from the new Tomb Raider series, but is totally fresh and original. In fact... wait... WHY are you reading this review?? Have you not heard? This is THE must own VR game! This is THE aaa experience! Just buy it!  ...btw if you're an OCD completionist like me, the game is over 50 hours of pure bliss.. if not, its still 25-30 hrs long!

this game delivers far more than I dared to hope this is a full densely packed game to explore and though the first two hours of this 25-50 hour game are a bit of a slog the challenging combat the puzzles and layers of easter eggs come together in the best vr game to date setting the bar to a new High in a way I haven't seen since lone echo!

Overall this is an amazing VR experience so far, however there are two major issues that prevent this from being a 5 out of 5 experience. 

First is the performance. I'm running an 8700k/2080ti set up and even i'm getting frame rate drops all the time, even in the central HUB. The game looks decent but not enough to cause that kind of slow down, given I can run any non VR game in 4K.

Secondly, there are no collision or weapon physics. If a single developer can do this in Blade and Scorcery then there's no excuse for a massive studio/production like this not to. This makes the combat in the game very floaty and lacks weight. I've died so many times from blocks not registering because the enemy weapon just clips through mine. It's very frustrating. It also really takes you out of the experience where your weapons clip through every object in the game. 

Those issues aside,  I'm very grateful for this game even being made. No one has come close to making a VR game on this scale, with this level of detail. I hope this  is the start of things to come for VR!
I'm barely past the tutorial and this game is absolutely amazing! We need more games like this!

They got a ton of things right with this game! Locomotion, mechanics and haptics feel natural and dialed in. Hands gestures, body, feet and full range of movement are also extremely impressive with this title. Gameplay is a great combination of hand to hand combat and puzzle solving. Voice acting and storyline are also very well done. So far I’m impressed with many elements of this game. Graphics are also amazing! Did not expect AAA graphics when I downloaded. This is definitely one of the best VR games to date. A few things that were missing for me are better character development and a clearer understanding of how quests fit in with what’s happening in the story. Also, harder puzzles would be good. I’m spoiled with fallout 4’s character development and the insane puzzles from Obduction. Either way Asgard is a must have for you Vr library

Most negative reviews are about the combat system. It is a bit strange to base the difficulty on the parry mechanic but its not terrible. I think the game has a lot to offer with the god perspective. A god helping a human with puzzle solving. Have you ever wanted to mess with the miniature village model from the movie Beetlejuice? Buy this game :D

Where as I have fully been enjoying the game and all its many well crafted elements, I seemed to have come across a major giltch during the first level playing as the old man wizard. There is a green crystal bowl that you are suppose to place on the proper pole when you are in god mode. I happned to have dropped it when I was placing it there and it fell through the map, and is not responding back to it's starting point for me to pick it up and try again. So I am unable to complete the bridge the old man is suppose to cross to continue the game. I've invested too much time and unlocked everything for the shield maiden to start over a whole new game. Going to be asking for a refund since the game company has not gotten back to me or answered their phone. Play at your own risk.
 Aside from this I has had to deal with the game jamming up everytime a fight begins. and with every sword stroke the enemy makes, the game will freeze for a moment. My PC is well over the recomended specs so I blame the game for this.

This game is just perfect. Grafics are amazing, gameplay works 99% perfect. For a Roleplaying game with quests, sidequest, hidden quest and crafting/upgrading stuff, finding secrets and solving riddles. 
Worth every $. The Details are great. Wanted to start just a little bit last night and got hocked up for 5 hours and couldn't break free of it. Hope they add more content on this soon. Don't want this to end! :)

I have a decent PC that runs most vr games with ease but This game imparticular was slow at loading anything and everything. If you die it would take 5 minutes to laod back in. Aswell as some of the most basic tasks of putting somthing in your pouch would be so hard. It in all was not a good comfort level. The idea and graphics were fun though.

review_title: Massive Potential with Some Poor Design
one_reviews_text:
I want to start off by saying I love this game. When I pictured VR before I bought my Rift S, this is very close to the game I imagined playing, and now it's here. A game with an interesting combat system, some light puzzles, and beautiful environments.

However, as some have already pointed out, load times are pretty atrocious. Having to travel betweens worlds just to lighten your load is always tedious, and it's made worse when there's 5 minutes between deciding to leave for Asgard, then returning to whatever world you're currently working your way through. When you die, you're also forced to sit through a minutes long load screen just to pick up where you left off.

All this, though, would bring it down to a 4 out of 5 star rating. However, when you couple all that with random encounters, it loses another star. It's okay to clear a room the first time, and can be a great example of a proper challenge. Learn to fight, or die. But on resurrecting, you've learned something about an enemy's timing or a weakness, and can exploit it the next time. Even so, when you're forced into a tough battle in every area, even when you've already been there, the load times become an almost fatal flaw.

I'm still early in the game, so I've far from mastered the combat. Any enemy above the standard draugr is a challenge, and I really feel accomplished when I win a battle! But in a game that encourages exploration, and all but requires backtracking to discover secrets, I shouldn't have to dread travelling back to a puzzle section because I might die in a random encounter and be forced to sit through a too-long load screen. There is an option to lower the difficulty to make parrying optional, but parrying is fun! And I want to get good at it. Random encounters here make me have to decide between getting good, or waiting for longer than I'm playing.

Test me, sure, but in a game that can take literal minutes to load after death, test me in specific situations, not every five steps.
review_feedback: Thank you for the feedback. We are always looking at reviews to see how we can improve things for a patch.

one_reviews_text: This game is basically the perfect VR RPG.  The graphics, sound, gameplay, mechanics... everything is top notch AAA production value.  I've played Skyrim VR with all of the best mods-- and this still beats it for immersion and VR native capabilities that you simply couldn't imagine outside of VR.

Best personal experience I’ve had in VR over the last 3 years. Action, adventure, crafting, side quests, challenges,upgrades are some of the things you will experience. Also Lots of story and lore. Game seems like a mixture of god of war meets Darksiders and Skyrim. A must buy don’t wait for a sale, this is worth full price.

review_title: Most Ambitious VR Game to date
one_reviews_text: This is without a doubt the most ambitious PCVR game built from the ground up for VR to date. They've really created a great game, and a must have for any RPG fans, especially for those who love the Elder Scroll series. Non-RPG fans might not enjoy it as much, however. It's an excellent looking game, but this also means you'll need a powerful PC to play it. Combat can begin to feel a bit repetitive, though this is something I feel with any typical RPG. The enemies tout a pretty good amount of health and there is a bit of a focus on parrying, blocking, and dodging, so combat can get a bit lengthy for my taste...though its not the worst sinner in this area. There's plenty of junk to pick up, so be prepared to pickup a lot then go back to drop off and craft stuff. Overall I recommend this for everyone with VR, even non-RPG fans since there really isn't many VR titles on this level

review_title: Good Game once you get past the tutorial
one_reviews_text: Its a good game, my only problem I have is the exceccively long tutorials. This seems to be a problem with alot of VR games like people who play vr have never played a game. also unless you want gorrilla arms set the difficulty to mortal the enemies just become damage spunges witrh  more difficulty.

This game is crazy the graphics are beautiful, the game play is great so far, the storey is great so far , I love where VR is going . this is deffintly one of the best VR Games so far .. i was hesistent to buy because i didnt think the storey would be great and how much stuf you can do , i was wrong . i am very very impressed . Well Done

This game is one of the best VR games to be released thus far.  So many of the games that have been released thus far either feel like a tech demo for VR, or just don't compare to typical PC/console games.  It's nice to finally play a game that has an in-depth crafting system, and fairly challenging combat.  The game gives you good reason to replay through areas, and rewards you for completing challenges or exploring.  If you're looking for a good RPG in VR, this is it.

review_title: Finally a real game in VR !!
one_reviews_text:
The day has finally come that someone released a true, AAA game in VR.

It has a great story, atmosphere and game-play, not to mention the amazing graphics. I've been playing for five hours straight. Definitely a must buy!

Experienced VR player, as far back to DK2 owner and now owner of Rift S, Quest, Oculus GO, Vive, and Pimax.

Fantastic game! Controls are perfect for even this southpaw (left handed).

This game is so good almost feels like you could live in it. Wonderful job devs!!

This game is worth every cent and more!! Money well spent and i never had said that!!

If Lone Echo was (is) the VR killer app for SciFi lovers, Asgard's Wrath is the killer app for Fantasy lovers.
Great game, any owner of O. Rift should buy it. 
Do not miss this gem!

Thanks Sanzaru folks.
I bought the game and after it installs it says failed to install and restarts the download in a infinite reinstall loop. Hopefully i can get help cause i reallyu wanna play it.

This is what a real AAA VR game is supose to be!
Great gameplay, visuals and an epic story.
The price is somewhat higher for a VR game but it's no doubt worth it, this game is a musthave in the VR genre!
Thank you Oculus & Sanzaru for making a "real" AAA title! Next Project make us a MMO in this world and watch the headsets fly off the shelf :)
This is the game I have been waiting for.  The more I play the more game opens up and the more interesting it gets. Can't wait to find out what's next!

My chief complaint about all VR games is depth. This one is DEEP. And FUN. I've been playing at least 12 hours and I don't even think I've scratched the surface. This is worth every penny and I am glad I bought it. More later but yes buy this game!

Great experience so far, finally a decently polished proper longer than 10 hours game made for VR from the ground up!

One star off for the stutters now and then (even in tavern) with a 9700k and 1080 GTX (436.48) on LOW with resolution slider down to lowest with GPU and CPU not passing 50% usage.

If you're looking for a VR game with depth, lots of side content, varied main quest, this is absolutely the game for you. Gorgeous environments, interesting story and rewarding progression elements make this game really special.

It is the biggest VR production and you really notice it. Must play game for anyone with a VR HMD.

So far my favorite VR game was Fallout 4 (and before Skyrim).  Unfortunately, the fact that the virtual reality market still in a  little niche, makes the porting of successful games not natively developed for VR the only possible way to have AAA titles.  Thanks to Oculus and his "endless" funds Sanzaru has managed to perform the miracle: create a title exclusively for VR that has the depth and  the details of the non-VR masterpieces.  All the stylistic choices made by the developers are perfect: the menus and the interfaces, the mechanics of fighting, in this title fantastically credible because complex and satisfying, the duality God / Hero, the epic greatness of the audio department.  But the better thing is the story.  It does not simulate, as other VR games do, a length that does not have, to camouflage with a lot of repetition the little development.  Instead it is a well developed and coherent story.  In short, I am impressed both by the maturity shown by Sanzaru and by the beauty of VR, light years more engaging than other technologies for which it concerns the involvement and unfortunately, I am afraid, so much unknown to make Argard's Wrath possible only with the  funding of a wealthy company like Oculus. The only thing: in God mode the controls are weird and the collision map must be different; sometime the game crashes or slows down. But this title is published only yesterday.

This game has it all...Great Mechanics, Lots of options smooth game play..The world is just breath taking, theres sooooo much content....Although I must admit I got a little lonely being the only one in the game and I knew it was a single player before I bought it. I WOULD BUY IT AGAIN...but if there was a multiplayer aspect I could see my self spending way too much time in here....They knocked this one out of the park! If you like action...if you like puzzles.....if you like pulling the head of your dead enemy off your sword..this game is for you!

The load time is a little extensive but Im sure that s because of the Graphics.

review_title: Finally! Game better than Robo Recall.
one_reviews_text: I can't stop playing this game.  I've been Playing for 4 days straight and still have not beat it.  I can't beleive how big this game is.   this game cost me  $149 worth of Highspeed data, a new harddrive, plus the $40 for the price of the game.  Well worth it.  Even after the 3 trys it took me to download it...  I wish it had an option to download it in stages or an option to have ir mailed in a flash drive because some of us, like myself, live out in the country and have Satilite internet.  Very slow and very expensive.  Word of advice, make sure you have your internet connected directly because if you loose connection during your 78GB download, the whole file will likely get currupted and you will have to start all over again. not fun.  However,  this is litterly the best game I've ever played!  And I've downloaded over 500 GB of VR games...  Well worth the price and even the proce of an upgrade if you have to get one.  You won't regret it.  Well Done.  Now,  I'm going back to my game.

5 Star game but I had an issue where I only had about 170GB Free.  The game will try to install with 129 free but the unpacking step takes another 70GB and will fail if you don't have more free.  Save yourself a night of wasted download time and make sure you have enough free space before trying to download.

review_title: cant install this game...i give it up

I restart my pc multiple time deleted the files in the oculus download folder. checked out all forums...no luck... im done i have no ideas anymore. i think im going to refund this game.

review_title: Even Playable on Low End Hardware!
one_reviews_text: Didn't see any reviews addressing this, so I thought I would. Obviously the game is amazing, buy it if you haven't already. Beautiful graphics, well optimized, and fantastic addicting gameplay as a mortal warrior and an all powerful God. Transforming into your God form and towering over the world like standing over a miniature train set is probably the most enjoyable gameplay aspect for me. But, the thing that really got me was how I was able to run this game near flawlessly on my Radeon RX480 GPU! Granted I get a couple tracking issues here and there on the rift s and the rare frame drop flicker, but no tracking issues on the original rift, and as long as I set the graphics to low, I maintain stable max frame rates most of the time depending on my HMD (80fps rift s, 90fps rift)! I have a GTX 1080 on the way, but the fact I can still enjoy this game on my entry level VR GPU at all is astounding. I can't even run Sairento as good as this game on my setup! Great game devs, you deserve so much praise for this VR masterpiece, definitely looking forward to your upcoming stuff and the future of AAA, full game, VR titles in general. VR is definitely NOT dead! I had honestly planned to move exclusively to the Valve Index, but if Oculus keeps releasing and supporting original quality content like this, I will gladly continue to keep supporting.

review_title: It's all that and a bag of chips!
one_reviews_text:
OK.  No chips.  But this is certainly a new benchmark for VR gaming.  So glad we're coming out of the era of, what really amounts to mini games that show off virtual reality.  I think most enthusiasts like myself are ready for more.  This is more!

At $40 the price point is more than reasonable for a AAA title such as this, considering a full blown Xbox game starts around $60.  Someone on Youtube mentioned it took them 25 hours to get through just the main storyline, without all the side missions.  

I was a bit concerned about performance at first since the requirements say GTX 1080.  I'm  only running a 1060 3GB and it runs fine with the graphics set to high.  But graphics on epic is where this game really shines so I went ahead and upgraded to a RTX 2070.  (Hopefully Defector, that hog, will run better as well)  

Gigabyte Z170X Gaming 7 OC
Intel i7-6700K 4Ghz
Gigabyte Nvidia RTX 2070 Super 8GB OC
32 GB DDR4 OC
M2 C Drive
Rift S
MSI Afterburner
review_feedback: We really appreciate the nice review! Thank you for playing.

one_reviews_text: Comically bad textures, voice acting, and shallow gameplay. If it had been produced outside of VR, it would never attract an audience.

This is one of the few AAA titles in VR, its like god of war and skyrim in one game, it's beautiful. Good combat with a sence of difficulty, rather than feeling like you are fighting clothes on washing line like most other VR games. Great story so far, and imirsion like no other game ive played, its so imersive it feels like a dream. After only 2 hours of play its in my top 3 VR games. Lets hope this pushes the boundry for VR and other developers follow the lead.
This needs to be part of everyone's VR Essentials list.

review_title: i wait my entier life for that
one_reviews_text: when i was kid i  was dreaming about a game like that in VR. now it's on and it rocks ! Very nice game. graphics are good. Game play is nice and the story is good. Just one grief : as I am french i would love some french subtitles cause the langage is not a usual english and it can be hard for us to understand.

Plays really nice in VR with good controls, intuitive mechanics and feels more fleshed out than any made for VR game to date. 20 hours in and feels like about 50% done. Beautiful graphics, best I've ever seen in VR, the large download size for high res textures is very worth it. Playing on high settings and good balance between good looks and smooth framerate on my 3 year old rig.

Hope this does awesome for the production studio and for VR to continue to move towards this quality of title more and more consistently in the future!

I've only played for a few hours and already it's been worth the money. This game is SUPER fun and has a number of different ways to play. I'm already in love with the characters and the world it's built in. The game is also just downright beautiful.

I've been super skeptical about VR RPG Games so far and have held off on purchasing a few that looked shallow but I would recommend this game to absolutely anybody. Can't wait to get some free time to really dig into this and continue the story.

This feels like a complete game with a sense of building your characters, gear, and progression. Combat is actually really challenging too even on the medium difficulty ( at least the elite NPCS you encounter an hour in). The Tutorials are really helpful and the transition from gameplay to tutorial feels natural.

This is what the VR world needs rights now. This game has beautiful graphics and a long play time. (it gives me serious Witcher3 flashbacks for some reason) I have a i7 8th gen and RTX2060 and it runs with no problem. The loading time is a little to long for my liking but it's not unbearable. If you have a powerful enough graphics card, this game is a must-buy.

So far (~8 hours in) the best VR game I've played.  Love the setting and art style.  The mix of combat, RPG elements and puzzles gives this a thoughtful, smart and polished feel.  This brings together much of what works well in other games but pushes forward many VR elements that others will be emulating - which is great.

Excellent VR game definitely a must have BUT as i read many people referring to Skyrim.. this isnot, not the depth of story or the NPC's dialogues stories etc, there is only you and the character that hold your hands to tell you what to do and some followers ( companions) and enemies if course.

The game looks amazing thanks to high red textures ( 160 gb) once installed, 
there is a puzzle side a la "Moss"and some crafting, like lot of iron gives you sheet of iron lot of sheets gives you lingot of iron etc... 
the combat mechanic are difficult you have to  follow the sequence chosen by  the developers or you'll die quickly (  parry, attack, block, repeat) you can throw the sword, i find it weird that i can buy arrows but not the bow ( somebody help?) hope the développer gave us more freedom and diversity in melee combat like assassin's creed. 
i noticed some bugs like texture not loading in some objects like rocks or barrels. 
Hope developers will expend the game later with more depth znd back story of each character and maybe make ig an open world...
RUSSIAN PLIZZZZZZ!

3 stars until I get to see what this is like on the Quest.Thats the only reason I bought it,plus it's meant to be amazing, can't wait.
Please Oculus ,make sure that link update is really good,otherwise I will have to buy a rift s,after selling my odessey plus.
Fingers crossed.

review_title: Still in tutorial; lots of fun yet
one_reviews_text:
I will refine my opinion later, but what I see is very, very impressive. Did not play Lone Echo yet, but that game is certainly the flagship for VR for the year to come at least. Almost as well polished as Robo Recall is, but with more gameplay and content. It looks more accessible than hardcore, but it's a lot of fun anyway. And controls are real good and convincing despite some very minor drawbacks.
Take my money and do more games like that!!

Really trying hard to like this game more, as all the reviews state it's AAA, must have etc. Graphics are pretty good I guess. Interface for accessing inventory I don't like. I played Skyrim/Fallout 4 for 100+ hours in 2D and getting there in VR too. I suppose I was expecting the same masterpiece level with this. I have difficulty set to Legendary and find the combat so hard and frustrating, which is why I gave up on Chronos and just couldn't play something like Dark Souls. Maybe if I drop to Mortal (easy) I'd enjoy it more but exploration and finding barrels etc. just reappear returning to an area seems weird. Absoultely loved God Of War games on PS3/PS4 for the Norse Mythology so can't understand why this isn't better for me. I'll keep going for a while longer and update my review if it improves playability. Not found any way your character levels up or gains any new abilities as game progresses yet, which is usually a motivator in RPGs for me.

Ok i am so disappointed. To enjoy this game you HAVE TO play on EPIC graphics settings . Low ,medium, or even high are juste too ugly. Ok i know, i have only GTX 1060 but every game i have on VR i can play with good graphics ,but not this one. I go refund now and buy for sure when i upgrade my PC to 1080/2080 (???) to play this game.
review_feedback: Hi, we are sorry that the game didn't run well for you. We released a patch that might solve some issues, but if it didn't, Sanzaru's discord server has some tips that might get you working with smoother performance.  https://discord.gg/BmvdCP

review_title: Good game but few issus with a game this
one_reviews_text:
Download failed to run twice after hours and hours of waiting!! Oculus library then wants to redownload all over again!! 
This is on brand new gaming PC Rift S with RTX 2060 16GB memory and Ryzen gen 3 CPU 2TB storage. I have over 35 other VR games working no problem. 
***Update*** 
Third  atempt to download worked - had to leave overnight and DO NOT pause or switch out of the oculus download screen or you are back to square one. However once I finaly got to start playing the game then, yes it is awsome so upgrade to 3 stars. It is a masive game though and you will need a beefy PC to run above low quality graphics, be interesting to see if the questlink is going to handly this.

This game has everything right. The combat is intuitive and fun, graphics are amazing and the story is definitely engaging. I dont see how anyone could give this game less than 4 stars at the least unless your not a true advocate for VR. This game does not have to be run with epic graphic settings to still be amazing. I look forward to more titles like this.

review_title: A essential VR game for anyone
one_reviews_text: This game is absolutely terrific. One thing this game thrives at, is content. Almost every single VR game is over and completed in under 10 hours, and even then, only a few games that have enough content for more than a few hours of playtime. I have over 2 hours in Asgards Wrath so far, (And Im loving every minute of it) and I only have 2% total completion. Even if you don't strive to get 100% completion, anyone can easily get at least 40+ hours out of this game in terms of play time. The higher price tag of $40.00 compared to other VR games might make some reconsider, but this game is easily worth it. I would reccomend this game to anyone with a VR headset, because Asgards Wrath is a must have, with its entertaining gameplay, mechanics, and feel.

One of the best VR games i've ever played. Graphics are incredible, Gameplay is perfect, and its a full blown game not just an expeirence you get sick of after 10 minutes like alot of other games. At $40 it is on the expensive side but worth every penny. Unlike Skyrim VR this game was made only for VR and you can tell. If i had to complain about one thing i would have to say im a little dissapointed in the sword mechanics just seems kind of arcade-y to me but made just played too much blade & sorcery. Even with that its still one of the best games i've played on the Oculus great job Devs!! hope to see more from you guys in the furture

Performance is smooth for me on my crusty old 980 Ti @ medium GFX settings (though it does make the Oculus deck in the BG lag like hell sometimes if you step back out of the game. Fortunately you can re-calibrate on the fly in-game, so that’s not too annoying). I’ve yet to try bumping up the GFX settings, but I’m not holding my hopes too high if 2080xx cards are struggling!

People marking this down to one star just because of lack of localization, or download issues when the world and his wife were trying to DL it are just churlish beyond reason!

Take some of the glowing reviews with a pinch of salt, and allow for hyperbole. This game is no Skyrim (I’m not talking just the VR Skyrim), but for a VR game it’s probably as close as we’re going to get for a good while, it really is good. Innovative and well thought out. There are a few minor niggles with it, combat feels a little floaty due to the lack of feedback (but no worse than titles like Gorn). Load times between levels are about 10-20 secs at my settings, but I’d expect that to be higher if you crank up the eye candy settings. The game could really do with a grip toggle for holding weapons, esp. if you’re a lefty like me, as it gets old fast having to hold in the side trigger when movement is also on the left controller. Progression / upgrades are a wee bit overly grindy. 

Those points (which keep it from being a 5 star job) aside, it’s an impressive effort. Other than Lone Echo, it’s the first VR game I’ve played that really does feel like a fully fleshed out game. The companions have character, the areas are small but designed well, and most importantly of all… it’s just great fun. I was a little concerned this wouldn’t be worth the asking price, but overall it absolutely is.

The closest thing I can compare this to is God of War.  You feel like you're in a Pirates of the Caribbean ride at Disneyland.   The production values are incredible.   This is the best game I've ever had the privilege of playing.

review_title: A+++ POLISHED BEAUTIFUL IMMERSIVE FUN VR
one_reviews_text: Easily ranks up there with Lone Echo, Robo Recall, and Moss etc.  IMHO the best game to date for VR!  Takes all the lessons learned with VR and delivers absolute perfection, smooth controls, perfect optimization, and outstanding graphics.  I'm playing with all ingame graphics maxed out on a i7 8800k, gtx 1080ti, and 16gb ram.  No frame drops at all.   The game gives you AAA game play and tons of side quests, sure to provide many many hours of entertainment.  Lore, and atmosphere are spot on to the era.  Just buy it.

This is really a must have for ur collection.
AAA game with some puzzle and adventure elements.
Fact is that i dont like puzzle games. But the ones in this game are so great and i hope more devs will follow this example.
If ur pc can handle it and play it on Epic settings , best game so far for 2019.

review_title: Worth every single penny of my Pre-order
one_reviews_text: I can say I don't normally write reviews for games period much less VR titles, But this game is absolutely 100% AAA quality, voice acting can be a tad choppy at times but the game makes up for that in every other regard. Beautiful visuals, engaging combat, actual difficulty without it being the game's fault. If you make an error in combat it is YOUR mistake, Everything is fair and balanced. The boss fights arent boring, infact most of them are quite interactive and make you feel like a total bad***. Even if you arent a fan of Norse mythology or puzzle games, this game is an absolute must-play for any oculus owner or VR fanatic in general. Absolutely beautiful and a massive props to both Oculus and the dev team behind the game. You guys and your game deserve every ounce of praise it's recieving and a massive congratulations on a successful launch. Very few games now a days, Flat-screen included actually have successful launches with very few bugs plaguing the game and I personally havent had a single one. The single and ONLY gripe I have is how long the load times take, but even that is primarily because of the high-resolution textures the game has, So even that is understandable. Once again, thank you Oculus and thank you Sanzaru Games for an amazing title sure to breathe new life in to the VR community. Keep setting the bar and standards for VR gaming higher!

This game is a great value for 40 dollars. There is so much to do and everything is gorgeous. I was shouting IM THOR RAGNAROK to my fiancee when i was on the rainbow bridge leading to asgard in the beginning of the game. Such an amazing feeling.

The graphics and quality of visual elements are incredible. I have found that I need to shut down other apps and make sure my Alienware is set to game mode because this beast of a game uses every inch of my computer and it is WORTH IT. 
There’s so much to discover, so much to learn, my personal fun part is smacking people across the face in the tavern. Gives me the giggles every time. 
I get lost in time playing this game. Best purchase so far!

Walking takes some getting used to it but other then that.. no problem. 
Its a must have title for any system.

review_title: The beginning of something aaa in vr
one_reviews_text:
Amazing game, amazing visuals, it stands out from everything in vr.  Performance optimiztion are flawless too. 
the only regret is in combat, the combat system doesn't match the highness of the product. i've setted the difficulty to mortal beaceause of that. 
it is ok to wait and parry particulars attacks, but everything is based on that, and worst is the quick head stroke or counter  from enemies totally unpredictable and really quick. 
witn a more oculated combat system it could be the must have of every vr gamer.
Anyway i thx developpers and sponsors for this marvellous experience.

review_title: Great experience but long loading screen

Great Game, but the loading when switching between worlds (and after dying) takes way too long (> 1 Minute). It would be nice to implement a quick "send item to Asgard" feature. =)

Another nice feature would be an option to reenter the tutorial space, to practice blocking and dodging and to introduce friends to the game.

review_title: The best VR game to date by LEAGUES!
one_reviews_text:
AAA+ I could go on about how amazing and large the world is, or how smooth and fluid the controls are, how much fun the game is in general but I'd be wasting play time typing it out.

What are you doing? Stop reading and get in to it!

As the other reviews have stated, this game is amazing. Combat is challenging, looting is fun, side quests are available, amazing graphics... and so much more. For this price, it's impossible to say no nor regret the purchase. Enjoy.

review_title: Must have for everyone loving VR
one_reviews_text: Absolut fantastic game. Gameplay and fighting system is very nicely done. Graphics are fantastic. Game mechanism are fresh, new and surprising with every new character.  I'm 30 hours into the game and still only scratched the surface. Best VR Game at the moment!
Sweet!!

One of the most immersive games i have played. The sense of scale is amazing and the background score is cinematic. This is truly what VR should be and dare i say even surpasses Lone Echo.
Buy this at full price and support the developers so that we can enjoy more AAA content on our VR headsets.

review_title: Only thing missing is gen2 interaction
one_reviews_text: When you start in the bar, you see a bottle and you pick it up, try slamming it against the table it goes through it, try putting it on thee table and it breaks. The lab recently got an update where your hand could interact with the world, blade and sorcery and boneworks.  I feel like the balance still needs to be found between gameplay and interaction. This world is big is so I understand it's not the easiest thing to do, but I feel overtime it could be improved.

It's not just the amount of content the game offers but the quality of it. Lots of main missions, great side quests, labyrinths that add many extra hours of gameplay and are just as good as the main story, etc etc. Lots of exploration, good puzzles, great controls, superb level design, great combat (a bit too difficult in medium and hard, too much parrying needed IMO but perfect in 'Mortal' if you're more into exploration and the puzzle solving).  All characters work great, scenery is gorgeous, tons of quality of life details here and there like automatic/manual climbing of ladders and stairs, quick access menus and many other things.  Overhyped games tend to turn out disappointing but this certainly was not the case, it's everything they said it would be and more, it delivers on every promise they made and that does not happen too often.  Absolutely gorgeous, AAA quality game both technically and from a gameplay perspective. If God of War was a VR game it would be call Asgard's Wrath.

To all the people giving it 1 or 2 stars because the game is not dubbed into other languages, yes, I agree it should offer that, at the very least subtitles, I am Spanish  and I'd love to have a good dubbing but that has NOTHING to do with the quality of the game itself, it's ridiculous to say the game is amazing and then give it  a 1-star rating because of the lack of other languages, there are other ways to ask for a dubbing without review-bombing the game.

review_title: The AAA VR Game you've been waiting for
one_reviews_text:
I've been playing VR for years and I (like many others here) have been waiting for the "AAA" game that really shows what VR is TRULY capable of: Providing a unique/ different experience. Period. That's what VR is all about. I am happy to report that this game not only provides that experience, but is the AAA you've been waiting for. 

Is it perfect? No. Not really. It has some faults, but what game doesn't? The devs have done a phenominal job across the board. Tons of production value. Cool combat and amazing graphics. 

Oh, and this game has tons of meat in it. It will take you easily over 25 Hours+ just to beat the main story and probably another 20+ to do all of the side quests. Lot's of stuff to do, explore etc. 

The best way to sum this game is like a FPS Zelda/Skyrim/God of War. It has a lot of elements from each of those games and that is not a bad thing. It's even better in VR!

Stop reading. Just buy it. You won't regret it.

review_title: Great looking game. Lots of potential.
one_reviews_text:
Only been playing the game for a few hours. 4% in and will review again later on. So far, looks great. This is the quality we want in more of the VR games. 
Some of the characters use the same model as the all of the others - don't see why they can't be more unique.
Combat is awkward as the actions don't feel like they are making contact and the death animations seem random sometimes. 
Controls are great. Free movement which is the only way to play a VR game. Although, there is no run or jump function...yet, which is common. Would be more immersive with headbobbing option. Run with swinging arms options. Climbing would be nice.
Swapping between mortal and God is very nice touch.
Good Points: Graphics, free-movement, scope, scale, size, crafting, followers.
Bad Points: Crashes - So far the biggest issue is the high amount of crashes: 8 so far after only a few hours in. Not good. It seems to get overwhelmed, leading to a fatal error.
Smaller issue is the load times: 20-30 seconds sometimes, not too bad on an M.2, but could be a major issue on slower drives.
More updates later.
Bruh... just do it. I've spent hundreds on vr games. This became my new favorite instantly... buy it. Buy it right now.
This is what every story driven VR RPG should strive to be.

Rediculously fun!  Playing in both mortal and God mode is what I like best.  Moving things in an area in God mode to assist the mortal is a great mechanic!  I dont even care what these guys make next.  I'll get it.  (is this what being a fanboy feels like)
Noice

review_title: Not amazing but polished and good
one_reviews_text:
This is just my impression after playing for an hour. A little bit disappointed after reading all the praise from people. I agree that it's really good looking and maybe the best VR game so far. At least this type of Skyrim like game. Other games may be more fun and I'm unfortunately not amazed.

The intro shown in earlier demos felt pretty small in scale to me. Pretty cool but as I suspected nothing really special about it. I didn't think that this would be a game for me after seeing the early demo. I still think it's worth a buy for everyone who has PC VR just because of the scale and quality of the game. I hope it grows on me when I get more into the game.

There are some things left to polish. When playing as the god I had to stand in the exact same spot and direction as when starting the game. Otherwise the steering was off. Left was forward, right was back and so on until i turned the right way. Turning made me move around in a circle instead of just turning until I moved to the center of my play area.
In many (good) ways reminds me of Skyrim :)

Some familiar, some new. Beautiful graphics. Fun gameplay. Instantly in the top tier vr games. Get it!

The absolute best game I have ever played in VR.  I have 100+ games between steam and oculus, this is the best one yet.  This is what Skyrim was supposed to be like, but failed.  It has a very Diablo feel to it.  The combat on hard is very challenging, always keeps me on my toes.  There is so much replay value, you can go through every area multiple times to unlock new content. I bet 100 hours easy can be done trying to finish all the side quest.  The heros are so much fun, each one plays like a different Diablo class.  So far I like the double sided staff that turns into laser nunchucks, lol, so much cool stuff.  I've never stayed in VR longer than an hour, but now I'm in 2+ hours a night because I finally have a game that is engaging and feels like a true AAA release.
You should buy it.

review_title: Haven't even played the game yet
one_reviews_text: And it's 5/5

Unfortunately this game offers only headset-guided locomotion. 
It does look promising but I stopped playing after an hour and will wait in a hope that a controller relative locomotion gets added soon in an update. 
It is not only a question of comfort. This is a milestone game for VR, a trend-setter, a game that others will learn from, so not offering locomotion options is a worying sign.
Hopefully they will hear the community feedback (there is a big thread on Reddit about this) and will offer the players options to eperience the game in the best way for them. Looking forward to playing this game that looks like can join or even dethrone Lone Echo as best VR experience for me.

one_reviews_text:
Continually holding grip for weapons gets old quick. Also can we walk in the direction the left hand points? Decoupled head is my preference so i can see the shiny world without having to stop dead. 
Overall it looks great but hoping my gripes get addressed. I am playing on pimax 5k+ vive wands atm but may buy index controllers . game looks super shiny btw.

This, Lone Echo and the Climb are absolute masterpieces, and this one is a masterpiece among mastepieces. FULLY worth the price. This is agame that would make you think: It was a privilege playing this!

review_title: Best game I have played in VR, period.
one_reviews_text: You can climb ladders/stairs or simply grab a handle and teleport up/down. Melee combat feels really good. Good weapon types/skills variation. Love the throwing axe. You can throw stuff (food, potions, etc...) to your companions and they will catch it eat it if they need it, if not, they will throw it back at you for you to catch. Lots of crafting, mini games, quests/side quest. Lots of weapon slots on your character so you can actually have a shield, a bow, a sword and a dagger at the same time equipped. Just have to reach for each weapon location (hip, back etc...) and grab them.

Thank Oculus for sponsoring good vr-games. Nothing like all that early access crap on steam. My favorite so far besides Lone Echo.

Graphics, Sound and Tutorial for Controls all top notch and runs great on 6700k and 1080Ti.

This is the first game I can say getting VR kit was worth it.  Up to this point every game I've played felt like a beta or just a port of games from other platform.  Even Robo Recall didn't do it for me.  This feels like God of War PS4 in VR.  Muisc, graphics, voices, and atomsphere are great! 40$ is a great deal for a AAA VR 30-40 hrs single player experience
I'm impressed. After using PCVR for three years this is finally the game I was waiting for! A highly polished action RPG with a good combat system, a good story and made specifically for VR. Play it!
